<b>לפי שאין בקיאין לשמה—Since they are not well versed</b> in the requirement <b>of לשמה</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבה states that the reason the חכמים require a שליח ממדה"י to say בפ"נ is because the people of מדה"י are not בקי in the requirement of לשמה. There are many requirements in הלכות גיטין, and תוספות wonders why is it that they are not בקי (only) in לשמה, but are בקי in all other הלכות גיטין. It is also necessary to understand how saying בפ"נ assures us that it was written לשמה.<br>--------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי שנא לשמה דאין בקיאין משאר הלכות גיטין –<br>And if you will say; why is</b> the requirement<b></b> of <b>לשמה different</b> (from all other requirements of writing a גט) <b>that</b> the people <b>are not well versed</b> in this requirement <b>more than the other laws of גיטין,</b> that people are aware of –<br><b>כגון מחובר ושינה שמו ושמה ונכתב ביום ונחתם בלילה –<br>for instance;</b> the הלכות that these following גיטין are פסול: if the גט was written while it was <b>attached</b> to the ground<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה דף כא,ב.</i>; i.e. it was written on a leaf of a tree, <b>or if he changed</b> the husband’s <b>name or</b> the wife’s <b>name<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה דף פ,א. See there also תוס' ד"ה שינה, who interprets שינה וכו' to mean that s/he was called with different names in different places, and only one name was written עיי"ש. </i></b> in the גט and did not write the correct names, <b>or if the</b> גט <b>was written in the daytime, and the</b> witnesses <b>signed it</b> the following <b>night<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה יז,א.</i>.</b> In all these cases the גט is פסול. However we do not mention that the reason the שליח says בפ"נ is to assure us that none of the above happened. Seemingly because we assume that whoever is involved in the writing of the גט is aware of all these פסולים. Why would they not be aware of the פסול of שלא לשמה as well<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In fact, since the requirement of לשמה is an active and positive requirement in every גט, it would seem that everyone would be aware of it, much more than the other פסולין mentioned in תוספות, where no active requirement exists (i.e. no one usually writes a גט במחובר, that people should be aware that there even is an issue).</i>?<br>תוספות will now present a possible resolution to this question and refute it:<br><b>ואין לומר דנקט לשמה דשכיח טפי –<br>And one cannot say</b> that the reason רבה <b>mentions</b> that we are concerned that it was not written <b>לשמה</b> is because <b>it is more common</b> than the other פסולים mentioned above, for it may be likely –<br><b>דמשכח גט ששמו כשמו ושמה כשמה ומשדר לה –<br>that</b> a husband who wishes to divorce his wife <b>may find</b> a written <b>גט</b> that a stranger wrote to divorce his wife <b>whose name</b> of the husband in the גט is <b>the same as his name,</b> and the woman’s <b>name is the same as</b> his wife’s <b>name and he will send</b> this גט <b>to</b> his wife, without even going to a scribe, who would be aware that this גט is פסול –<br><b>וגם הסופר שרגיל לכתוב טופסי גיטין אגב שיטפיה מישתלי וכתב שמו ושמה –<br>And in addition</b> even if the husband will go to a scribe<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">We may assume that the scribe will be בקי in the requirement of לשמה, as opposed to the populace at large.</i> for the גט, it is possible that the <b>סופר who is accustomed to write the</b> blank <b>forms of גיטין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה דף כו,א, that a סופר may prepare in advance the forms of גיטין provided that he leaves out the pertinent לשמה information which is filled in at the time of the נתינת הגט.</i>;</b><br><b>On account of his routine he may</b> inadvertently <b>forget and he will write</b> this particulars husband’s and wife’s <b>names</b> filling in their names in the form (for practice)<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps he heard that there is strife in their marriage.</i><b>.</b> When the husband will come to this סופר to write a גט for him, the סופר may give him this finished גט, not realizing that he wrote it שלא לשמה. Therefore this problem of שלא לשמה is more likely than those that תוספות mentioned previously, and therefore that is why רבה mentioned just his problem. However in truth –<br><b>והוא הדין שאר הלכות גיטין –<br>The same holds true for all the rest of the laws of גיטין,</b> that the<b></b> people of חו"ל are not בקי in them as well. Therefore, when the שליח states בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם, he is testifying the גט is כשר in all respects, not only was it written לשמה, but also all the הלכות of גיטין, including those mentioned by תוספות previously, were strictly adhered to.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 4.</i> This would seem to answer תוספות question; that there is no difference in the knowledge of the laws between לשמה and the other הלכות גיטין, it is just that it is more likely that a גט may written שלא לשמה, than other violations; therefore רבה mentioned שאין בקיאין לשמה.<br>תוספות refutes this answer:<br><b>זה אינו דהא אמר לקמן (דף ט,ב) בג' דרכים שוו גיטי נשים לשחרורי עבדים<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא (ט,א) enumerates the three similarities: a) שוו למוליך ולמביא, that there is a requirement to say בפ"נ ובפ"נ, b) an עד  כותי is כשר only by גיטי נשים ושחרורי עבדים, and c) that ערכאות are פסול.</i> –<br>This is not so</b>, we cannot say that רבה was concerned about all הלכות גיטין and the testimony of בפ"נ ובפ"נ validates that all הלכות were adhered to, <b>because later</b> the גמרא <b>quotes</b> a ברייתא which <b>says: that גיטי נשים are similar to the</b> שטרות that are used to <b>set</b> <b>free עבדים</b> כנענים, <b>in three ways –<br>ופריך והא איכא לשמה –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>asks</b> on the ברייתא: <b>but there is</b> the requirement that both these שטרות have to be written <b>לשמה.</b> There is a fourth similarity between<b></b> גיטי נשים and שחרורי עבדים, why does the ברייתא state only three?! The גמרא continues:<br><b>בשלמא לרבה היינו מוליך ומביא –<br>It is understood, according to רבה,</b> why the ברייתא did not mention לשמה, <b>because</b> לשמה is <b>the same as מוליך ומביא</b> which the ברייתא did mention. מוליך ומביא is the requirement to say בפ"נ ובפ"נ both by גיטי נשים ושחרורי עבדים, when they are sent from either חו"ל לא"י or from א"י לחו"ל<b>.</b> Therefore according to רבה the ברייתא could not have said both לשמה and מוליך ומביא, since the whole חיוב to say בפ"נ by מוליך ומביא is on account of לשמה, therefore לשמה and מוליך ומביא are identical.<b><br>אלא לרבא קשיא –<br>However according to רבא it is not understood</b> why the ברייתא did not mention לשמה, since, according to רבא the saying of בפ"נ by מוליך ומביא is on account of קיום, and has no connection to לשמה. The גמרא continues with another question on the ברייתא:<br><b>ותו בין לרבה ובין לרבא הא איכא מחובר –<br>And furthermore according to both רבה and רבא there is</b> the פסול of writing the שטר while it is <b>attached</b> to the ground, which applies both to גיטי נשים ושחרורי עבדים, so why does not the ברייתא mention it. This concludes the quote from the גמרא. From this dialogue we see that the previous contention that saying בפ"נ validates all הלכות גיטין including לשמה and מחובר etc. is incorrect, as תוספות continues –<br><b>אלמא לרבה דוקא נקט לשמה בכלל מוליך ומביא ולא נקט מחובר –<br>It is evident that</b> according <b>to רבה, only</b> the requirement of <b>לשמה is mentioned</b> in the גמרא <b>as being included in מוליך ומביא</b>, and therefore the ברייתא could not mention לשמה as an additional similarity because the requirement of לשמה and the saying of בפ"נ by מוליך ומביא are identical, <b>however מחובר is not mentioned</b> to be included in מוליך ומביא as לשמה is, as is evidenced by the fact that according to רבה there is no question why the ברייתא does not mention לשמה (because it is included in מוליך ומביא) but there is a question why the ברייתא does not mention מחובר, so obviously it is not included in מוליך ומביא. This proves conclusively that the בפ"נ only comes to validate that the גט was written לשמה and not the other הלכות גיטין. Therefore תוספות original question remains; why is it that they are בקי in all other דינים, but they are not בקי in the דין of לשמה.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 5.</i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ומפרש רבינו תם דבכל הלכות גיטין בקיאין –<br>The ר"ת explains that</b> the people of חוץ לארץ <b>are בקי in all of הלכות גיטין,</b> including<b></b> the הלכות of לשמה –<br><b>אלא דהך דרשא דוכתב לה לשמה אינה נראית להם עיקר דרשה –<br>however this דרשא</b> that the חכמים derive from <b>what</b> the תורה writes <b>וכתב לה ‘He should write for her’</b> which the חכמים interpret the word <b>'לה'</b> to mean <b>לשמה ‘for her sake’</b> that the גט must be written – specifically<b></b> for her sake<b>;</b> this דרשא <b>does not appear to</b> the people of חו"ל as being <b>the substantive <sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not explain why it was only this דרשה that the people of חו"ל did not accept as opposed to other דרשות (מחובר for instance). תוספות was bothered why they were ignorant of לשמה, however תוספות accepts the fact that they rejected only the דרשה of לשמה. A possible explanation: ignorance is by definition not a conscious decision, therefore תוספות wonders how is it that all other laws they know and not this law of לשמה (see footnote # 5). However we can accept the fact that they made a conscious (but wrongful) decision as to the status of the דרשה of לשמה.  </i>דרשה</b> of the word 'לה'<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">They may feel that this word is coming to teach us something else.</i>.<br>This interpretation that the people of חו"ל know the דין of לשמה, it is just that they somehow feel that it is not a correct דרשה, seems to contradict that which the גמרא says, namely; that the people of חו"ל are אין בקיאין לשמה, they are not aware of the דין of לשמה. תוספות therefore continues:<br><b>ואין בקיאין פירוש אין חוששין לדרשה דלשמה –<br>And</b> the phrase <b>'אין בקיאין'</b> – ‘<b>they are not</b> 'well <b>versed</b>’, <b>is to be understood to mean that ‘they dismiss the דרשה of לשמה’<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Once they did not take this דרשה seriously, after a while they may have become less aware of its הלכות, therefore in reality they may have been actually אין בקיאין לשמה.</i>.</b><br>תוספות anticipates another question on this interpretation that אין בקיאין means אין חוששין:<b><br>ולאחר שלמדו דלקמן –</b> <sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">דף ה,א.</i><br><b>And</b> concerning that which the גמרא says <b>later,</b> that we are discussing<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there is discussing the case of a שליח who was a פקח שנתחרש; that קיום is sufficient, without saying בפ"נ. This presents a problem according to רבה. The גמרא answers that this case occurred לאחר שלמדו, so there is no more concern for שלא לשמה.</i> a time period <b>after</b> the people of חו"ל <b>learnt</b> the דין of לשמה; this would seemingly indicate that prior to this time of 'לאחר שלמדו'; the people did not yet learn or know the דין of לשמה. This is in contradiction to the פירוש ר"ת. תוספות answers:<br><b>פירוש לאחר שקיבלוה –<br>The meaning</b> of לאחר שלמדו is not to be understood in its literal sense, but rather <b>after they accepted</b> the דרשה of 'לה לשמה'.<br>Now that we know what the meaning of אין בקיאין לשמה is, תוספות will now discuss how the statement of בפ"נ ובפ"נ resolves this concern, for seemingly the שליח makes no mention of לשמה in his statement.<br><b>והא דפירש הקונטרס דממילא שיילינן ליה אי הוי לשמה ואמר אין –<br>And that which רש"י explains</b> concerning this question; how do we know that it was written לשמה; <b>that inevitably we ask</b> the שליח, once he says בפ"נ that he was present at the writing of the גט, <b>whether it was</b> written <b>לשמה and</b> the שליח <b>says ‘yes’,</b> that it was written לשמה.<br>תוספות argues that this interpretation is –<br><b>אין נראה דלא משתמיט בשום דוכתא שיהא צריך לישאל –<br>not plausible<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">Were we to say that the people of חו"ל (including the שליח) are not בקי in the הלכות גיטין in general, then we may be forced to accept sרש"י' explanation that we ask the שליח if it was written לשמה (and any other concerns we may have), for we cannot say that the שליח is testifying that all is well, since they do not know הלכות גיטין. It is not logical to assume that בפ"נ ובפ"נ means בסתם that all the דינים were adhered to. Once we accept תוספות interpretation that they are בקי in all הלכות גיטין (including לשמה), they are just not חושש on this one דין of לשמה, then the שליח understands that the purpose of having him say בפ"נ is to assure us that it was written לשמה, and as תוספות concludes סתמא לשמה קא מסהיד. See מהרש"א הארוך.</i> for we do not find it mentioned anywhere that</b> בי"ד <b>is required to ask</b> the שליח if it was written לשמה –<br>תוספות asks an additional question on פירש"י:<br><b>ועוד דאם כן לימא איכא בינייהו אם צריך לישאל –<br>And furthermore, that if this is so</b> as רש"י claims that we ask the שליח if it was written לשמה, <b>let</b> the גמרא <b>say ‘that there is</b> another <b>difference between</b> רבה and רבה’, namely <b>if it is required to ask</b> anything additional of the שליח, after he testifies that בפ"נ ובפ"נ. According to רבא this is sufficient to be מקיים the גט; according to רבה however, we are required to ask the שליח if it was written לשמה. Since the גמרא does not mention this difference, that proves that there is no difference, and even according to רבה, saying בפ"נ is sufficient. The question remains how through his testimony of בפ"נ do we know that it was written לשמה?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דסתמא לשמה קא מסהיד<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The שליח who delivers the גט and has to testify בפ"נ is presumably called to the סופר where the גט is being written and is told to observe all that transpires so that he will be able to testify that he himself saw that it was written and signed properly. This alerts the שליח that he is required to make sure that it is being written לשמה, a requirement they knew about, but were not scrupulously following. His subsequent testimony of בפ"נ assures us that he is testifying that it was certainly written לשמה (that the husband did not find a גט ששמו כשמו nor did the סופר write their names while he was writing טופסי גיטין etc.). </i> –<br>The ר"י says that it is assumable that his testimony</b> of בפ"נ <b>is regarding</b> that it was written <b>לשמה.</b><br><b>כדפירש בקונטרס נמי בסמוך (דף ג,א ד"ה לא גייז)-<br>as רש"י also explains it</b> in this manner <b>further</b> in the גמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">This is according to the second interpretation there in רש"י [which states: סתמא (לשמה) קא מסהיד].</i><b>.</b><br>תוספות continues to ask:<br><b>והא דאמר לקמן מי קתני בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם לשמה –<br>And</b> concerning <b>that</b> which the גמרא <b>says later on<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">לקמן ג,א.</i></b> why רבא does not agree with רבה that the reason for saying בפ"נ is on account of אין בקיאין לשמה, for that cannot be the reason, for <b>does the</b> משנה <b>teach us</b> that the שליח is requires to say: <b>בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם לשמה,</b> and since there is no requirement to add the word לשמה that proves that לשמה is not the reason for saying בפ"נ. This is sרבא' refutation of רבה. If however we understand that סתמא לשמה קא מסהיד, as תוספות just told us, how are we to understand sרבא' refutation. There seemingly is no need to add the word לשמה since סתמא לשמה קא מסהיד.<br>תוספות replies, that the refutation of רבא should be understood as follows:<br><b>נהי דסתמא לשמה משמע-<br>Granted that it is assumable that he is testifying</b> that the גט was done <b>לשמה</b><br><b>מכל מקום כיון דעיקר תקנה משום לשמה הוא הוה ליה למימר בהדיא –<br>Nevertheless</b> it is not sufficient to assume that לשמה קא מסהיד, because <b>since</b> (according to רבה) <b>the main תקנה</b> for saying בפ"נ <b>is on account of לשמה, the</b> שליח <b>should</b> be required <b>to say it outright</b>, so everyone will know without a doubt that it was done לשמה, and not to merely assume that it was done לשמה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The meaning of אין בקיאין לשמה is that the בני חו"ל in spite of knowing that there is a requirement that a גט be written לשמה, as derived from the פסוק וכתב לה – לשמה, nevertheless they did not take it seriously. The חכמים were therefore מתקן that one who brings a גט ממדה"י must testify בפ"נ ובפ"נ, which is assumed to mean that it was נכתב ונחתם לשמה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According to the מסקנא is the פסול of שלא לשמה more apt to happen than the other פסולי גיטין?<br>2. Are all the סופרים in חו"ל בקי in לשמה?<br>3. How are לשמה and מוליך ומביא ‘identical’ according to רבה, and how are they ‘different’?<br>4. תוספות initially proposed to answer that the בני חו"ל are not בקי in all the דינים, and the reason he mentions לשמה is because לשמה is more שכיח than the others, but בפ"נ really is removing all the concerns.<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9. </i> Why does not תוספות merely say that the פסול of לשמה is more שכיח, therefore the רבנן were concerned to prevent it, however the other פסולים happen so infrequently, that the רבנן saw no need to address them?! This would also resolve the difficulty from the ברייתא of מוליך ומביא which תוספות cites.<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See כוכבא דשביט.</i><br>5. תוספות proves that the חשש is only on account of לשמה from the גמרא later (on ט,ב);<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> indicating that we are assuming that which the גמרא concludes (here) that סתם ספרי דדייני מיגמר גמירי.<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Otherwise what is תוספות proof, for perhaps (certainly) that גמרא is only according to the מסקנא.</i> If we assume that ספרי דדייני are גמירי, then what is תוספות question that why are we not concerned about מחובר, etc., since the ספרי are גמירי, the only concern is for לשמה that perhaps he found a גט which was שמו כשמו וכו', but there can be no concern of מחובר,etc.!<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See פנ"י and בל"י אות כ.</i>
<b>לפי שאין בקיאין לשמה—Because they are not well versed</b> in the requirement <b>of לשמה</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>It would seem from the גמרא that רבה is of the opinion that the בני חו"ל, are not בקיאין לשמה and therefore we are (seriously) concerned that this גט from חו"ל may not be written לשמה. Our תוספות quotes a ברייתא that will disprove this concern.<br>--------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>קשה דלקמן (דף ה,א) תניא הוא עצמו שהביא גיטו –<br>There is a difficulty; for later</b> in the גמרא there is a <b>ברייתא which states, ‘if</b> the husband <b>himself brought his גט</b> for his<b></b> wife from חו"ל<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גט was written in חו"ל and the husband brought it to א"י to divorce his wife.</i> and intends to divorce her now –<br><b>אינו צריך שיאמר בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם-<br>He is not required to say בפ"נ ובפ"נ’.</b> This concludes the citation from the ברייתא. תוספות asks:<br><b>מאי שנא הוא משלוחו אי חיישינן שמא לא נעשה לשמה –<br>How is he different than if his שליח</b> brought the גט, <b>if we are concerned that perhaps the גט was not prepared לשמה?!</b> In either case, whether it is the שליח who brings the גט or the husband, they should both be required to say בפ"נ to assure us that the גט was written לשמה, since our concern is שאין בקיאין לשמה.<br>תוספות offers a possible solution and rejects it;<br><b>וטעמא דאמר לקמן מינקט נקט ליה בידיה ואיהו מערער עלויה –<br>And the reason which</b> the גמרא <b>says later</b>, concerning this very ברייתא; why does not the husband have to say בפ"נ if he himself brought the גט from מדה"י, because since <b>he is holding</b> the גט <b>in his own hand</b>, which obviously tells us that he wants to divorce his wife, will <b>he come</b> later <b>to contest this</b> גט!<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The husband seemingly would look foolish if he contests the very גט that he himself gave to his wife.</i> Therefore the גמרא concludes that if the בעל himself brings the גט from מדה"י he is not required to say בפ"נ, because he will not be מערער later. This seems to be the same issue which תוספות is raising, and the גמרא answers it as just stated.<br>תוספות is not satisfied with this explanation and תוספות asks:<br><b>למה לא יערער אם מתחילה לא ידע דבעי לשמה והשתא ידע –<br>Why should he not contest</b> the validity of the גט <b>if originally he did not know the requirement of <sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i>לשמה, and now he knows,</b> and he realizes that there is no גט?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">He will be מערער either because he is an honest man and does not want his wife to be עובר on the איסור אשת איש, since she is not divorced, or because he actually changed his mind and wants to return to his wife, etc.</i> The question remains why if the בעל himself brings the גט, is he exempt from saying בפ"נ?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דמסקינן בסמוך דרוב בקיאין הן וסתם ספרי גמירי –<br>The ר"י says that the</b> גמרא <b>shortly concludes<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">דף ב,ב בסופו.</i> that most</b> people <b>are aware</b> of the לשמה requirement <b>and it is assumable that the scribes are knowledgeable</b> in the לשמה requirement, therefore it is highly unlikely that the גט was written שלא לשמה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote"> Since רוב בקיאין הן we can safely assume that the husband will not give her a גט that he found, in which it was שמו כשמו ושמה כשמה, and likewise it is not probable that the סופר will give them a גט that was not written לשמה. See previous תוס' ד"ה לפי (הא').  </i>. If this is the case, then why according to רבה must one say בפ"נ since there is no real חשש of שלא לשמה? תוספות continues:<br><b>וליכא אלא לעז בעלמא דמסתמא שלא כדין יערער –<br>And the only concern is of loose gossip<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' ב,ב ד"ה ורבנן, ודף ג,א ד"ה חד.</i></b>. In the event that the husband will claim that it was written שלא לשמה, people will gossip that she is still an אשת איש. However we are not concerned that it is really a גט פסול, <b>for presumably his contention will be unjustified,</b> for as we just said there is no real חשש of שלא לשמה, only לעז.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why we are concerned that the בעל will be מערער is since he did not give the גט directly to his wife, for he sent it with a שליח. At that point the בעל may have not realized the finality of his action, that he is divorcing his wife. He may think that he could still change his mind later. When it finally dawns on him that he is no longer married, he may reconsider and attempt to regain his wife by claiming (falsely) that it was not written לשמה, and she is legally still married to him. We are not seriously concerned that his ערעור is actually true, for as mentioned רוב בקיאין הן וסתם ספרי גמירי. We are concerned however that people will gossip concerning this woman and any future children she may have from another man, and say that her divorce was in doubt, and the status of her children is questionable. Therefore the שליח says בפ"נ to remove all doubt and allegations made by the husband. <br></i><br><b>והכא שמביאו הבעל בעצמו ליכא למיחש אפילו ללעז דתו לא מערער –<br>However here</b> in the case <b>where the husband himself brings</b> the גט, <b>there is no need to be concerned even for לעז, for he will not pursue to be מערער</b> on this גט –<br><b>כדאמר בסמוך מנקט נקיט בידיה וכולי –<br>as</b> the גמרא <b>will shortly say, ‘he</b> himself <b>is holding</b> the גט <b>in his hand etc.,</b> will he be contentious about it!’<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">In this case the husband himself is giving the גט to his wife. There is no doubt as to the finality of this matter. His mind is made up. The husband has no intention at all of staying married to this woman. He will presumably never come to contest this גט in an attempt to win his wife back. Therefore there is no need to say בפ"נ, for we are not concerned neither that it was שלא לשמה (because רוב בקיאין וכו') and not for לעז.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is no real חשש of שלא לשמה, since רוב בקיאין and סתם ספרי גמירי, we are only concerned that the בעל, who sent the גט through a שליח, may reconsider and want to invalidate the גט by claiming that it was not written לשמה, and even though we will not accept his claim, nevertheless there will be a הוצאת לעז on this women and the subsequent children she may bear, therefore the חכמים were מתקן to say בפ"נ to prevent this לעז.<br>On the occasion that the בעל himself brought the גט and is personally giving it to his wife there is no concern that he will reconsider and want to be מערער on this גט. Therefore there is no need for him to say בפ"נ.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does תוספות ask his question here? It would seem more logical to ask the question later when the גמרא teaches us the דין of הוא עצמו שהביא גיטו.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See תפארת יעקב.</i><br>2. Why does תוספות limit his question on the statement מינקט נקיט ליה בידיה וכו', that he will still be מערער,<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> when the question seemingly should be, even if he is not מערער, but we – בי"ד – have to verify that it was written לשמה?<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם שי"ף, סוכת דוד and אמ"ה # 119.</i><br>3. Why if the בעל claims with definiteness that the גט was written שלא לשמה, do we not believe him; he is a ודאי and we are seemingly a ספק?

Line 3

<b>מאי בינייהו—What is the difference between them</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asks what are the practical differences between רבה who gives the reason for saying בפ"נ, because אין בקיאין לשמה, as opposed to רבא who gives the reason of אין עדים מצויין לקיימו. The גמרא offers three differences. תוספות will ask that there are seemingly two additional obvious differences between רבה ורבא that the גמרא does not mention, תוספות will explain why the גמרא does not mention these differences.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates the following questions:<br><b>לא מצי למימר מוליך איכא בינייהו –</b><br>The גמרא <b>could not have said</b> that <b>there is</b> a difference <b>between</b> רבה and רבא in regards to one <b>who brings</b> a גט from א"י to חו"ל; according to רבה who says that the reason for saying בפ"נ is because the people of חו"ל are not בקיאין לשמה, then it is understood that if one brings a גט from א"י where the people are בקיאין לשמה there is no need to say בפ"נ, according to רבא however who says the reason for saying בפ"נ is because אין עדים מצויין לקיימו, then it makes no difference if the גט is brought from חו"ל to א"י or vice versa, in all cases there are no <sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">People do not travel frequently from א"י לחו"ל nor from חו"ל לא"י.</i>עדים מצויין לקיימו, and one would need to say בפ"נ. This seemingly would be a נפק"מ between רבה and רבא.<br>תוספות will now explain why the גמרא does not state this נפק"מ:<br><b>דלרבה נמי לרבנן בתראי מוליך צריך לומר בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם –<br>For the view of רבה</b> is <b>also that according to last רבנן</b> in our משנה in regard to <b>מוליך</b> מא"י לחו"ל one is <b>required to say בפ"נ ובפ"נ,</b> as<b></b> stated clearly in the <sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">וחכ"א אין צריך שיאמר בפ"נ ובפ"נ אלא המביא וכו' והמוליך וכו'.</i>משנה<b>.</b> The<b></b> reason for this is –<br><b>דגזרינן מוליך אטו מביא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>For</b> the חכמים <b>were גוזר</b> that <b>מוליך</b> has to say<b></b> בפ"נ <b>on account of מביא</b> מחו"ל לא"י. The גזירה is that if we would not require מוליך to say בפ"נ, people would mistakenly conclude that מביא also does not have to say בפ"נ. Therefore both רבה and רבא agree that according to the רבנן בתראי of our משנה, מוליך has to say בפ"נ. There is no difference between רבה ורבא in the case of מוליך according to the רבנן בתראי of our משנה.<br>תוספות will now explain why even according to the ת"ק who does not state whether מביא is required to say בפ"נ, the גמרא still does not state specifically that this depends on the מחלוקת between רבה and רבא, even though according to the ת"ק there is a difference by מוליך between רבה ורבא:<br><b>ולתנא קמא נמי הוי בכלל הא דאמר איכא בינייהו ממדינה למדינה בארץ ישראל –<br>And</b> even <b>according to the ת"ק also,</b> the גמרא does not say that the difference between רבה ורבא is in a case of מוליך, because this difference that there is between them by מוליך <b>is already included in</b> one of the differences <b>that the</b> גמרא already <b>said</b>, namely <b>there is</b> a difference <b>between</b> רבה ורבא in a case were one brought a גט <b>from a מדינה למדינה in א"י</b> itself. According to רבה there is no need to say בפ"נ because the בני א"י are בקיאין לשמה, and according to רבא there is a requirement to say בפ"נ because אין עדים מצויין לקיימו. The exact same מחלוקת, with the same reasoning will be by המביא גט מא"י לחו"ל, therefore there is no need for the גמרא to repeat it.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i><br>תוספות has another question concerning the נפק"מ between רבה ורבא:<br><b>והא דלא קאמר גט מקויים<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות may mean that it is being מקויים now in א"י (for if it was מקויים in חו"ל the שליח would still be required to say בפ"נ to insure that the קיום is not forged [See אמ"ה # 126]).</i> איכא בינייהו –<br>And</b> the reason why the גמרא <b>did not say that there is</b> a difference <b>between</b> רבה ורבא in a case where the <b>גט</b> was already <b>מקויים</b> when it was brought ממדה"י; according to רבה, one must say בפ"נ, because אין בקיאין לשמה, however according to רבא there is no need to say בפ"נ, since it is already מקויים.<br>תוספות answers that the reason the גמרא did not say this נפק"מ is –<br><b>משום דהוי בכלל דאתיוה בי תרי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3. </i> דדמי למקויים - <sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 4.</i></b><br><b>because it is</b> already <b>included</b> in another נפק"מ that the גמרא stated, namely <b>when two</b> שלוחים <b>brought</b> the גט ממדה"י. This case of אתיוה בי תרי <b>is similar to</b> the case of <b>מקויים,</b> which תוספות is now discussing. Regarding אתיוהו בי תרי, according to רבה, one must say בפ"נ, because אין בקיאין לשמה, however according to רבא there is no need to say בפ"נ, since these two שלוחים testify that the husband sent them with this גט, the husband will not be able to be מערער<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See next תוספות ד"ה דאתיוה.</i> that he did not send this גט. The same argument that רבה ורבא have concerning אתיוה בי תרי applies to גט מקויים; according to רבה, one must say בפ"נ, because אין בקיאין לשמה, however according to רבא there is no need to say בפ"נ, since the גט is מקויים the husband will not be able to be מערער that he did not send this גט. Therefore the גמרא does not say this נפק"מ of גט מקויים, because it is included in the נפק"מ of אתיוה בי תרי.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא did not mention מוליך מא"י לחו"ל as an איכא בינייהו, since according to the רבנן בתראי all agree that בפ"נ is required (גזירה מוליך אטו מביא), and according to the ת"ק the א"ב of מוליך is included in the א"ב of ממדינה למדינה בא"י. The גמרא did not either mention the א"ב by a גט מקוים, because it is included in the א"ב of אתיוהו בי תרי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does the גמרא choose the נפק"מ of ממדינה למדינה בא"י,<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> rather than המוליך מא"י לחו"ל?<br>2. Why does תוספות find it necessary to tell us the reason<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> why the רבנן בתראי maintain that מוליך is required to say בפ"נ?<br>3. Why does the גמרא choose the נפק"מ of אתיוה בי תרי<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> as opposed to the נפק"מ of גט מקויים?<br>4. Why does תוספות add the phrase דדמי למקוים at the end of תוספות<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> as opposed to the case of מוליך where תוספות just says דהוי בכלל ממדינה למדינה בא"י?
<b>דאתיוה בי תרי —</b> גט<b>That two people brought</b> the<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא states that if two people were שלוחים to bring a גט ממדה"י, according to רבא they are not required to say בפ"נ. Our תוספות will discuss the reason why they are not required to say בפ"נ.<br>------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס למאן דאמר לפי שאין עדים מצויין לקיימו אלו יקיימוהו –<br>רש"י explains</b> that <b>according to the one</b> (רבא) <b>who maintains</b> that the reason we say בפ"נ is <b>because</b> <b>אין עדים מצויין לקיימו,</b> then it is not necessary to say בפ"נ because <b>these</b> two people who brought the גט, and seemingly would be familiar with the witnesses<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over # 1.</i> who signed the גט, they <b>will be מקיים</b> the עדי הגט, and since the purpose of saying בפ"נ is to assure us of קיום עדי הגט, in this case בפ"נ is not necessary.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">However according to רבה who maintains the reason for saying בפ"נ is because we are concerned that it was not written לשמה , then (even) if two people bring the גט, they are required to say בפ"נ.</i><br>תוספות has difficulties with this interpretation.<br><b>וקשה דאטו בכיפא תלו להו שיהו מזומנין לקיימו כשיבא הבעל ויערער –<br>And it is difficult</b> to understand this interpretation. <b>Are we indeed going to hold</b> these two שלוחים <b>in a cell so that they can be at the ready to be מקיים</b> the גט <b>when the husband will come and contest</b> the validity of this גט?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The purpose of saying בפ"נ (according to רבא) is that in case the בעל will come later and be מערער on the גט, the woman will not have to search for עדי קיום, because the שליח by saying בפ"נ was already מקיים the גט. In this case we are saying that if two people brought the גט they do not have to say בפ"נ, because if the בעל will come later and be מערער, they will be available to be מקיים the גט. תוספות asks: who can guarantee that these two people will be here when the בעל is מערער; we are obviously not going to sequester them till the בעל comes and is מערער!<br></i><br>תוספות has an additional question:<br><b>ועוד דלמה לי דאתיוה בי תרי-<br>And furthermore why is it necessary</b> to present this difference (between רבה and רבא) in a case <b>where two people brought</b> the גט (which may be somewhat unusual)<br><b>כך שוים שנים מן השוק שמכירין חתימת העדים –<br>It would be the same if</b> there are <b>two</b> people (not שלוחים) <b>from the street that recognize the signatures of the witnesses;</b> in that case there would also be no reason (according to רבא) to say בפ"נ, since these people can be מקיים the עדי הגט<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This would seem to be more common than sending a גט with two שלוחים. Also since they are local residents, they would presumably be available for קיום whenever the בעל would be מערער. Therefore let the גמרא say instead, that one of the differences between רבה and רבא is if we know that there are two people who recognize the חתימת העדים; according to רבה it is required to say בפ"נ but not according to רבא. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.  </i>.<br>תוספות offers a different explanation of the גמרא:<br><b>ומפרש רבי יצחק בן אשר דאתיוה בי תרי ואמרי שהבעל שלחם –<br>And the ריב"א explains that two people brought</b> the גט a<b>nd they said that the husband sent them</b> to give this גט to his wife. This is sufficient<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">They do not need to be present at the כתיבת וחתימת הגט, to testify בפ"נ.</i> (according to רבא), for this is tantamount to קיום הגט<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">According to רבה however they would still be required to say בפ"נ, because the fact that the husband sent them does not assure us that it was written לשמה.</i>.<br><b>דתו לא מהימן לומר לא שלחתים-<br>for</b> the husband <b>will not be believed anymore to say ‘I did not send them’</b> and the גט is a forgery made up by someone else, since they say that the husband himself sent them<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore it is not necessary to sequester them, for once they say that the husband sent them, the גט is מקויים and the בעל cannot be מערער anymore.</i>.<br>תוספות bolsters his point by quoting the גמרא:<br><b>דהכי אמר לקמן (דף ה,א) שנים אין צריכין לומר בפני נכתב וכולי –<br>For this is what</b> the גמרא <b>says later, ‘two</b> people who brought a גט ממדה"י <b>are not required to say בפני נכתב, etc.</b> The גמרא gives a reason –<br><b>ומה אלו יאמרו בפנינו גירשה מי לא מהימני –<br>For what</b> would be <b>if they would say that ‘He divorced</b> his wife <b>in our presence’ would they not be believed!</b> Therefore since these two<b></b> people have the power to render the woman a divorcee, we believe them as well when they claim that the husband sent them<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i>.<br>תוספות will now clarify an anticipated objection:<br><b>ולהא לא חיישינן שמא החתים במזיד עדים פסולין<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">They were relatives to each other, for instance, or he simply forged the signatures.</i> –<br>However we are not concerned<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">What good is the testimony of the שלוחים that the husband sent them, since they are not actually being מקיים the גט, and they do not actually know the witnesses (in opposition to the interpretation of רש"י), it may be possible that the husband did indeed give them then גט, but the witnesses on the גט are invalid, and therefore there is no גט.</i></b> that <b>perhaps</b> the husband <b>intentionally signed</b> on the גט <b>invalid witnesses.</b><br>תוספות answers that this is of no concern:<br><b>דמסתמא כיון דשלח לה גט כדין עשאו ואינו חשוד להכשילה –<br>For presumably since he sent her a גט,</b> and this we know from the שלוחים who testify that he sent her a גט, therefore we may assume <b>that he made</b> the גט <b>properly, for he is not suspect to purposely harm her.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">Our concern according to רבא is only that perhaps the husband (will claim that he) did not actually send this גט to his wife. This concern is addressed by the fact that the שלוחים testify that he did indeed send them. However, we do not suspect that a man would want to ruin his wife’s life by sending her a false גט and having her marry while she is still an אשת איש.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רש"י states that two שלוחים are not required to say בפ"נ according to רבא, because they themselves could be מקיים the גט.<br>תוספות raises two objections; a) How can we be sure that the שלוחים will be here when the בעל is מערער; and b) The גמרא should state that if there are two witnesses in the area who are familiar with the signatures there is no need for בפ"נ.<br>תוספות explains the גמרא to mean that if they are two שלוחים, all that is required of them is to say that the husband sent them, and that would be in place of בפ"נ. תוספות concludes that we are never concerned that the husband will willfully send a גט פסול to harm his wife.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does רש"י assume<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> that the שלוחים know the חתימת העדים?<br>2. Why is it necessary for the גמרא to give a reason, that the שלוחים are believed because of a מיגו<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i>; they should be believed because they are עדים!<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכת דוד אות עג and , בית לחם יהודה.</i><br>3. Why does the second question on רש"י,<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> pose no problem to the ריב"א?

Line 4



Line 5

<b>ליבעי תרי—Let us require two</b> witnesses<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asks; according to רבה who is concerned that the גט was written שלא לשמה, since the בני חו"ל are not בקיאין לשמה, we should require that two עדים testify that this גט was written לשמה and only then to permit the woman to get married. However we have already learnt in a previous <sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">(תוספות ד"ה לפי (הב'</i>תוספות that there is no real concern of שלא לשמה, only a concern of הוצאת לעז, why does the גמרא require two witnesses.<br>-----------------------<br><b>אכתי לא ידע הא דפרישית דלא הוי טעמא אלא משום לעז עד לבסוף:</b><br><b>The</b> גמרא <b>did not know at this point</b> (of questioning that we should require two witnesses) <b>that which I previously<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות ד"ה לפי (הב')</i> explained that the reason</b> for saying בפ"נ on account of אין בקיאין לשמה <b>is not</b> that we actually are concerned that the גט was written שלא לשמה, <b>but rather</b> we are concerned <b>only on account of false gossip;</b> the גמרא did not know this <b>until the end</b> of the סוגיא, when the גמרא realizes that there is no real concern of <sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Since רוב בקיאין וסתם ספרי גמירי.</i>שלא לשמה only of לעז that if the husband will claim that it was not written לשמה people will gossip about this woman and any children she may bear in the future.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If the גמרא knew that the only concern is gossip, the גמרא would not ask that we require two witnesses just to dispel rumor and gossip. For this the שליח is sufficient as the גמרא will shortly conclude. At this point the גמרא assumed that there is a real חשש of שלא לשמה, therefore the גמרא demanded that there be two עדים.</i><b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>When the גמרא asks that we should require two עדים, the גמרא thought there is a real חשש of שלא לשמה. Only later was it made clear that there is only a חשש of (ערעור and) הוצאת לעז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It seems obvious (as stated in the previous תוספות referenced here) that only after the גמרא concludes רוב בקיאין הן וסתם ספרי גמירי, do we realize that it is only a חשש of לעז; why does תוספות need to reemphasize it?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See פני יהושע בגמ' ד"ה ולרבה.</i>
<b>מידי דהוה אכל עדיות שבתורה—As is wont to be in all testimony in the Torah</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא contends that we should require two witnesses to confirm that the גט was written לשמה, since that is what is usually required when we need witnesses.<br>The תורה writes<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">דברים (שופטים) יט,טו.</i>: לא יקום עד אחד באיש לכל עון ולכל חטאת וגו' על פי שני עדים וגו' יקום דבר. From the words לכל עון ולכל חטאת we derive that neither a monetary loss, nor a physical punishment can be meted out without the testimony of two עדים. Similarly the Torah writes<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">שם כד,כא.</i> concerning a גט that כי מצא בה ערות דבר. We derive from the גזירה שוה דבר דבר, that also by דיני אישות, such as גיטין וקידושין we require two עדים.<br>However in other matters of איסור והיתר, like כשרות etc. as will be learnt in the גמרא, one עד is נאמן. This is the issue we are discussing here; is this testimony that the גט was written לשמה, similar to those that require two עדים, or those for which one עד suffices.<br>----------------<br><b>בדלי"ת גרסינן –<br>The text should read</b> עדיות <b>with a</b> <b>דלי"ת</b> (referring to testimony),<b></b> not עריות with a רי"ש. The meaning of כל עדיות is –<br><b>כגון עדות דיני ממונות ודיני נפשות –<br>For instance the testimony in monetary matters and in capital punishment matters</b>, in both these instances, two witnesses are required to either compel one to pay, or to punish someone convicted of a capital crime. The גמרא contends that the same standard of two עדים should apply to the testimony in this concern of אין בקיאין לשמה, since it too is a testimony.<br>תוספות presents an alternate גירסא:<br><b>ואית דגרס עריות ברי"ש –<br>And there are those who render the text עריות with a רי"ש,</b> meaning testimony concerning (illicit) marriage relationships, in which two witnesses are (also) required<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Those that prefer this reading of עריות, feel presumably that it is more appropriate to compare the שליח הגט, where we are seemingly dealing with אשת איש issues, to a case of עריות rather than to כל עדיות, which deal with monetary and capital crime issues.</i>.<br><b>ולא נהירא דאם כן מאי משני עד אחד נאמן באיסורין –</b><br>This rendering of the text <b>does not seem correct, for if</b> this reading would be <b>correct (</b>that we are comparing this שליח הגט to a דבר שבערוה)<b>, what</b> does the גמרא <b>answer; that ‘a single witness is to be believed in matters of איסור’</b>, and therefore the שליח is believed as an עד אחד. However the גמרא is not addressing the question –<br><b>והא ערוה נמי איסור הוא –<br>for</b> the laws of <b>ערוה are also</b> laws of <b>איסור,</b> and we require two witnesses, and since this שליח is seemingly testifying concerning a דבר שבערוה which was the contention of the מקשן, we should also require two witnesses<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">According to תוספות גירסא the sגמרא' answer is understood; two עדות are required for דיני ממונות ודיני נפשות, but for איסור והיתר one עדות is sufficient, and here by גט it is a question of איסור והיתר, whether the גט was written לשמה or not.</i>.<br><b>והכי הוה ליה למימר לא דמי לשאר עריות והוה ליה ליתן טעם – <sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is not suggesting which reason the גמרא should have used.</i></b><br><b>And this is the way</b> the גמרא <b>should have responded</b> to the question (that we should require two עדים since it is a דבר שבערוה), that this testimony <b>is not similar to all other cases of עריות and</b> the גמרא should continue <b>and give a reason</b> why this testimony is different than all other עריות, and one עד is sufficient. Had the גמרא answered in this fashion, it may have been acceptable to be גורס אכל עריות. However since the גמרא merely answers עד אחד נאמן באיסורין, that shows that the original question did not deem to compare this testimony to עריות, but rather to compare it to testimony in general, which under certain circumstances (specifically דיני ממונות ודיני נפשות), requires two עדים. The גמרא answers that since this עדות is only concerning איסור and is not like דיני ממונות and דיני נפשות; therefore for איסור one עד is sufficient<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It is only later that the גמרא claims that since איתחזק איסורא דאשת איש, so this is also a דבר שבערוה.</i>.<br>תוספות attempts to justify the גירסא of עריות:<br><b>ומיהו יש לומר דהכי קאמר עד אחד נאמן באיסורין להתיר –<br>However perhaps one can say that this is what</b> the גמרא <b>meant</b> with its answer <b>that an ע"א is נאמן when</b> there is a concern of <b>איסורין –</b> he is believed <i><b>to permit</i> <i></i></b>the איסור<b></b> even by a דבר שבערוה –<br><b>והא דבעי תרי הני מילי לאסור דחד לאו כל כמיניה –<br>And that</b> which is an accepted fact that by a דבר שבערוה, <b>two</b> witnesses <b>are required that was said only</b> in regards <b>to place a prohibition</b>, that is when we require two עדים, because <b>one</b> witness <b>cannot be believed</b> to place a prohibition on a person, who up to this point of testimony was not under this prohibition, therefore we require two עדים to create a איסור; however to remove a suspected איסור, the גמרא says, one עד is sufficient<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">We would need to say that this distinction that תוס' is making between להתיר where one עד is sufficient, and לאסור where two עדים are required, is only concerning cases where there is no established precedence, i.e. no חזקה that is in opposition to the עדות. For instance if one עד would claim that a certain woman is married – and we have no prior knowledge whether she is or is not married, then the עד is not believed לאסור. If he would claim however, concerning this same woman that she is not married, then he would be believed להתיר. However, if there is a contesting חזקה, obviously one עד is not sufficient to be מתיר a known אשת איש, for instance. In our case here, the שליח, who is saying בפ"נ, is merely stating that the גט was written לשמה. There is no חזקה claiming otherwise, therefore at this point the גמרא maintains according to this גירסא, that one עד is sufficient. Later the גמרא claims that since based on his testimony we are permitting her to get married, there is a חזקת איסור of אשת איש contesting the claim of the שליח, and we should require two עדים.</i>.<br>תוספות presents a question of semantics on this גירסא of כל עריות:<br><b>אבל הא דקאמר כל עריות לא אתי שפיר דמאי כל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>However, that</b> which the גמרא says, according to this גירסא, <i><b>all </i>עריות, this is not properly <i></i></b>worded; f<b>or what</b> is the meaning of the word <i><b>כל – all</i></b>. Seemingly the word כל would indicate all עריות that are mentioned in the תורה, but this is not correct, for –<br><b>עיקר דבר שבערוה אין פחות משנים זהו באשת איש בגיטין ובקידושין –<br>The main rule that a דבר שבערוה requires no less than two</b> עדים <b>this is</b> (only) <b>concerning</b> the ערוה of <b>אשת איש concerning גיטין and קידושין,</b> where we require two עדים that it be a valid גיטין or קידושין<br><b>וזנות דאשת איש לאוסרה על בעלה –<br>And</b> also<b></b> establishing <b>the adultery of a married woman</b> requires two עדים, who witnessed the adultery in order <b>to prohibit her from</b> living <b>with her husband<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א הארוך.</i>.</b> However concerning all other עריות we do not find the requirement of אין דבר שבערוה פחות משנים.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">One עד is believed to testify, for instance, that this woman is or is not your sister, etc., thereby permitting or prohibiting a marriage. See נח"מ, בל"י.</i> The question therefore remains why does the גמרא say אכל עריות, the גמרא should have said מידי דהוי אאישות or something similar.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There are two גירסאות in our גמרא; whether we are comparing this שליח הגט to כל עדיות (as תוספות prefers), or to כל עריות. The difficulty with the גירסא כל עריות is, if the גמרא maintained originally that the שליח הגט is comparably with עריות, the proper response should have been that in some way he is different than all עריות, and explain why. The text ע"א נאמן באיסורין is seemingly not appropriate, according to this גירסא, for עריות are also איסורים and (yet) they require two עדים.<br>However תוספות concedes that the גמרא means to say that even in עריות if the purpose is to be מתיר an איסור then even an ע"א is believed, as opposed to creating an איסור, where two עדים are required.<br>Nonetheless one problem remains with this גירסא of כל עריות, namely that the word כל (which means literally all types of עריות), is superfluous, for the requirement of two עדים, by עריות is generally limited to the ערוה of אשת איש, and not the remaining עריות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why according to תוספות גירסא is the word כל, proper.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> Not all עדיות require two, as seen from ע"א נאמן באיסורין?
<b>עד אחד נאמן באיסורין—One witness is believed</b> concerning <b>prohibitive acts</b>.<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>An עד אחד is believed to testify on matters of איסור והיתר. He can testify that this piece of meat is כשר and not נבילה, or whether this מקוה has the proper שיעור or not, etc. There is a qualification to this rule. If there is a חזקת איסור, then (it is questionable<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות ד"ה הוי דבר, quoting the גמרא יבמות פח,א. We will assume that he is not believed.</i> if) an ע"א is [not] believed to contradict the חזקת איסור. Were he to testify regarding a woman, whom we know that she was married, that she is now divorced, we may not accept his testimony. This qualification itself is subsequently qualified. An ע"א can be believed even when he contradicts a חזקת איסור, if he is capable of rectifying and removing the איסור. He can say that he was מפריש תרומה from this grain, even though there is a חזקת איסור טבל on it, nevertheless he is believed to say that he was מפריש תרומה since it is בידו to be מפריש תרומה. In regards to a שליח הגט who says בפ"נ that it was written לשמה, this seems to be the regular case of ע"א נאמן באיסורין, where there is no איתחזק איסורא – we do not assume the גט was written שלא לשמה, and it is not בידו of the שליח\עד to write the גט לשמה.<br>-----------------------<br><b>פירוש הקונטרס שהרי האמינה התורה כל אחד ואחד –<br>רש"י explains;</b> where do we see that ע"א נאמן באיסורין <b>for the תורה believes every individual –<br>על הפרשת תרומה ושחיטה וניקור הגיד וחלב –<br>Concerning separating תרומה, ritual slaughtering</b> of an animal, <b>removal</b> of forbidden sinews (<b>גיד</b> הנשה) and veins, <b>and forbidden fats</b> of an animal. A person, who is invited to a friend’s house to eat, may do so on the say so of the host that the food is kosher, and none of the abovementioned items presents any problem. Even though there are no two witnesses that the host was מפריש תרומה or the meat was נשחט properly etc. We believe the testimony of the single host.<b></b> This proves that ע"א נאמן באיסורין.<br>תוספות comments on sרש"י' explanation:<br><b>ולא היה לו להזכיר הפרשת תרומה ושחיטה דבהנהו נאמן אף על גב דאיתחזק איסורא –</b><br>However, רש"י <b>should not have mentioned תרומה ושחיטה</b> among the items he listed to prove ע"א נאמן באיסורין, <b>for in</b> these two items <b>he is believed even though there is a חזקת איסור</b> originally<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of תרומה; all grains are originally טבל and forbidden to be eaten unless one is מפריש תרומה. In the case of שחיטה, every animal had an איסור אכילה on it while it was alive. The נאמנות of the ע"א in these cases can seemingly outweigh even a חזקת איסור. When the גמרא said ע"א נאמן באיסורין concerning שליח הגט, we meant only where there is no חזקת איסור, as in the case of לשמה, where we cannot say the גט is בחזקת שלא נכתב ונחתם לשמה.    </i> on the food<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Concerning ניקור וחלב however, there is no חזקת איסור on the meat we intend to eat, that it was ever גיד הנשה or חלב. Therefore the עד is believed.</i>. This is highly unusual that an ע"א should be believed when איתחזק איסורא. Therefore we must say the reason why an ע"א is נאמן by תרומה ושחיטה even though that it is איתחזק איסורא, is –<br><b>משום דבידו לתקנם –<br>Because</b> the ע"א <b>has the capability to correct</b> this איסור, by being מפריש תרומה and being שוחט the בהמה –<br><b>כמו שפירש הקונטרס בסמוך והכי אמר בהאשה רבה (יבמות פח,א) –<br>as רש"י will shortly comment<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה הכא איתחזק. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i>. And similarly this is said in</b> פרק <b>האשה רבה.</b> Therefore, this type of ע"א נאמן באיסורין where it is בידו לתקנם has no bearing<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">One may ask that ניקור הגיד is also בידו לתקן, so it too should not be mentioned. See נח"מ, סו"ד, בל"י et al. The consensus is that the מנקר is testifying that: a) he was מנקר, which is בידו, and b) that the meat he is serving does not contain a mixture of גיד הנשה. Concerning ‘b’, there is no איתחזק איסורא that this meat is גיד הנשה, and it is not בידו to transform the גיד into בשר כשר, therefore as far as concept ‘b’ is concerned it is not איתחזק איסורא and also not בידו, which is our case of ע"א נאמן באיסורין, עיי"ש .  </i> on our case of the שליח testifying that it was written לשמה, where he does not have<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Nor did he ever have. See Footnote # 8</i> any capability at all to change the לשמה status of the גט.<br>תוספות challenges his own assumption that שחיטה is בידו לתקן:<br><b>ושחיטה אף על גב דהשתא אין בידו לתקנו –<br>and</b> concerning <b>שחיטה,</b> which תוספות claimed that רש"י should not have included it since it is בידו, תוספות asks, <b>even though that presently</b>, when he is serving the meat, <b>he is no longer capable to correct</b> the problem of נבילה,<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">As opposed to תרומה where he can be מפריש the תרומה presently as he is serving the meal.</i> so why is he נאמן, since it is איתחזק איסורא?<br>תוספות answers, that nevertheless since –<br><b>מעיקרא היה בידו לשחוט –<br>Originally he was capable of שחיטה</b> (either by himself or arranging for someone else to be שוחט), that is sufficient to be considered בידו לתקנו. תוספות offers proof for his contention –<br><b>דאם לא כן אמאי מהימן כיון דאיתחזק איסורא –<br>For if you will not agree</b> that this is considered בידו, but rather insist that it must be בידו now, then <b>why</b> indeed <b>is anyone</b> solely <b>believed</b> that this is בשר שחוטה, <b>since it was איתחזק איסורא</b>. One cannot say that indeed the only way that one is permitted to eat meat is only if two people will testify that it was נשחט properly –<br><b>דלא מצינו בשום מקום שיצטרך בגדול אחד עומד על גביו –<br>For we do not find it</b> mentioned <b>anywhere that there is a requirement that another adult should be standing together</b> with the שוחט, so that we can have two witnesses testifying that it is בשר שחוטה. Therefore that proves that we do not require that it be בידו now, rather it is sufficient that originally it was בידו.<br>תוספות continues to prove his point, indicating a possible rebuttal to this logic:<br>One may challenge תוספות proof by saying that the נאמנות of בידו is only if it is בידו now, and not if it was only previously בידו, and the reason why we may eat on the testimony of the שוחט, is because there is a רוב (a ‘majority) that tells us it was נשחט properly, namely that the רוב people that are שוחט are competent שוחטים. Therefore it has nothing to do with the נאמנות of an ע"א, but rather on account of רוב. תוספות responds that this is not so, for there is a נאמנות of an ע"א by שחיטה even when we cannot utilize this רוב –<br><b>ומעשים בכל יום דמהימן –<br>And it is an everyday occurrence that</b> the שוחט alone <b>is believed</b> (on account that it was previously בידו).<br><b>ואף על גב דלא שייך רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן –<br>Even</b> in a situation where this rule that <b>‘most</b> people <b>who frequent at</b> places of <b>שחיטה are competent</b> שוחטים’ <b>does not apply</b> –<br><b>כגון שנחתך כל הראש ואין בית השחיטה ניכר –<br>If for instance the entire head was cut off and the place of שחיטה cannot be discerned</b>, nevertheless if someone claims that he was שוחט it properly, he is believed. In this case we cannot say that the reason he is believed is because רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן; for we do not know that this animal was נשחט, since its head was severed and we cannot tell if it was נשחט or not. This proves that the only נאמנות is because he is an ע"א, and regardless that there was a חזקת איסור מחיים on this animal nevertheless he is now נאמן to say that it was נשחט properly, since previously it was בידו that he could be שוחט the animal properly.<br>תוספות asks an additional question:<br><b>ומה שאנו סומכין על הנשים בשחיטה אף על פי שאין יודעות הלכות שחיטה –<br>And</b> the reason <b>why we depend on women concerning שחיטה,</b> i.e. if a woman serves meat we trust her that it is בשר שחוטה, <b>even though</b> <b>they do not know the laws of שחיטה,</b> therefore seemingly it is not בידה, not now and not previously, for they do not know how to be שוחט. The question is how can we depend on them, for they are only an ע"א, and it is איתחזק איסורא?<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>כיון שבידה ללמוד לשחוט או להשכיר אחרים שישחטו לה כבידה דמי –<br>Since she is capable of learning how to be שוחט</b> (the שחיטה of a woman is a שחיטה כשרה) <b>or</b> she is capable <b>of hiring others</b> (valid שוחטים) <b>that they do the שחיטה for her, this is considered as if it is בידה.</b> It is not necessary that the persons themselves do the שחיטה. If, for instance, (s)he can see to it that the food is prepared in a כשר manner it is considered בידו.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The שליח הגט, however, is not empowered to write the גט. It is up to the husband to direct a סופר to write the גט. Therefore it is not בידו of the שליח הגט, and he can be believed only if it is לא איתחזק איסורא.</i><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומנלן דעד אחד נאמן באיסורין –<br>And if you will say; from where do we derive</b> this דין that <b>ע"א נאמן באיסורין.</b> We have proof that ע"א נאמן באיסורין from ניקור הגיד וחלב, however what is the source מן התורה that ע"א נאמן באיסורין.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דגמרינן מנדה דדרשינן בפרק המדיר (כתובות עב,א) וספרה לה לעצמה –<br>And one can say; that we derive it from</b> הלכות <b>נדה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The פסוק וספרה לה is actually discussing a זבה not a נדה, however the same rule applies to נדה.</i>, for we have a דרשה in פרק המדיר</b> that when the תורה states, concerning a זבה; <b>‘and<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">ויקרא (מצורע) טו, כח.</i> she shall count for her</b>(self)’ the דרשה of the word לה is to be understood, that she may count it <b>by herself</b>, and she will be believed to say that the required seven days have passed and she was טובלת and is טהורה. We see that we believe an ע"א, that she is טהורה.<br>תוספות poses a question:<br><b>ואם תאמר אם כן אפילו איתחזק איסורא –<br>And if you will say; if</b> we are deriving the דין of ע"א נאמן באיסורין from נדה, then an ע"א should be believed <b>even</b> in a case where it is <b>איתחזק איסורא.</b> When the אשה sees דם she becomes a נדה (or זבה), and is בחזקת איסור, and nevertheless she is believed to say that she is טהורה against a חזקת איסור.<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ויש לומר דאינה בחזקת שתהא רואה כל שעה –<br>And one can say; that there is no חזקה by</b> this woman <b>that she will continually see דם,</b> on the contrary, she will see דם naturally only for a limited period and then cease seeing דם –<br><b>וכשעברה שבעה טהורה ממילא ולא איתחזק איסורא –<br>And once the seven</b> days <b>pass<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">מן התורה a נדה is טמא for only seven days after the onset of seeing דם, provided she stopped seeing דם before the seventh day passed.</i></b> and she is not seeing דם, as is the natural state of affairs, that דם נדה does not last seven days, <b>she becomes טהורה automatically<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not mean that after she ceases seeing דם she is aטהרה  after the seven days; for she does not become טהורה unless she is טובלת in a מקוה. Rather, the intent of תוספות is, that this limitation that seeing דם places upon her, namely that during this time that she sees דם, she cannot do anything (טבילה) to become טהורה (she is בחזקת איסור), this limitation ceases to exist automatically, without her having to do anything, once she stops seeing דם after seven days, and she has no more this חזקת איסור. </i> and</b> therefore <b>there is no</b> real <b>חזקת איסור</b>, as opposed to טבל for instance, where the איסור טבל will not go away on its own, only if you are מפריש תרו"מ, here however the איסור will automatically disappear in the allotted time when she will not see דם. Therefore when she says that her seven days of נדה have passed, she is not testifying against any חזקת איסור, for we expect the seven days to pass at one point or another; she is merely informing us that the time is now.<br>There is still a question remaining: After the seven days passed she is still בחזקת איסור נדה, since she was not טובלת. How can we believe her that she is completely<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">We believe her that she is not seeing דם and seven days passed, because that is not in contradiction to any חזקה, but that does not make her completely טהורה, until she is טובלת.</i>טהורה, against this חזקת איסור?! To which תוספות responds in his conclusion:<br><b>וגם בידה לטבול –<br>And</b> concerning the completion of her טהרה – <b>she is</b> certainly <b>capable of being טובלת</b> in a מקוה, and as was stated earlier, that when it is בידו, then an ע"א is believed even against a חזקת איסור.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The proof that ע"א נאמן באיסורין, in a situation similar to a שליח הגט who is testifying that it was written לשמה, can be derived from the fact that people are נאמן on ניקור הגיד and חלב. For in those two instances there is no חזקת איסור on this meat that it is either גיד הנשה or חלב. The fact that people are believed for הפרשת תרומה and שחיטה is irrelevant to our discussion here, since in both those cases there is a חזקת איסור, and the reason the ע"א is נאמן, is only because it is בידו. This cannot apply to our case of שליח הגט, where it is definitely not בידו to write the גט לשמה.<br>The נאמנות of בידו is not limited to a situation where it is only presently בידו; it applies even if it was בידו in the past. This explains why people are נאמן to state that this meat is שחוטה, since in the past they were capable of either themselves being שוחט the animal properly or hiring others to be שוחט properly.<br>We derive the rule of ע"א נאמן באיסורין, from the פסוק concerning a [זבה] (נדה), which says וספרה לה, that the woman can count by herself and tell us when she is a טהורה, we see from here that even one person is believed to testify that there is no איסור.<br>We cannot assume that since by a נדה she was בחזקת איסור once she saw דם, therefore the fact that she is believed to say she is a טהורה, proves that an ע"א is נאמן even against a חזקת איסור. This is incorrect for the חזקת איסור by a נדה is a חזקה that will automatically become nullified as soon as she ceases to see דם, which is the natural state of affairs, therefore her testimony that she is no longer seeing דם, is not contradicting any חזקה; and we subsequently believe her that she was טובל, even though she is still בחזקת איסור נדה (even after seven days), because in regards to טבילה, it is obviously בידה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why is בידו believed even if איתחזק איסורא?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> Is it because בידו removes the איתחזק איסורא, or because בידו is a special נאמנות?<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ</i><br>2. How shall we explain the difference between the בידו of a שוחט in the past, to the בידה of a woman concerning שחיטה?<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See אמ"ה # 152.</i><br>3. How can we derive ע"א נאמן באיסורין from נדה, perhaps by נדה she is believed because it is הפה שאסר הפה שהתיר (she had the option of not informing anyone that she is a נדה)?<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See אמ"ה # 166 and נח"מ.</i>
<b>עד אחד נאמן באיסורין—One witness is believed</b> concerning <b>prohibitive acts</b>.<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא originally asked that two עדים should be required to testify that the גט was written לשמה as is the case whenever witnesses are required. One may assume that this מקשן maintained that here by גט we also require two עדים, since it is a דבר שבערוה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The process of a גט changes her status as an אשת איש, and permits her to marry another person to whom she was previously prohibited as an ערוה.</i>, one of the categories<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">They are: דיני ממונות, דיני נפשות ודבר שבערוה.</i> where two עדים are required. The subsequent answer that since ע"א נאמן באיסורין, therefore the שליח alone is believed, may leave us perplexed. We are discussing a גט, which is a דבר שבערוה, how can the גמרא compare this to איסור. Our תוספות discusses this issue.<br>------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה רבינו תם מה תשובה היא זאת –<br>The ר"ת has a difficulty; what is this answer</b> that the גמרא gave; that the שליח is נאמן, because ע"א נאמן באיסורין. This seemingly does not address the question at all<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוספות ד"ה מידי דהוי, for a similar type question.</i>. We cannot use the rule of ע"א נאמן באיסורין, in this case. This is not a case of איסור והיתר; this is a case of עריות, which requires two עדים. To prove that this is not a case of איסור והיתר where one עד is נאמן; תוספות continues –<br><b>עיקר הגט יוכיח שצריך לחותמו בשנים –<br>The main</b> execution of this very same <b>גט will prove</b> that this is not a case of איסור והיתר, <b>for it is necessary that</b> the גט <b>be signed by two</b> witnesses. If it were merely איסור והיתר, we would not require two עדים. We require two עדים because by a גט we are dealing with a דבר שבערוה; therefore how did the גמרא state that this is merely a matter of איסור and the שליח alone is נאמן on the כשרות of this גט?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ותירץ דהכי קאמר דעד אחד נאמן באיסורין בכהאי גוונא –<br>And</b> the ר"ת answered; <b>this is what</b> the גמרא <b>is saying: that an ע"א is נאמן by איסורין</b> even by a דבר שבערוה, provided that it is <b>in such a manner –<br>שעיקר הגט נעשה כבר ושוב אין צריך אלא גילוי מילתא לידע אם לשמה נכתב:</b><br><b>Where the main</b> execution <b>of the גט was already completed</b> properly with two עדים, as is required for a דבר שבערוה <b>and subsequently all that is required is merely information to notify</b> us <b>whether it was written לשמה.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This notification should not be considered a דבר שבערוה according to this תרצן, since it is not accomplishing anything in the גט. When the עדים sign on the גט, they create the actual validity of the גט. However when the שליח states that it was written לשמה, he is merely notifying that it was previously written לשמה. The תרצן is of the opinion that such testimony should not be considered a דבר שבערוה. Rather it should be considered akin to איסור והיתר. The גמרא however will presently reject this approach and maintain that all aspects of a גט, even validating its status that it was written לשמה, is part of a דבר שבערוה process, and will require two עדים.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The תרצן who explains that the reason why one שליח alone is נאמן to testify that the גט was written לשמה, is on account of the rule of ע"א נאמן באיסורין; it is his contention that merely testifying on the status of a גט, that it was properly drawn up, this testimony is not to be considered as a דבר שבערוה. Rather this should be considered as all other testimonies of איסור והיתר, where one עד is sufficient. It is only when creating a גט originally that the rules of דבר שבערוה apply, necessitating two witnesses to sign the גט, but not however to merely testifying as to its validity.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. How should we understand תוספות question as opposed to his answer?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. Is a דבר שבערוה considered איסורין?
