This will explain the reason for saying בפני נכתב and since רבה also agrees that אין עדים מצויין לקיימו that will explain why בפני נחתם must also be said.<br>תוספות anticipates a possible answer and refutes it:<br><b>ודוחק לומר דכולה הך סוגיא וגם רב אשי דאמר לקמן רבי יהודה היא –<br>And it is implausible that this entire discussion</b> in which we are searching for a תנא who requires כתיבה וחתימה לשמה <b>and also<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> רב אשי who states later</b> in the גמרא that our משנה follows the opinion of <b>ר' יהודה</b> who maintains that both כתיבה וחתימה have to be done לשמה; it is implausible that in all this –<br><b>איירי למאי דסלקא דעתן מעיקרא –<br>We are discussing</b> only <b>according to what we originally thought</b>, namely that רבה does not agree with רבא at all, therefore we must find a תנא who requires both כתיבה וחתימה לשמה. In truth however, we can say that according to רבה the תנא of the משנה is ר' אלעזר, as previously mentioned. תוספות finds this too far fetched<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">When the גמרא discusses an issue at length, we assume that it is according to the מסקנא, unless specifically stated otherwise.</i> to say that the entire סוגיא is only according to the הוה אמינא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It is especially difficult to say that רב אשי, who was from the last אמוראים and was מסדר the גמרא, did not know of the מסקנא that רבה אית ליה דרבא and finds it necessary to actually establish our משנה only according to ר' יהודה.</i>. We must say therefore that even according to the מסקנא, we cannot use תוספות solution. The question is why not?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דרבה אף לפי המסקנא בעי חתימה לשמה –<br>And one can say; that even according to the מסקנא of the גמרא</b> where רבה agrees with the reason of אין עדים מצויין לקיימו, nevertheless we need to say that <b>רבה requires that the חתימה be לשמה.</b> Therefore we are seeking the תנא who requires both כתיבה וחתימה לשמה even according to the מסקנא that רבה אית ליה דרבא.<br>תוספות will now explain why we must maintain that רבה requires חתימה לשמה.<br><b>כיון דידענו לא מהני –<br>Since</b> according to רבה (even) two עדים that state <b>ידענו</b> (besides saying בפני נכתב) <b>will not validate<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' ד"ה הכא that רבה derives the דין that ידענו לא מהני from the משנה ריש פ"ב. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i></b> the גט. The only explanation why ידענו is not sufficient is because we require that the חתימה be לשמה. The עדים cannot testify that the חתימה was לשמה, unless they were present by the חתימה, and saw the עדי הגט signing לשמה. If רבה would not maintain that the חתימה needs to be לשמה, then if two עדים state ידענו, ‘we recognize the חתימות’, then it would certainly be כשר.<br>תוספות will now explain why רבה maintains ידענו לא מהני even according to the מסקנא:<br><b>דאי מהני לפי המסקנא תקשי רבה מאי טעמא לא אמר כרבא –<br>For if</b> we will maintain that <b>according to the מסקנא</b> (when רבה agrees with רבא), ידענו <b>is acceptable<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">In the הו"א when רבה maintains that we say בפ"נ only because of לשמה, then obviously ידענו is not valid, because it does not tell us whether the עדים signed לשמה. According to the מסקנא, however, where רבה agrees with the reason of אין עדים וכו', perhaps he will also agree that ידענו is acceptable, because we do not need חתימה לשמה, we say בפני נחתם, only to be מקיים the גט.</i> the</b> original <b>question</b> will remain; <b>why does not רבה</b> totally <b>agree<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">רבה did not agree with רבא because according to רבא it is not necessary to say בפני נכתב. And רבה does not accept sרבא' answer that בפני נכתב is said because אתי לאיחלופי, for רבה is of the opinion that לא אתי לאיחלופי since by קיום we can only say בפני. Even if two עדים come and say ידענו it will not be accepted. If according to the מסקנא, however, רבה will also agree that ידענו is acceptable, then it will be אתי לאיחלופי, so רבה has no reason not to accept sרבא' opinion. [The distinction of אשה ובעל דבר alone will not be sufficient to prevent the אתי לאיחלופי; see תוספות ד"ה כיון (מהר"ם שי"ף).] </i> with רבא,</b> that the חיוב of saying בפ"נ is only because of קיום and not because of לשמה. Therefore we must conclude (since רבה argues with רבא), that ידענו לא מהני. The reason why ידענו לא מהני, is that since we require חתימה לשמה, then ידענו will be hearsay.<br>תוספות anticipates a possible refutation and rejects it.<br><b>וליכא למימר הא דלא מהני ידענו היינו משום איחלופי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">It would be appropriate (according to this refutation) that the חכמים disqualify ידענו by שנים (who should be believed) in favor of accepting בפנ"ח by one שליח, because one שליח is more common than two who recognize the חתימות from מדה"י (see מהר"ם שי"ף). See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>And we cannot say</b> that רבה does not require חתימה לשמה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore תוספות original question should remain that we follow ר"א concerning בפני נכתב on account of לשמה; and בפני נחתם is said only for קיום.</i>, and the <b>reason why ידענו</b> <b>is not acceptable<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">If there is no requirement for חתימה לשמה, there seems to be no reason why ידענו לא מהני.</i> because</b> if ידענו would be acceptable <b>then</b> אתי <b>לאיחלופי</b> בקיום שטרות. The proposed refutation is as follows; there is no requirement for חתימה לשמה. Nonetheless <sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">This will also explain why רבה disagrees with רבא. Since ידענו לא מהני there is no need for בפני נכתב, since לא אתי לאיחלופי because ידענו לא מהני.</i>ידענו לא מהני; for if ידענו מהני people will say this single שליח\עד is equivalent to the two עדים that say ידענו. Therefore it follows that wherever two עדים are believed (i.e. קיום שטרות), a single עד should also be believed<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9 in תוספות ד"ה הכא.</i>.<br>תוספות rejects this refutation; we cannot say that ידענו לא מהני, simply because of אתי לאיחלופי –<br><b>דהא כיון שצריך לומר בפני נכתב משום לשמה לא אתי לאיחלופי:<br>For since</b> the שליח <b>is required to say בפני נכתב on account<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i> of לשמה this will prevent any confusion.</b> Therefore since there is no concern of confusion, the only explanation why ידענו לא מהני is because רבה requires חתימה לשמה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We must say that רבה is of the opinion that the חתימה (also) must be לשמה, even according to the מסקנא of the גמרא that רבה אית ליה דרבא. The reason why רבה does not totally agree with רבא, but rather maintains that בפני נכתב must be said on account of לשמה and not on account of אתי לאיחלופי, is because רבה maintains that לא אתי לאיחלופי since ידענו לא מהני. The (only) reason why ידענו לא מהני is because they have to testify that it was written לשמה, and this can be accomplished only be saying בפני.<br>We cannot say that חתימה לשמה is not required, and the reason why ידענו לא מהני is because if ידענו מהני, then אתי לאיחלופי. This is not so, for according to רבה, the שליח must say בפני נכתב for לשמה. This saying of בפני נכתב will prevent איחלופי. This proves that רבה requires חתימה לשמה. Therefore we cannot say that he follows the opinion of ר"א who requires only כתיבה לשמה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Previously<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה הכא. See footnote # 7.</i> תוספות explained that רבא derives that ידענו is not effective from the משנה in ריש פ"ב. Here תוספות states that רבה maintains ידענו לא מהני for otherwise why does רבה argue with רבא. Can we reconcile these two תוספות?<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. What is more frequent;<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> a. שליח המביא גט; b. שנים המכירים החתימות; or c. אשה המביאה גט and האשה עצמה שהביא גיטה?<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם שי"ף.</i><br>3. Why does תוספות add the phrase 'משום לשמה'<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15.</i> when mentioning that בפני נכתב needs to be said?

Daf 3b



Line 1

<b>דתנן אין כותבין במחובר וכולי—For we learnt in a משנה </b>one <b>is not</b> permitted <b>to write</b> a גט <b>on</b> anything that is <b>attached</b> to the ground <b>etc.’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבה maintains that בפ"נ ובפ"נ is said to assure us that the גט was written and signed לשמה. From this we gather that the תנא of our משנה, according to רבה, requires that both the כתיבת וחתימת הגט must be לשמה. The גמרא states unambiguously that our משנה cannot follow the opinion of ר"מ. For ר"מ requires only חתימה לשמה and not כתיבה לשמה. The גמרא offers proof<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">We do not find any משנה or ברייתא that states explicitly the opinion of ר"מ regarding כתיבה or חתימה לשמה.</i> that this indeed is the opinion of ר"מ by quoting the משנה in פרק ב' which states אין כותבין במחובר וכו'. In that משנה, however, sר"מ' name is not mentioned. How can we then infer from this משנה the opinion of ר"מ (regarding לשמה)? In fact in the גמרא on that משנה there is a מחלוקת concerning whose opinion that משנה follows; whether ר"מ or ר' אלעזר. Our תוספות will explain why the גמרא assumes that ר"מ requires only חתימה לשמה and not כתיבה לשמה.<br>The תורה writes<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">דברים (כי תצא) כד,א.</i> וכתב לה ספר כריתות ונתן בידה; from this the חכמים derive that between the וכתב and the ונתן there should be no interrupting action. Therefore a גט that is [written or] signed במחובר, then it is detached and given to the woman, that גט is פסול מן התורה, since it was detached between the וכתב and ונתן. There is however a disagreement as to what וכתב precisely refers to. According to ר"מ it refers to the חתימת הגט, and according to ר"א it refers to the כתיבת הגט.<br>From the words וכתב לה we also derive that the וכתב must be לה – לשמה. The same מחלוקת applies; according to ר"מ only the חתימה must be לשמה, according to ר"א the כתיבה must be לשמה. The חתימה is not even required, since וכתב refers to the כתיבה.<br>----------------------<br><b>הך סוגיא –<br>This סוגיא</b> which maintains that ר' מאיר is of the opinion that only the חתימה need be לשמה (and not במחובר), however the כתיבה need not be לשמה (and מחובר is not פוסל) –<br><b>ובסמוך נמי דמוקי רב אשי מתניתין כרבי יהודה –<br>And similarly</b> when the גמרא will <b>shortly</b> say <b>that רב אשי establishes our משנה according to</b> the view of <b>ר"י;</b> that only ר"י maintains that both the כתיבה and the חתימה need be לשמה (and that מחובר is פוסל by either of them); these two גמרות –<br><b>אתיא כריש לקיש דפרק ב' (לקמן כא,ב) דמוקי מתניתין כרבי מאיר דחתמו שנינו –<br>Follow</b> the opinion <b>of ריש לקיש in the second פרק, who establishes the משנה</b> in פ"ב, <b>according to ר"מ, because</b> <b>the</b> text of the משנה there which <b>states 'חתמו' – ‘they signed’ –<br>דמשמע חתימה ממש –<br>indicates</b> that we are discussing <b>the actual signing</b> of the גט. Therefore the משנה in פ"ב must follow the opinion of ר"מ. The משנה there states, ‘if he wrote the גט במחובר then detached it and signed it בתלוש it is a גט כשר’. The inference is that he wrote the entire גט במחובר, only the signing was בתלוש. The גט is nevertheless כשר. Thus this משנה cannot follow the opinion of ר"א who requires <sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ר' אלעזר is of the opinion that עדי חתימה are not required by a גט (and שאר שטרות), only עדי מסירה, as the גמרא will shortly say. It follows that the word וכתב (לה) refers to the כתיבה. Therefore כתיבה במחובר is פסול. </i>כתיבה בתלוש and (certainly) not the opinion of ר"י who explicitly argues there on this ת"ק and requires כתיבה וחתימה בתלוש. The משנה must therefore follow the opinion of ר"מ who maintains that the word וכתב (לה) refers to the חתימה.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore if it was signed בתלוש it is כשר (even though it was written במחובר) since there was no interruption between the וכתב (which means the חתימה) and the ונתן (see ‘Overview’)</i> Since that משנה follows the view of ר"מ, and the משנה states that even if the גט was written במחובר it is still כשר, we know that וכתב is referring <i>only</i> to the חתימה. Otherwise the גט would be פסול because of the <sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה חתימה and the ‘Overview’ here.</i>דרשה וכתב ונתן. From this we may infer<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot infer that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה from the fact that he requires עדי חתימה. This only teaches us that וכתב means חתימה also, but not חתימה exclusively. In fact וכתב may refer both to the כתיבה וחתימה. Once however, we ascribe the משנה of אין כותבין according to ר"מ, then it is evident that וכתב refers to חתימה exclusively and not to כתיבה. See מהר"ם שי"ף. </i> as well, that the כתיבה need not be לשמה, for the word וכתב (לה), is referring only to the חתימה and not the כתיבה.<br><b>אבל רבי יוחנן ושמואל מוקי התם מתניתין כרבי אלעזר –<br>However, ר' יוחנן and שמואל establish the משנה there</b> in פרק שני <b>according to</b> the view of <b>ר' אלעזר,</b> who maintains that the word וכתב (לה) refers to the כתיבה of the גט and not to the חתימה. This may seem difficult for the משנה states that; כתבו וכו' תלשו חתמו וכו' כשר, which would seem to indicate that even if the entire גט was written במחובר it is still כשר. How can we say that the משנה follows the ruling of ר"א who requires כתיבה בתלוש? תוספות explains:<br><b>וחתמו אתורף קאי כלומר סיימו –<br>And</b> the word <b>'חתמו'</b> which the משנה states, <b>is referring to the תורף<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The תורף of the גט refers to the writing of the names of the husband and wife as well as the date of the גט. It is only this part of the גט that need be לשמה and בתלוש (even according to ר"א). The remainder of the גט, the טופס, is the text of the גט which is the same in all גיטין and is not פוסל if it is written שלא לשמה or במחובר.</i></b> of the גט, and it does not mean ‘they signed it’. Rather the word חתמו is to be understood <b>as if</b> the משנה <b>said ‘they completed’</b> (writing the תורף of) the גט.<br><b>כמו תורה חתומה ניתנה דסוף פרק הניזקין (לקמן דף ס,א) –<br>It is similar</b> to the expression: <b>‘the completed Torah was given</b> to the Jews’, which the גמרא states <b>at the end of פרק הניזקין</b>. The word חתומה there (as well as here) does not mean ‘signed’ but rather ‘completed’.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">According to the interpretation of ר' יוחנן ושמואל that the משנה of אין כותבין במחובר וכו' is following the opinion of ר' אלעזר and not of ר' מאיר, we cannot therefore, infer from this משנה the opinion of ר' מאיר concerning כתיבה לשמה (or כתיבה במחובר). It would seem possible then, that according to ר"י ושמואל our משנה of בפ"נ ובפ"נ לשמה can follow the opinion of ר"מ who may hold that we require לשמה both by כתיבה and חתימה. Similarly it cannot be proven that ר' יהודה requires כתיבה וחתימה לשמה (as רב אשי maintains), since כתיבתו וחתימתו בתלוש may refer to the טופס ותורף but not necessarily to the actual חתימת העדים.</i><b></b><br>תוספות will now reject this possibility.<br><b>ולשמואל ורב יוחנן נמי יש להוכיח דרבי מאיר לא בעי כתיבה לשמה –<br>And</b> (even) <b>according to שמואל ור"י we can also prove that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה –<br>כדמסיק בסמוך מדרב נחמן דאמר אומר היה רבי מאיר אפילו מצאו באשפה כולי –<br>As</b> the גמרא will <b>conclude shortly</b> with a statement <b>from רב נחמן who stated, that ר"מ was wont to say ‘even if he found</b> the גט <b>in the garbage</b> dump etc.’, and he signs it with proper witnesses he may give it to his wife. We see unequivocally from this statement of ר' נחמן that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה. Therefore even according to ר"י ושמואל we cannot say that the משנה of בפ"נ ובפ"נ לשמה follows the opinion of ר"מ.<b></b><br>תוספות asks; even if we assume that the משנה in פ"ב follows the opinion of ר"מ, we still cannot infer from it that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה –<br><b>ואם תאמר והיכי מוכח מהכא דלא בעי כתיבה לשמה –<br>And if you will say; how is it evident from this משנה that כתיבה לשמה is not required? –<br>דילמא לכתחילה בעי כתיבה לשמה כדבעי לכתחילה בתלוש –<br>Perhaps כתיבה לשמה is required initially</b>, <b>just as</b> the משנה <b>requires that initially</b> the גט should be written <b>בתלוש.</b> The משנה states clearly: 'אין כותבין במחובר'. It is only בדיעבד that מחובר is כשר. We may say the same concerning לשמה, that לכתחילה the גט must be written לשמה. Therefore we require the שליח to say בפני נכתב, because we prefer to have the גט כשר לכתחילה and no only כשר בדיעבד<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם who interprets the terms לכתחילה and בדיעבד to mean as follows: לכתחילה we are to write the גט לשמה; if the גט was not written לשמה and the women received it בדיעבד, she may לכתחילה remarry with this גט. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2</i>.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאפילו אי לכתחילה בעי כתיבה לשמה לא מיתוקמא מתניתין כוותיה –<br>We can say; that even if לכתחילה the גט must be written לשמה, our משנה</b> of בפ"נ <b>cannot follow</b> the opinion of ר"מ –<br><b>כיון דדיעבד כשר לא היו מתקנין לומר בפני נכתב –<br>Since בדיעבד</b> the<b></b> גט will be <b>כשר</b> if he wrote it שלא לשמה, the חכמים <b>would not have instituted</b> the ruling requiring that <b>בפני נכתב be said.</b> If בדיעבד there is no פסול in כתיבה שלא לשמה, nothing is accomplished by saying בפני נכתב, since <b>i</b>t is כשר regardless whether it was written לשמה or not.<br>תוספות offers an additional poof that כתיבה לשמה is a requirement even בדיעבד:<br><b>ועוד דתנן בריש פרק ב' (לקמן דף טו,א) דאי לא אמר בפני נכתב פסול –<br>And furthermore,</b> even if we were to argue that we want to be sure that the גט is כשר לכתחילה, therefore we require the שליח to say בפני נכתב, nevertheless we will not understand <b>that which the משנה states in the beginning of the second פרק that ‘if</b> the שליח <b>did not say 'בפני נכתב',</b> the גט <b>is פסול’</b> even בדיעבד. This is certainly incomprehensible. If the requirement to write a גט לשמה is only לכתחילה, but בדיעבד it is כשר, how can it be that if the שליח failed to say בפני נכתב (which is a testimony that the גט was written לשמה), the גט will be פסול. We must therefore conclude that our משנה maintains that if the גט was not written לשמה it is פסול even בדיעבד. That cannot follow the opinion of ר"מ who at most only requires לשמה לכתחילה.<br>תוספות asks another question;<br><b>ותימה לרבינו יצחק דהכא משמע דלא מתוקמא מתניתין כרבי מאיר –<br>The ר"י is perplexed; for from</b> the גמרא <b>here it seems that our משנה is not in accordance with ר"מ –<br>משום דרבי מאיר לא בעי כתיבה לשמה –<br>for ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה</b> by a גט –<br><b>ולקמן (דף ה,ב) תניא בהדיא המביא גט ממדינת הים –<br>But later it is stated explicitly in a ברייתא: one who brought a גט ממדה"י</b><br><b>נתנו לה ולא אמר בפני נכתב ובפני נחתם יוציא והולד ממזר דברי רבי מאיר<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות assumes that הולד ממזר even if he said בפני נחתם, but he did not say בפני נכתב.</i> –<br>he gave it to</b> the woman <b>and</b> the שליח <b>did not say בפ"נ ובפ"נ;</b> if the woman remarried on the basis of this גט, the דין is the second husband <b>must divorce</b> her, <b>and</b> any <b>child</b> she bore from her second ‘marriage’ is deemed to be a <b>ממזר, this is the opinion of ר"מ.</b> We may infer from this that according to ר"מ, saying בפני נכתב is so important, that the lack of saying בפ"נ invalidates the גט. According to רבה, the reason for saying בפני נכתב is on account of לשמה. How can we then say (according to רבה), that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה; if so why are we concerned if he did not say בפני נכתב, to the extent that the גט is פסול and יוציא והולד ממזר. It would seem from this ברייתא that (according to רבה) ר"מ does require כתיבה לשמה, and that explains why if בפני נכתב is not said then יוציא והולד ממזר.<br>תוספות goes on to say that this question is only according to רבה –<br><b>ולרבא ניחא דבעי בפני נכתב דלא ליתי לאיחלופי –<br>However, according to רבא it is understood</b> why the שליח <b>is required to say בפני נכתב</b> (even) to the extent that its omission will cause יוציא והולד ממזר in order <b>that we should not confuse<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See previous גמרא ג,א and the תוספות.</i></b> קיום הגט with קיום שטרות.<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">Without the שליח saying בפני נכתב, we would assume that בפני נחתם is a regular קיום. We would therefore conclude that just as by קיום הגט one עד is sufficient, the same will apply to קיום שטרות. This is not true; by קיום שטרות there is always the requirement that two עדים be מקיים the שטר. To prevent this confusion the חכמים were מתקן that by גט אשה the שליח should add בפני נכתב to differentiate it from קיום שטרות. Not saying בפני נכתב goes against this תקנת חכמים, and therefore the חכמים invalidated the גט. This explains sרבא' position.</i> However according to רבה there is a difficulty; why if the שליח did not say בפני נכתב the דין is יוציא והולד ממזר.<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty regarding רבא. How can we maintain that according to רבא it is understood why the שליח says בפני נכתב (according to ר"מ), which means that the שליח must be present at the writing of the גט –<br><b>והא דאמר רב נחמן בסמוך דלרבי מאיר מצאו באשפה כשר –<br>For ר' נחמן will shortly state that according to ר"מ</b> (even) <b>if one finds</b> a גט <b>in a garbage</b> dump <b>it is</b> nevertheless <b>כשר.</b> This seemingly contradicts what we just said; that the שליח must be present at the writing of the גט, otherwise it is פסול. It seems that רב נחמן is contradicting this premise when stating that even a גט found in the garbage is כשר. This גט was certainly not written in the presence of the שליח!<br>תוספות reconciles this contradiction;<br><b>היינו כשהבעל עצמו נותנו לה או בארץ ישראל –<br>This</b> statement of ר' נחמן is valid <b>when the husband himself gives her</b> the גט, <b>or</b> even when the גט is being sent with a שליח <b>in א"י,</b> In these two cases no בפני נכתב need be said, and indeed that גט may be picked up from the garbage, since there is no requirement of כתיבה לשמה according to ר"מ.<br><b>אבל שולח גט ממדינת הים צריך שיראה השליח כתיבת הגט –<br>However, one who sends a גט ממדה"י the שליח is required to see the writing of the גט –<br>שיוכל לומר בפני נכתב דלא ליתי לאיחלופי –<br>In order that he be able to testify בפני נכתב, so that there be no confusion</b> between קיום הגט and קיום שטרות<b>.</b> According to רבא therefore, it is understood that if the שליח does not say בפני נכתב the גט is פסול.<br>תוספות will now conclude the question on רבה<br><b>אבל לרבה קשיא דלית ליה טעמא דאיחלופי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i> –<br>However, according to רבה it is difficult, for he does not agree</b> that <b>the reason</b> בפני נכתב is said is because of the חשש of <b>איחלופי</b>, only on account of לשמה. Since ר"מ maintains that כתיבה לשמה is not required, why should the גט be פסול if the שליח does not say בפני נכתב.<br>תוספות continues to say that רבה disagrees with the חשש of איחלופי –<br><b>אף לפי המסקנא דרבה אית ליה דרבא כדפירשנו:</b><br><b>Even according to the conclusion</b> of the גמרא, that surmises <b>that רבה agrees with רבא, as we explained previously.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות ג,א ד"ה מאן. תוספות explained there that if רבה would agree to the חשש of איחלופי, then there would be no reason for רבה to argue with רבא at all. He should accept the reasoning of רבא; namely that בפני נחתם is on account of קיום and בפני נכתב is on account of איחלופי.  </i></b> According to the מסקנא of the גמרא even רבה agrees that the reason for saying בפני נחתם is for קיום (as well as for לשמה). Nevertheless he maintains that בפני נכתב is said on account of לשמה exclusively. There is no חשש of איחלופי, which would require the שליח to say בפני נכתב.<br>The question remains why, according to רבה, does ר"מ maintain that if the שליח does not say בפני נכתב the דין is יוציא והולד ממזר. Our תוספות does not answer this question.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See אמ"ה # 61-3</i><br>Summary:<br>Everyone agrees that our משנה of בפ"נ cannot follow the opinion of ר"מ, since he maintains that כתיבה לשמה is not required (בדיעבד). ריש לקיש derives this from the fact that the משנה of אין כותבין במחובר follows the opinion of ר"מ. From that משנה it is evident that only the חתימה must be בתלוש. It follows then that the word וכתב refers only to the חתימה. Subsequently only the חתימה must be לשמה.<br>שמואל and ר"י also agree that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה based on the statement of ר' נחמן quoting ר"מ that מצאו באשפה is כשר.<br>Even if we were to maintain that ר"מ is of the opinion that כתיבה לשמה is required לכתחילה (as it is in the case of תלוש), nevertheless our משנה of בפ"נ cannot follow the opinion of ר"מ. It would be unnecessary to have the שליח say בפני נכתב, since even in the event that it was not נכתב לשמה it would be כשר בדיעבד. It certainly does not justify the פסק (stated in the משנה ריש פ"ב) that if בפני נכתב was not said, then the גט is פסול.<br>There is a difficulty however according to רבה. There is a ברייתא in which ר"מ states explicitly that if the שליח did not say בפ"נ ובפ"נ the דין is יוציא והולד ממזר. We can understand this ruling according to רבא who maintains that even though ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה, nevertheless the שליח must say בפני נכתב in order that לא אתי לאיחלופי. (This requirement that the שליח be present at the writing of a גט [to testify בפני נכתב] is limited only to situation where בפ"נ is required, otherwise according to ר"מ even if מצאו באשפה it is כשר.)<br>However according to רבה who does not accept the חשש of איחלולפי (even according to the מסקנא) and the only reason to say בפני נכתב is on account of לשמה, why then does ר"מ maintain that if the שליח does not say בפני נכתב the דין is יוציא והולד ממזר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why did not the גמרא originally quote the statement of ר"נ to prove that ר"מ does not require כתיבה לשמה?<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See אמ"ה # 42-3.</i><br>2. Why is it necessary to interpret the terms לכתחילה ובדיעבד as the מהר"ם interprets it<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9.</i>? Why cannot we say that בדיעבד means that if she remarries, she may remain remarried?<br>3. תוספות asks why does ר"מ maintain that if the שליח did not say בפני נכתב then יוציא וכו', since according to רבה there is no חשש of איחלופי.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> Rather תוספות should have said that according to ר"מ who requires חתימה לשמה there can be no איחלופי since ידענו will not be acceptable according to ר"מ!<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א (הארוך).</i> Alternatively תוספות could have proven that ר"מ is not concerned about איחלופי, otherwise the משנה could follow the opinion of ר"מ.<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם שי"ף.</i>

Line 2

<b>שלשה גיטין פסולים—Three</b> types<b> of<b> גיטין are invalid</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא quotes the משנה of the last פרק concerning ג' גיטין פסולין; where ר' אלעזר argues on the תנא קמא and requires no עדי חתימה, only עדי מסירה. Our תוספות will be discussing the opinion that the ת"ק of this משנה is ר"מ. Even though there seem to be some differences between ר"מ and this ת"ק, nevertheless they can be reconciled.<br>-------------------<br><b>איכא דמוקי בפרק בתרא (לקמן דף פו,א) הך מתניתין כרבי מאיר –<br>There are those</b> אמוראים quoted<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there, when discussing this משנה, states: הניחא לר"מ; this (משנה) is understood according to ר"מ.</i> <b>in the last פרק</b> of מס' גיטין <b>who establish</b> that the ת"ק of <b>this משנה</b> of ג' גיטין פסולין <b>follows</b> the opinion of <b>ר"מ<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem appropriate that the ת"ק of ר"א (who maintains עדי מסירה כרתי) should be ר"מ who maintains עדי חתימה כרתי.</i>.</b><br>תוספות anticipates the following question:<br><b>אף על גב דאית ליה לרבי מאיר כל המשנה ממטבע שטבעו חכמים בגיטין הולד ממזר-<br>Even though ר"מ is of the opinion<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See גמרא ה,ב.</i></b> that <b>he who deviates from the proscribed<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The word מטבע means an imprinted coin. It is to be understood to mean, that we are to follow a uniform pattern, just as all coins are imprinted in the same way.</i></b> method <b>that the חכמים proscribed concerning גיטין, the child</b> that is born after the woman remarries on the basis of such a גט, that child <b>is a</b> <b>ממזר.</b> In all these three גיטין there was a deviation from the proscribed method (they are גיטין פסולים) and nevertheless the משנה states ואם ניסת הולד כשר. How can we reconcile this with the opinion of ר"מ?<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דהכא היינו טעמא דהולד כשר</b> –<br><b>The ר"ת says that the reason that here the child</b> is deemed to be <b>כשר</b> and not a ממזר is –<br><b>דכך היה המטבע שלא יפסל הולד בהנך שלשה –<br>Because this was</b> the original <b>stipulation</b> of the חכמים when they instituted the various תקנות of writing גיטין <b>that in these three</b> cases enumerated in this משנה, <b>the child will not</b> be considered <b>פסול</b>.<br>תוספות has additional difficulties reconciling the משנה of ג' גיטין with the ruling of ר"מ:<br><b>ואף על גב דרבי מאיר סבר וכתב היינו וחתם –<br>And even though ר"מ is of the opinion</b> that when the תורה writes the<b></b> word <b>וכתב</b> (לה); the תורה <b>means</b> that the גט should be <b>signed</b> (by witnesses). How can we reconcile this opinion of ר"מ with this משנה which states: כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים the ולד is כשר. There are no עדים on this גט; how can it be a גט כשר?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is asking that this is not merely a case of המשנה ממטבע שטבעו חכמים וכו' (which we can explain [as תוספות just did] that the חכמים made an exception by these three גיטין), but rather this is a פסול דאורייתא if we maintain (as ר"מ does) that עדי חתימה כרתי</i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>מכל מקום כשר הולד בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים –<br>Nevertheless, the child</b> will be deemed <b>כשר</b>, <b>,</b> in the case where the גט was written <b>in</b> the husband’s <b>handwriting,</b> even though <b>there are no witnesses</b> who signed the גט, even according to ר"מ. The reason being –<br><b>דכיון שהבעל עצמו כתב אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו –<br>That since the husband himself wrote</b> the גט in his own handwriting <b>there is no greater</b> act of <b>signing</b> the גט, <b>than this</b> act of the husband writing the גט himself.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why וכתב means וחתם is that we need the witnesses to ascertain that the husband is actually initiating the divorce and directing the סופר to write the גט. Through the חתימת העדים we know that there was a וכתב. How much greater is this assurance (that the husband is initiating the divorce) when the גט is in the husbands own handwriting. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i><br>תוספות now questions how the third case of the משנה can be reconciled with ר"מ who requires עדי חתימה:<br><b>ואין בו אלא עד אחד –<br>And</b> concerning the case where <b>there is only one witness</b> who signed on the גט; how can ר"מ agree that הולד כשר –<br>תוספות qualifies and explains his question:<br><b>למאן דאמר בפרק בתרא (גם זה שם) כתב ידו ועד שנינו שפיר –<br>According to the</b> אמורא <b>in the last פרק,</b> who interprets the משנה which states אין בו אלא ע"א, to mean that the גט was written in the husband’s <b>hand writing</b> and in addition <b>a witness</b> signed as well. That is how we interpret the <b>משנה;</b> <b>it is understood</b> that this may follow the ruling of ר"מ; as was stated previously that since it is in the husband’s handwriting אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה teaches us this דין of כתב ידו ועד, in addition to the דין of כתב ידו, in order to inform us that even if it was כתב ידו ועד, nevertheless it is a גט פסול. Only בדיעבד is הולד כשר. See following תוס' ד"ה יש (הא'). </i><br><b>אלא למאן דאמר דכתב סופר ועד קשה –<br>However, according to the one who interprets</b> the statement אין בו אלא ע"א to mean there was merely <b>the handwriting of the scribe plus</b> the signature of <b>one witness, it is difficult to understand</b> why the גט should be כשר even בדיעבד according to ר"מ. There are no two עדים signing the גט. We cannot say here אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו, for it was merely the handwriting of a scribe, not the husband.<br>תוספות anticipates a possible resolution to this question. Perhaps we can say that the handwriting of the סופר be considered as an additional witness. One may argue that the סופר by writing the גט is testifying that the husband is divorcing his wife. Together with the witness who actually signed the גט we have two witnesses. תוספות refutes this idea.<br><b>ניחוש דשמא סופר כתוב להתלמד וזרקו לאשפה –<br>We should be concerned perhaps the סופר wrote the גט for practice and he threw it into the garbage</b> dump –<br><b>ובאתה האשה והחתימה עליו עד אחד ואין כאן שנים –<br>And then the woman</b> (perhaps) <b>came</b> along, found the גט <b>and had one witness sign it and we do not have here two witnesses.</b> The writing of the סופר does not assure us that the husband asked the סופר to write the גט. It is possible that the סופר wrote the גט for practice. The question remains how this can be a גט כשר, according to ר"מ, since we do not have two עדים.<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>ויש לומר שהסופרים חוששים למכשול ונזהרין בכך –<br>And one can say that the סופרים are concerned for</b> various <b>problems<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i></b> that may develop <b>and are careful</b> to prevent <b>these</b> types of problem by destroying any גט which was written להתלמד. We can therefore assume that this גט was written at the request of the husband, and together with the signature of the witness, it can be considered as if two witnesses (the סופר and the ע"א) signed it.<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated question; if the סופרים are so careful to destroy any גט that was written להתלמד, then obviously this גט was written at the request of the husband. Let us consider the handwriting of the סופר as one עד, and we should require only one more additional עד. Why does the משנה say that כתב סופר ועד is פסול לכתחילה?<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ומיהו אין רגילות להזהר לגמרי שתחשב כתיבת סופר כעד אחד –<br>However, they are not that accustomed to be very scrupulous</b> never to leave lying around a גט that was written להתלמד <b>that the handwriting of the סופר should be considered as a</b> valid <b>ע"א.</b> It is only בדיעבד that we are not פוסל the ולד if there was כתב סופר ועד. Initially, however we require two עדים. A גט with כתב סופר ועד is לכתחילה פסול, for we have no ironclad assurance that the סופרים are scrupulously careful with גיטין that are written להתלמד.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה of ג' גיטין פסולים which states ואם נשאת הולד כשר can be reconciled to follow (even) the opinion of ר"מ who maintains that כל המשנה ממטבע שטבעו חכמים בגיטין הולד ממזר and that עדי חתימה כרתי. The reason why by these ג' גיטין פסולים the ולד is not a ממזר, is because the חכמים were לכתחילה מתקן that these three גיטין are an exception to this rule and the ולד is כשר.<br>The reason why כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים is כשר is because there is no greater חתימה than the כתב יד of the husband himself.<br>The case of אין בו אלא ע"א is easily understood according to the opinion that it means כתב ידו וע"א. Even according to the opinion that it is כתב סופר וע"א, there are really two עדים on this גט. The כתב סופר is also testifying that the husband asked him to write the גט. Usually סופרים are meticulous in destroying גיטין written for practice. The fact that this גט is being presented (and signed by an ע"א), lends us to believe that the husband told the סופר to write the גט. It is not sufficient proof however to permit using such a גט לכחתילה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות explains that כתב ידו is אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> Why then is it a גט פסול?<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See following תוס' ד"ה כתב.</i><br>2. תוספות states that when writing גיטין להתלמד the סופרים are חוששים למכשול.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> What מכשול can there be since we are discussing the opinion of ר"מ that כתיבה לשמה is not required?!<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י.</i><br>3. What proof can be brought (from the words of ר"מ himself) to support what תוספות contends: ומיהו אין רגילות להזהר כל כך וכו'?

Line 3

<b>כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים—He wrote it in his own handwriting, but there were no witnesses</b> signed <b>on</b> the גט.<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>In the previous תוספות we learnt that the כתב יד of the בעל is as good a חתימה as any. Why therefore is a גט written in the כתב יד of the בעל, invalid? תוספות will explain that since there are no witnesses in this גט, the בעל may write whatever date he wishes. Therefore it is considered as a גט without a date; which is פסול. There are two differing opinion why a גט must be dated<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See גמרא דף יז,א.</i>; either on account of the חשש שמא יחפה or משום פירי (as will be shortly explained). תוספות will quote these two opinions and explain how they are relevant to this case of כתב בכתב ידו.<br>-----------------------<br><b>טעמא דפסול משום שיוכל לכתוב הזמן כמו שירצה והוי כאין בו זמן –<br>The reason</b> why this גט is <b>פסול</b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוספות ד"ה שלשה, that כתב ידו is אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו.</i> <b>is because he is able to write</b> in the גט <b>whatever date he desires<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">When witnesses sign on a גט they ascertain that the correct date is written. However when the husband writes the גט, even though it is כשר as far as requiring (כתיבה ו)חתימה is concerned, but no one can vouch that the correct date was written.</i> and</b> so this גט <b>is considered as</b> a גט which <b>has</b> <b>no</b> <b>date.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A גט without זמן is a גט פסול as this very משנה states.</i></b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר בשלמא למאן דאמר בפרק ב' (לקמן דף יז,א) –<br>And if you will say;</b> while <b>it is understandable according to the one who maintains in the second פרק –<br>דתקנו זמן בגיטין שלא יחפה על בת אחותו –<br>That</b> the reason the חכמים <b>instituted</b> that it is necessary to write <b>the date in גיטין; is to prevent</b> the husband <b>from covering up</b> in order to protect <b>his niece</b> whom he married.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">A man who married his niece or any other permissible relative (or very close friend), and the woman committed adultery while married to her husband; she is liable to be put to death. If the husband cares for her, however, he may (overlook the adultery and) write her a גט after the adultery; and (if) [since] there is no date on the גט, she will claim that she was divorced before the time of the adultery and therefore not מחוייב מיתה (See תוס' דף יז,א ד"ה משום that she is בחזקת גרושה וכו' עיי"ש.). In order to prevent this שמא יחפה, the חכמים instituted that the (correct) date must be written in the גט.</i><b></b> If we are to assume that this is the reason why תקנו זמן בגיטין, then, תוספות continues, it is understood that –<br><b>הכא בכתב ידו נמי איכא למיחש שמא יחפה –<br>Here in</b> the case where the husband wrote the גט <b>in his own handwriting, we are also concerned</b> <b>perhaps he will cover up</b> on his ex-wife by writing an earlier date that precedes the time of adultery and therefore the גט should be פסול –<br><b>אבל למאן דפרש התם דתקינו זמן משום פירי –<br>However, according to the one that explains there that</b> the reason the חכמים <b>instituted</b> the writing of <b>זמן</b> by גיטין <b>is on account of ‘fruit’</b><sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The husband has the rights to the produce (‘fruit’) of certain properties that the woman brought into the marriage from her estate (נכסי מלוג). This right ceases (according to this מ"ד) from the moment the גט is signed even if she did not receive the גט yet (see גמרא יז,ב and תוס' יז,א ד"ה ר"ל. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2). If there were no זמן in the גט, the husband could continue to reap and sell the produce of these fields even after the חתימה. The woman would have to prove that they were sold after the חתימה in order to retrieve her loss. This may prove very difficult since the גט has no זמן. Once the חכמים were מתקן זמן בגיטין, then the woman has to merely show that these fruits were harvested and sold after the זמן הגט, and the husband will have to repay her. </i> <b>–</b><br>According to this מאן דאמר –<br><b>קשה לרבינו יצחק מה חשש יש בכתב ידו –<br>The ר"י has a difficulty; what concern is there</b> if the גט was written <b>בכתב ידו;</b> why should the גט be פסול if it was written בכתב ידו?! There is a זמן in this גט. The husband cannot write a ‘post-dated’ גט; for it will obvious to the woman and בי"ד and it will be not acceptable.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">In addition, in a post dated גט the divorce becomes effective on the date written in the גט. The husband is entitled to the פירות until the זמן הגט. See תוס' דף יז,א ד"ה ריש לקיש, see מהר"ם שי"ף here.</i> If it is a pre-dated גט, then the husband is harming only himself. He is relinquishing his rights to the fruits for the duration between the date on the גט and the actual giving of the גט. The wife will be able to demand and collect (unjustifiably) from him (or the לקוחות) the fruits that were sold during that period. There seems no reason for concern. Why is it פסול?!<br>תוספות offers a possible explanation and will reject it:<br><b>ואם יש לחוש שיקדים זמן לטובה האשה –<br>And if there is a concern that he will pre-date the גט for the woman’s benefit</b> (as will be shortly explained) –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty with the idea that the husband is interested in the woman’s benefit –<br><b>אף על פי שבא לגרשה –<br>Even though he is in the process of divorcing her;</b> nevertheless, we can still say that he intends to help her, as תוספות explains –<br><b>ולעשות עמה קנוניא שתגבה מלקוחות שמכר להם פירות בינתיים –<br>For he wants to make a swindle</b> together <b>with her</b>; it is for their mutual benefit. תוספות explains the swindle: <b>she will collect from the customers<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The wife may claim her fruits from the customers that bought it after the זמן on the גט (as well as from her husband).</i></b> any <b>‘fruits’ that the husband sold them in the duration –<br>מאותו זמן הכתוב בגט עד עכשיו –<br>From the date</b> (which was pre-dated) <b>that is written in the גט until the present</b>, when the גט was actually written and delivered to the woman.<b></b> The בעל has the right to sell to the לקוחות the פירות נכסי מלוג of the אשה, until the date of the [actual] writing (and delivery) of the גט. If the גט was actually written and delivered to her on ט"ו חשון and the husband pre-dated the גט to ר"ח חשון; the husband has the right to sell them fruit up to ט"ו חשון. However, since the גט is pre-dated to ר"ח חשון, the wife will confront the לקוחות with this גט and demand (illegally) that they return to her any פירות that the husband sold them after ר"ח חשון. The former husband and wife will then divide this illegally acquired fruit between them<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">If the לקוחות will try to collect their loss from the husband, they may find it difficult to collect.</i>.<b></b><br>תוספות anticipates the question; it seems unlikely that a husband, who is divorcing his wife, will be in collusion with her to perpetrate a swindle on לקוחות. Nevertheless, תוספות will show that this concern is a valid one:<br><b>כמו שאנו חושדין את האשה גבי שובר כתובה בפרק שנים אוחזין (בבא מציעא דף יט,א<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא concerning a שובר לכתובת אשה is on יט,ב.</i>) –<br>Just as we suspect the wife concerning the receipt of a כתובה in פרק שנים אוחזין.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא in ב"מ quotes a ברייתא that says; if one found a receipt of a כתובה, stating that the woman (who may still be married) asserts that she received her כתובה payment from the husband; if the woman agrees that this is a valid receipt, it should be given to the husband, to keep as proof that he already paid up the כתובה, and therefore upon his demise or his divorcing his wife he will not owe her anything for her כתובה. The גמרא asks on this ברייתא, how can we return this שובר כתובה to the husband, perhaps it was written and dated in ניסן (תש"ס) and was not actually given to the husband till the receipt of the כתובה payment in תשרי (תשס"א). The woman may have sold her כתובה rights to someone between the dates of ניסן and תשרי, when she was still owed the כתובה and had the right to sell it. The person who bought the כתובה rights from this woman will be able to collect the כתובה payment upon the demise of the husband or the divorce of the wife. However if the date of the שובר is predated as stated, then after she sold the כתובה in אייר (תש"ס), the husband (or his family) will produce this receipt [after the divorce or his demise] that is dated ניסן, and will not pay the buyer the כתובה; claiming that the woman was paid for her כתובה in ניסן and she had no right to sell it in אייר. (The גמרא there answers why this is of no concern.)  </i></b> We can derive from there that even though the woman seemingly does not gain anything from having a pre-dated receipt; nevertheless we are concerned that she may make a קנוניא with her husband to defraud the לקוחות in the case of a divorce (or his demise). The same applies here.<br>תוספות will now reject this concern that the husband may predate the גט in order to enable him and his wife to swindle the לקוחות:<br><b>אם כן לא נסמוך עליו לטרוף מלקוחות מזמן הכתוב בו –<br>If indeed</b> this is the concern<b>;</b> let the חכמים institute <b>that we are not to depend on</b> the date of a גט written בכתב ידו of the husband, in regards <b>to collecting</b> the fruits <b>from the customers, from the date written in</b> such a גט. It is not necessary to invalidate a גט that is written בכתב יד הבעל, to protect the לקוחות; it would be simpler<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">A גט written בכתב יד הבעל is basically a גט כשר. There is merely a חשש that sometimes (seemingly very rarely) the לקוחות will suffer a loss. To prevent this (rare) loss to the לקוחות, it is more reasonable to bar the גט from being used as an instrument of proof, than to invalidate every proper גט that was written בכתב ידו. </i> to enact that such a גט cannot be used (regarding the לקוחות), as proof as to when the divorce took place<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it Over # 1.</i>.<b></b> The question remains; why is a גט written בכתב יד הבעל, invalid?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דודאי אינו נאמן ולכך פסלוהו דלפעמים תפסיד האשה שלא כדין –<br>And one can say; that</b> the husband <b>is certainly not</b> considered <b>trustworthy</b> when it comes to the writing the date of the גט, for the reason mentioned previously, that he may collaborate with his wife to swindle the לקוחות, <b>and therefore</b> the חכמים rendered such a גט to be <b>פסול.</b> We cannot follow תוספות previous suggestion that we not accept this גט as proof of the date of divorce, for that will complicate matters, <b>for occasionally the woman will suffer a loss unjustifiably –</b><br>תוספות explains how the woman will suffer a loss:<br><b>כשיכתוב הבעל יום שעומד בו ולא יקדים הזמן –<br>When the husband will write the actual (correct) date and he will not pre-date</b> the גט –<br><b>ואז היה לה לטרוף לקוחות מזמן הכתוב והיא לא תוכל לטרוף –<br>in which case she should be entitled to collect</b> any subsequent sold fruit <b>from the לקוחות from the date written</b> in the גט and onwards, <b>however she will not be able to collect</b> these fruits that were sold after the (true) date written in the גט –<br><b>לפי שאנו חושדין אותו שהקדים הזמן ולכך פסלוהו –<br>For we suspect him of pre-dating</b> the גט <b>and therefore</b> the חכמים <b>invalidated this</b> גט, to protect the rights of the wife. <sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot follow the option that תוספות suggested; namely that a גט בכתב ידו is not admissible evidence as far a זמן is concerned. For even though we may protect the לקוחות from a (rare) loss in the unlikely case of a swindle; however on the other hand the woman will not have any document to protect her rights when the גט is executed properly. It is not logical to institute a תקנה, which may protect a third party from a possible swindle, while denying routine justice for the woman for whom the גט is intended. There is (also) a much greater probability that the woman will be harmed, than that the לקוחות will be protected.  A woman must be given a גט, with which she can claim her פירות from the לקוחות.</i><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty. Seemingly we are making it worse for the woman. If this גט were not פסול, the פירות would belong to the woman<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">She would have to provide some outside corroborating evidence that she was indeed divorced on this day; the עדי מסירה, for instance.</i> from the date on the גט; the correct date. Now that we are invalidating this גט, the husband may continue ‘eating the fruit’, causing even greater loss to the woman. תוספות explains:<br><b>דהשתא בדין לא תטרוף האשה מזמן הכתוב כיון שהגט פסול –<br>For now the woman, justifiably, cannot collect from the לקוחות from the written date</b> (even if it is the correct date) <b>since the גט</b> was rendered <b>פסול</b> by the חכמים. The woman is not suffering any legal loss –<br><b>דדוקא בגט כשר גובה מיום הכתיבה –<br>For</b> only <b>with a גט כשר can she collect from the date</b> that is <b>written</b> on the גט. This גט, since it is פסול, does not give her any rights to the ‘fruits’. She is not losing anything; her husband did not divorce her yet.<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">Making this גט פסול is ultimately placing a restriction on the husband. He cannot give her a גט written בכתב ידו. He will have to bear the cost and time to rewrite the גט and have עדים sign it. In the duration he will still be married, and be required to fulfill all his obligations to his wife; including feeding her, etc. This will encourage husbands to write proper גיטין for their wives, which they will be able to use to collect their פירות. </i><br>תוספות offers another reason why כתב ידו is פסול:<br><b>ועוד יש לומר דחיישינן דאחר הכתיבה מיד תתפוס הפירות –<br>In addition, one can say; that we are concerned that immediately after the writing</b> of the גט; before the husband even gave her the גט, while she is still married <b>she will (</b>take the גט before it was delivered to her<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם. The תלמידי המהר"ם (as well as the מהר"ם שיף) explain this answer differently, עיי"ש.</i> and) <b>grab the ‘fruits’</b> that were bought legally, after the date of the גט, but before the גט was delivered to her –<br><b>ותאמר שכבר נתגרשה מזמן הכתוב בו:<br>And she will claim that she was already divorced from the date that was written</b> in the גט. The לקוחות will have a difficult time disproving her. If she grabbed the פירות, she will be considered the מוחזק, and she will retain the פירות שלא כדין.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of a regular גט בכתב סופר, this concern does not apply. If she grabbed the גט and there are no עדים on the גט, it is a meaningless piece of paper; if the עדים signed on the גט then indeed even if the husband did not give her the גט, nevertheless from the moment the עדים sign the גט, the husband ceases to have any rights to the פירות; they belong to the woman. See מהר"ם. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A גט written בכתב יד הבעל is פסול, because it is considered as a גט without זמן.<br>According to the מאן דאמר that זמן is required on account of the חשש of שמא יחפה; in the case of כתב ידו there certainly is the same חשש.<br>If we assume that the reason for זמן is פירי, the concern here is as follows: We are concerned that the husband may pre-date the גט in order that he and his ex-wife will make a קנוניא on the לקוחות to deprive from them the פירות they purchased in the time between the date in the גט and the actual giving of the גט. For this concern alone however, the חכמים could rule that the date in a גט, which is בכתב יד הבעל, is not acceptable as proof of the actual time of divorce. This approach, however, would cause that the woman will never have a proof of date of divorce, in a גט בכתב ידו, even if the date is correct. In summation: considering such a גט completely valid, even as a proof of date of divorce may cause the לקוחות to lose out, in the case of a קנוניא. To declare the גט valid, but it cannot be used as a proof of date of divorce, will cause the wife to routinely lose; therefore the חכמים instituted that it is a גט פסול, and the woman is not divorced, and therefore she is not yet entitled to the פירות.<br>An alternate explanation: The wife may take this גט that was written בכתב ידו, before she is actually divorced, and seize any פירות the לקוחות purchase from that day onwards (until the actual giving of the גט). She will claim that she is already divorced. The גט will support her claim that the פירות are hers.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות asked that if we are concerned about the לקוחות, we should institute that a גט בכתב יד הבעל cannot be used against the לקוחות.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> Seemingly then this גט is without זמן, concerning פירי; how can it be a גט כשר?<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם, בל"י, and  סוכ"ד.</i><br>2. In a regular גט the woman owns the פירות from the time of <sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i>חתימת העדים, even before נתינת הגט. What would the דין be in the case of כתב בכתב ידו (before the חכמים ruled that it is פסול)? Would it be the same or different? Prove your answer and explain it.<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18 and סוכ"ד אות פב.</i>
<b>יש בו זמן ואין בו אלא עד אחד—There is a date in</b> the גט, but <b>there is only one witness</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה of ג' גיטין פסולין teaches us about two similar cases; כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים and יש בו זמן ואין בו אלא ע"א (according to the מ"ד who interprets this latter case in a situation where it was written בכתב יד הבעל). תוספות will explain why it is necessary for the משנה to teach us both of these cases.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a question:<br><b>למאן דאמר כתב ידו ועד שנינו –<br>According to the one</b> who interprets this case of יש בו זמן ואין בו אלא ע"א, <b>saying</b> that the <b>משנה is discussing</b> a situation where <b>it was written in the</b> husband’s <b>handwriting<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This מ"ד is of the opinion that if it would be only כתב סופר ועד then the ולד is not כשר.</i>, and</b> in addition<b></b> a <b>witness</b> signed the גט, there will be a question; since in the case of כתב ידו וע"א it is a גט פסול, then certainly in the case of כתב ידו ואין עליו עדים it is surely פסול. Why does the משנה need to teach us that כתב ידו ואין עליו עדים is פסול?!<br>תוספות replies: the reason –<br><b>תנא כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים לאשמועינן דאפילו הכי הולד כשר –<br>The משנה teaches</b> us the case of <b>כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים</b>, is <b>to inform us that</b> even though there is no עד at all, <b>nevertheless the child</b> who will be born to this woman, after remarrying on the basis of this גט פסול, (he) will be a ולד <b>כשר.</b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה כתב that כתב ידו is אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו.</i><br>The question may be asked in reverse<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> if in the case of כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים the ולד is כשר then certainly in the case of כתב ידו וע"א the ולד would surely be כשר; why is there a need<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> to tell us this דין as well? תוספות replies: The משנה –<br><b>וסיפא דאין בו אלא עד אחד איצטריך דאפילו הכי לא תנשא לכחתחילה:</b><br><b>needs</b> to state the <b>concluding</b> case of <b>אין בו אלא ע"א; that notwithstanding</b> that there is כתב יד הבעל and an ע"א, nevertheless <b>she should initially not remarry</b> based on this גט alone for it is a גט פסול.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה כתב that the reason it is a גט פסול, is because it is כאין בו זמן.</i><b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is necessary to state the case of כתב בכתב ידו ואין עליו עדים to inform us that even if there are no עדים, nevertheless הולד כשר. Conversely it is necessary to inform us of the case of יש בו זמן ואין בו אלא ע"א, that even if it was בכתב יד הבעל, nevertheless לא תנשא לכתחילה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות at first explains why it is necessary to state the דין of כתב בכתב ידו and then afterwards explains why it is necessary to state אין בו אלא ע"א.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> Is there a reason why תוספות follows this order and not the reverse?<br>2. Once תוספות felt it necessary to explain why the משנה needs to state the case of כתב ידו ואין עליו עדים since it states already the case of כתב ידו וע"א; it is obvious that from כתב ידו ואין עליו עדים, we cannot assume that the same דין is by כתב ידו וע"א.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> Why does תוספות have to conclude and explain why it is necessary to state כתב ידו וע"א?
<b>יש בו זמן—There is a date in</b> the גט <br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>תוספות will explain the significance of adding the phrase יש בו זמן, in the case of אין בו אלא ע"א.<br>-----------------<br><b>נראה דהוא הדין דאין בו זמן –<br>It seems</b> to תוספות <b>that the</b> דין <b>would be the same if there was no date</b> in the גט; the ולד would still be כשר<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Inserting זמן in the גט is a תקנת חכמים. They are not פוסל the ולד born to a woman after she was מגורשת with a גט which has no זמן. For the reason why an ע"א is sufficient even according to ר"מ ([even] if we maintain כתב סופר ועד שנינו), see previous תוס' ד"ה שלשה.</i> –<br>Why is it necessary then, for the משנה to state the case of an ע"א in a situation where there was זמן; תוספות explains:<br><b>אלא לאשמועינן אף על גב דיש בו זמן לא תנשא לכתחילה –<br>However,</b> the purpose of stating יש בו זמן <b>is to inform us that even if there is זמן in the גט,</b> nevertheless <b>she should initially not remarry<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה שלשה for the reason.</i></b> on the basis of this גט.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה teaches us that a גט with זמן and an ע"א signed it (the ולד is כשר בדיעבד, but) nevertheless the woman may not remarry לכתחילה on the basis of this גט.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the דין in a case of כתב ידו וע"א and there is זמן; would she be permitted to marry לכתחלה?

Line 4

<b>רבי אלעזר אומר אפילו אין עליו עדים כולי—ר"א said even if there are no witnesses on</b> the גט, <b>etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our גמרא maintains that our משנה, which states that the שליח must say בפני נחתם cannot follow the view of ר"א, since ר"א maintains that חתימה is not required on a גט even מדרבנן. To support this statement, the גמרא quotes the משנה of ג' גיטין פסולין in which ר"א argues with the חכמים and maintains that they are כשרים. תוספות will be discussing two issues: A) How precisely do we derive from this משנה that ר"א does not require חתימה at all, and B) What is the status לכתחילה, of a גט without עדי חתימה according to ר"א.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר דילמא דוקא כתב בכתב ידו או בעד אחד דאיירי תנא קמא –<br>And if you will say; perhaps</b> ר"א maintains that it is a גט כשר, <b>only</b> in the cases where the גט <b>was written in the handwriting</b> of the husband <b>or when one witness</b> signed on the גט, <b>which the first תנא</b> of the משנה <b>is discussing;</b> only in these instances –<br><b>מכשיר רבי אלעזר –<br>does ר"א maintain</b> that the גט is <b>כשר.</b> In these cases there are (two) witness on the גט. In the case of כתב ידו, as תוספות mentioned previously<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">תוס' ד"ה שלשה.</i> that אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו and in the case of one witness, תוספות also explained that whether the גט was written בכתב סופר or בכתב ידו it is considered as if two עדים signed. How can we derive from this משנה that ר"א is of the opinion that even if there are no עדים at all, nevertheless the גט is כשר?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהלשון אפילו אין עליו עדים משמע דאין עליו עדים כלל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot consider the case of כתב ידו as אין עליו עדים כלל, for as תוס' ד"ה שלשה taught that כתב ידו is a case of אין לך חתימה גדולה מזו (see מהרש"א).</i> –<br>And one can say; that the expression</b> of ר"א, namely, ‘<b>even if there were no עדים’</b> signed <b>on</b> the גט; this expression <b>implies that</b> even <b>if there were no עדים at all</b> signed on the גט, nevertheless ר"א maintains that the גט is כשר. If ר"א would maintain that only in these specific cases of the ת"ק the גט is כשר, however if there were no עדים at all in the גט it would be פסול; the משנה should have just stated 'ור"א מכשיר בעדי מסירה'. The fact that the משנה added the phrase that ר"א says 'אפילו אין עליו עדים' it is כשר, from this we may infer that according to ר"א the גט is כשר even if there are no עדים at all.<br>תוספות offers an additional answer:<br><b>ועוד דקתני אין העדים חותמין על הגט אלא מפני תקון העולם –<br>And furthermore</b> we have additional proof that ר"א maintains that a גט is כשר without any עדי חתימה at all; <b>for the משנה quotes</b> ר"א saying: <b>“witnesses do not</b> really <b>have to sign on a גט;</b> they sign on a גט <b>only for the benefit of the people”.</b> This –<br><b>משמע דבעדי מסירה לחוד סגי –<br>implies that the witnesses</b> that are present when the גט <b>is delivered</b> to the woman; those witnesses <b>alone are sufficient</b> to render it a גט כשר. No עדי חתימה are required.<br>Now that we concluded that ר"א maintains that a גט without עדי חתימה at all is כשר. The question arises whether it is כשר לכתחילה or only בדיעבד<b><sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Concerning the ג' גיטין seemingly ר"א will maintain that it is כשר לכתחילה, for he disagrees with the חכמים who maintain that it is פסול לכתחילה and בדיעבד הולד כשר. See מהר"ם שי"ף for an alternate explanation as well.</i></b>.<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דאפילו לכתחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> מכשיר רבי אלעזר בעדי מסירה –<br>And it is the opinion of the ר"י that ר"א maintains that even initially</b> (the woman may remarry<b>,</b> for) the גט <b>is כשר with עדי מסירה</b> alone, without עדי חתימה <b>–<br>כדפירש בקונטרס –<br>as רש"י explained<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה ואם.</i>.</b><br>תוספות will now offer a proof to this opinion that it is כשר לכתחילה<br><b>מדקתני לקמן בפרק ב' (דף כא,ב) אין כותבין על נייר מחוק וחכמים מכשירין –<br>Since we learnt in a משנה later in the second פרק, ‘we are not to write a גט on erased parchment<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It is possible to erase something that was written in the גט (i.e. a certain stricture) after the witnesses already signed it. It will not be noticeable since the original was written on erased parchment. See רש"י on that משנה ד"ה נייר.</i> and the חכמים permit’</b> to write on erased parchment.<br><b>ואמר מאן חכמים רבי אלעזר דאמר עדי מסירה כרתי –<br>And the</b> גמרא <b>says<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">דף כב,א בסופו</i>,</b> ‘<b>who are the חכמים</b> of the משנה<b></b> that permit writing a גט on erased parchment? It is <b>ר"א who maintains that the עדי מסירה effectuate the divorce’.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">We are not concerned that anything was changed in the גט, for the עדי מסירה are present and they are aware of any restrictions or stipulations in the גט.  </i></b> This concludes the citation from the משנה and גמרא. תוספות continues:<br><b>ומשמע מכשירין וכותבין –<br>It is implicit</b> in the words of the חכמים of the משנה who say 'מכשירין' – ‘it is כשר’ (as opposed to the ת"ק who says 'אין כותבין'); that they mean to say “<b>and we</b> are permitted to <b>write</b> such a גט לכתחילה. We may infer from this, that just as we may לכתחילה write a גט on a נייר מחוק according to ר"א who maintains עדי מסירה כרתי (even though it is not permitted if we maintain עדי חתימה כרתי), similarly it is permitted according to ר"א, to write a גט לכתחילה without עדי חתימה as long as there are עדי מסירה.<br>תוספות will present a possible difficulty with this ruling that one is permitted לכתחילה to write a גט without עדי חתימה (according to ר"א):<br><b>והדתנן בהשולח (לקמן דף לד,ב) התקין רבן גמליאל שיהו העדים חותמין על הגט<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i> –<br>And concerning that which we learnt in a משנה in</b> פרק <b>השולח</b> that <b>ר"ג instituted that witnesses should sign on the גט.</b> How can we possibly say that לכתחילה it is permitted to write a גט without עדי חתימה signing?<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>לא שצריך לעשות כן אלא תיקן שילמד להם לעשות כן –<br>it is not compulsory to do so</b> (to have עדי חתימה sign); that is not what the phrase התקין ר"ג means <b>but</b> rather the word <b>תיקן</b> is to be understood in the sense <b>that he taught them to do so;</b> to have עדים sign for the benefit of the people<br><b>שלא יצטרכו לעדי מסירה כשירצו להראות לראיה השטר והגט –<br>that they should not be required</b> to depend <b>on the עדי מסירה, when</b> the recipient of the <b>שטר and the גט will want to present them as proof.</b> They will have the עדי חתימה right on the שטר.<br><b>אבל אם באים לסמוך לכתחילה אעדי מסירה סומכין:</b><br><b>However, if the</b> parties agree <b>to depend initially</b> solely <b>on the עדי מסירה</b>, and they are prepared to forgo the additional convenience of having עדי חתימה, <b>the may depend</b> on the עדי מסירה even לכתחילה without עדי חתימה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ר"א is of the opinion that even if there are no עדי חתימה on the גט it is still כשר. We derive this from his two statements in the משנה, 1) אע"פ שאין עליו עדים וכו' כשר and 2) שאין העדים חותמים על הגט אלא מפני תיקון העולם.<br>Furthermore, it is לכתחילה permitted to write a גט without any עדי חתימה, and give it to the woman. It may be to the benefit of the recipient of the שטר, that he includes עדי חתימה, He is, however, not obligated, to do so.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Do we interpret לכתחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> to mean that we may; a) לכתחילה write and give (such) a גט to the woman, b) once it was written we may give it to her without ע"ח or c) that if the woman received such a גט, she may לכתחילה remarry? Explain your answer.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות פט.</i><br>2. According to ר"א what is the דין in the case of כתב ידו ואין עליו עדים; is it כשר לכתחילה? Or are we concerned that he may tamper with the זמן?<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See רע"א, סוכ"ד, בל"י.</i><br>3. תוספות questions his premise that according to ר"א we do not require ע"ח, from the משנה which states התקין ר"ג שיהו העדים חותמין על הגט.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9.</i> Why did not תוספות pose this question from the משנה cited here, where ר"א states שאין העדים חותמין על הגט אלא מפני תיקון העולם; indicating the ע"ח are required?!<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See בית יהודה (למהריב"ן).</i>
<b>וגובה מנכסים משועבדים—And he can collect from the encumbered properties</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>A debt (חוב) may be collected from נכסים משועבדים provided that the debt was public knowledge (there is a (קול. Otherwise, in order to protect the consumers (לקוחות), a debt can only be collected from the debtor’s own assets (the בני חורי), but not from משועבדים. The קול (publicity) that there is a debt is created by the עדים. All agree that עדי חתימה create a קול and therefore a שטר with עדי חתימה can be גובה מנכסים משועבדים.<br>Our תוספות will be discussing whether עדי מסירה alone can also create this קול (according to ר"א); thereby enabling a שטר that was accompanied by עדי מסירה only, and had no עדי חתימה, to collect from משועבדים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">There is no question that the דין of עדי מסירה כרתי (according to ר"א) applies to all שטרות. The discussion at hand is only if it is also גובה ממשעבדי or only מבני חורי.</i>. This will depend on how we interpret the statement of ר"א that a גט with only עדי מסירה is כשר and it is גובה מנכסים משועבדים. The question at hand is; was ר"א referring only to the debt incurred by a גט אשה, namely the payment of the כתובה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why a כתובה may be different will be explained later in this תוספות. See footnote # 10.</i>, or was he referring to all debts, that they can all be collected from נכסים משועבדים as long as there are עדי מסירה.<br>-----------------------<br><b>לשון שני פירש בקונטרס אם שטר מלוה הוא גובה מנכסים משועבדים –<br>The second interpretation of רש"י</b> is that the statement 'וגובה מנכסים משועבדים', is to be understood, that <b>if it is a note of a loan</b> that did not have עדי חתימה, there were only עדי מסירה present, nevertheless<b></b> the מלוה <b>may collect</b> his debt even <b>from the secured properties</b> that were already sold.<br><b>וכן נראה לרבינו תם עיקר –<br>And the ר"ת agrees as well that</b> this interpretation is the <b>correct</b> one –<br><b>דאפילו בשאר שטרות גובה בעדי מסירה מנכסים משועבדים –<br>That even by</b> all <b>other documents,</b> not only by a גט אשה, <b>one may collect</b> what is owed to them <b>from the נכסים משועבדים on the basis of the עדי מסירה</b> alone, without עדי חתימה.<br>תוספות will now bring a proof to support this view:<br><b>כדמשמע בפרק בתרא (לקמן דף פו,ב) דאמר רב הלכה כרבי אלעזר בגיטין –<br>As is implied</b> further in our מסכת <b>in the last פרק where רב said; ‘the הלכה is like ר"א in</b> the cases of <b>גיטין’</b> that עדי מסירה כרתי and a גט without עדי חתימה is כשר. The גמרא there asks; do you mean to imply by this statement<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רב qualified his support of ר"א and limited it to be מכשיר only  גיטין and not other שטרות.</i>, that –<br><b>ובשאר שטרות לא והא קתני וגובה מנכסים משועבדים –<br>By other documents</b> the הלכה <b>is not</b> according to ר"א; we do require עדי חתימה! This cannot be <b>for we learnt in the משנה</b> that ר"א said; ‘<b>and he may collect from נכסים משועבדים’</b>. The same ר"א who states that a גט is כשר with עדי מסירה only, maintains as well that with such a document one may collect from נכסים משועבדים. The term וגובה מנכסים משועבדים would indicate that ר"א maintains his position that עדי מסירה כרתי by all documents that can be גובה מנכסים משועבדים, which would include שטרי חוב. Therefore if רב supports ר"א he should not limit it to הלכות גיטין alone.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there responds, that רב understands that ר"א made two separate statements; one concerning גיטין and another concerning שאר שטרות. רב agrees with ר"א only concerning גיטין.</i><br><b>אלמא דרבי אלעזר איירי נמי בשאר שטרות –<br>We can derive<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i></b> from that גמרא, <b>that ר"א is discussing other שטרות as well<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">If the phrase וגובה מנכסים משועבדים is referring only to the collection of the כתובה, the גמרא should not have asked ובשאר שטרות לא, rather the גמרא could have asked at most ולענין כתובה לא. The fact that the גמרא asks ובשאר שטרות לא proves that the גמרא understood the phrase וגובה מנכסים משועבדים to mean that any שטר with עדי מסירה (only) is גובה מנכסים משועבדים.</i></b> as גיטין.<br>תוספות asks a question:<br><b>וקשה דאמר בגט פשוט (בבא בתרא דף קעו,א) הוחזק כתב ידו בבית דין מהו –<br>And there is a difficulty; for</b> the גמרא <b>queries in</b> פרק <b>גט פשוט, ‘what is the</b> ruling if the borrower’s <b>handwriting is established in בי"ד?’<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">רשב"ם there explains this as follows: After the לוה gave the מלוה a note in his own handwriting stating that he owes him a sum of money, the לוה subsequently came to בי"ד and admitted that this is his handwriting. בי"ד then wrote (for the מלוה) a הנפק; notarizing and authenticating this כתב יד.</i></b><br><b>פירוש מהו שיגבה ממשעבדי –<br>The explanation</b> of this query is; <b>whether</b> the lender <b>may collect</b> his debt <b>from</b> נכסים <b>משועבדים</b>, since there were no עדי חתימה.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">From רשב"ם there, it is evident that the query is concerning the properties that the לוה sold after בי"ד issued the הנפק.</i><br><b>ומייתי מהך דגיטין דקתני וגובה מנכסים משועבדים –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>quotes from this משנה in</b> מסכת <b>גיטין, which states ‘and he may collect from נכסים משועבדים’;</b> from which we can derive that even though there were no עדי חתימה; nevertheless he may collect from נכסים משועבדים. This would seem to resolve the query there<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">That just as by גיטין you can collect בכתב ידו if there are עדי מסירה, here too if there is a הנפק on כתב ידו it is as good as עדי מסירה and you may collect from נכסים משועבדים, even though there are no עדי מסירה nor עדי חתימה.</i>; however –<br><b>ומשני שאני התם דאיכא כתובה –<br>The</b> גמרא <b>refutes</b> this proof by saying <b>‘it is different there</b> by גיטין, because <b>there is a כתובה</b> that was signed by witnesses, therefore she may collect from נכסים משועבדים.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2. The עדי הכתובה created a קול, therefore one may collect from נכסים משועבדים.</i> However, in the case of a regular שטר חוב, if there were no עדי חתימה, even if it was written בכתב יד הלוה and there was a הנפק (or עדי מסירה) you may not collect from נכסים משועבדים.<br>תוספות concluded quoting the גמרא in ב"ב, and will now explain the difficulty:<br><b>משמע דדוקא בגט איירי ולא בשאר שטרות –<br>It is apparent</b> from that גמרא that the phrase 'וגובה מנכסים משועבדים', <b>is concerning only a גט; and it is not</b> discussing <b>other שטרות</b> as well. This seemingly contradicts the opinion of the ר"ת (as well as the second פירוש in רש"י) that the דין of וגובה מנכסים משועבדים refers to all שטרות, and not only to collecting the כתובה with the עדי מסירה of the גט.<br>תוספות offers a alternate reading of the text to uphold his opinion<br><b>ורבניו שמואל בן מאיר גרס התם שאני התם דמשעת כתיבה שיעבד נפשיה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This is also how the text reads in our גמרות.</i> –<br>And the רשב"ם has</b> a different reading <b>of the text there</b> in ב"ב. Instead of the text reading as previously quoted in תוספות that, 'שאני התם דאיכא כתובה'; the text reads: <b>‘It is different</b> in מסכת גיטין from our query here in ב"ב, for there in גיטין, <b>from the time of writing</b> the note, <b>he subjugated himself’</b> to repay even from the נכסים משועבדים.<br><b>פירוש כשנכתב השטר נכתב כדי למוסרו בפני עדים –<br>The explanation</b> of the difference between the case in מסכת גיטין and the case in מס' ב"ב is; in מס' גיטין <b>when the שטר was written it was written</b> with the intent <b>that it be delivered in the presence of witnesses –<br>שיהו עדי מסירה במקום עדי חתימה והוי קול כאילו עדים חתומים –<br>That</b> these <b>עדי מסירה should be instead of the עדי חתימה and so there is publicity as if עדים would have signed</b> the שטר –<br><b>אבל לעיל איבעיא לן הוחזק כתב ידו בבית דין ומסר בינו לבין עצמו –<br>However, our query previously</b> in ב"ב is concerning a case where <b>his handwriting was authenticated in בי"ד,</b> but nothing more, meaning <b>that</b> the לוה <b>delivered</b> the שטר <b>to the מלוה himself</b>; there were no עדי מסירה –<br><b>ולא נתכוון אלא להודאה ולא לעשות שטר שיהיה לו קול –<br>And he had no</b> other intent <b>except to</b> formalize <b>an admission,<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">It was done in order that the מלוה be secure that the לוה will not deny the loan.</i> but he had</b> no intent of <b>creating a שטר</b> from this note <b>that it should have publicity;</b> it was merely an ‘IOU’.<br><b>והתם לא יועיל אפילו איתחזק בבית דין –<br>And in that situation even if בי"ד authenticated it, it is of no avail.</b> It will not be considered a שטר to enable the מלוה to collect from נכסים משועבדים.<br>תוספות will now mention an opposing view:<br><b>ורבינו חננאל פירש דההיא דגט פשוט (שם דף קעו,א) פליגא אההיא דמהגרש (לקמן פו,ב) –<br>And the ר"ח explained that</b> the גמרא <b>in</b> פרק <b>גט פשוט,</b> which stated that only by גט אשה are you גובה מנכסים משועבדים because there is a כתובה<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The ר"ח follows the original גירסא that תוספות quoted: 'שאני התם דאיכא כתובה'.</i>; that גמרא <b>argues against</b> the גמרא <b>in</b> פרק <b>המגרש,</b> which indicated that by all שטרות you can be גובה מנכסים משועבדים.
