<b>מעלין בדמיהן עד כדי טרפעיק—We increase their value up to a <i>Tarp’ik</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא stated that even though we are not supposed to redeem things (from נכרים) for more than their value, nevertheless we can pay up to a טרפעיק more in order to redeem them. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to what we are redeeming for an extra טרפעיק.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>מתוך פירוש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה ת"ר who writes, אע"פ ששנינו אין לוקחין אותן ביותר מדמיהן טעמא שלא יתנו לב ויטריחו לשלול ספרים.</i> משמע דקאי גם אספרים –<br>From the content of sרש"י' explanation it seems that</b> this ruling <b>applies also to ספרי תורה –<br>וקצת תימה דאיך משוה הש"ס ספרים שדמיהן יקרים –<br>And it is slightly puzzling how the גמרא can compare ס"ת, which are expensive –<br>להעלות כדי טרפעיק כמו בתפילין ומזוזות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It does not seem logical that we can add, above the market price, the same amount (a טרפעיק) for a ס"ת, which is very expensive as we will add for תו"מ, which are relatively much cheaper than a ס"ת!</i> –<br>To raise</b> the payment only <b>up to a טרפעיק, just like תו"מ,</b> which cost much less –<br><b>לכך נראה דקאי אתפילין ומזוזות:</b><br><b>Therefore it seems</b> to תוספות that this addition of only a טרפעיק is <b>regarding תו"מ,</b> however for a ס"ת it would be a greater amount.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to רש"י even for a ס"ת one may pay up to a טרפעיק more, however according to תוס' the addition of (just) a טרפעיק is regarding תו"מ only.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly תפילין are more expensive than מזוזות, so why is תוספות agreeing that we are מעלה the same טרפעיק for both תפילין and מזוזות?!

Daf 46a



Line 1

<b>אי אמר לה הכי מצי מקלקל לה—If he told her this he can ruin her</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב נחמן stated that the ruling of the משנה that one may not remarry his wife whom he divorced because of a שם רע or נדר, is only if he explicitly told her when he was divorcing her that he is doing so because of the ש"ר or נדר. The reason, says ר"נ, is because if he stated it so, he can ruin her.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה טעמא who writes; טעמא. דמתני' משום קלקולא שלא יקלקלנה על בעלה לאחר שתנשא לאחר ויאמר אילו הייתי יודע שהדברים בדאין או שהנדר יש לו הפרה אפילו היו נותנין לי מאה מנה לא הייתי מגרשיך וכן אמרתי בשעת גירושין שמפני כך אני מוציאך וכשגרשתיך היה בדעתי להחזירך אם ימצאו דברים בדאים ונמצא גט בטל ובניה מן השני ממזרין לפיכך אומרים לו קודם גירושין הוי יודע שלא תחזירנה עולמית ושוב אינו נאמן לומר כן שכיון שידע שאסור לו להחזירה אפילו לא תנשא לאחר ולא חש להמתין ולבדוק אחר הדברים גילה בדעתו שלא היתה חביבה עליו: From פרש"י it seems that without this תקנה the גט will be בטל. However תוספות disagrees. </i> There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to what מקלקל לה means and how the חכמים prevent this from happening.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>נראה דחששא זו אינה כי אם לעז בעלמא ולא שיהיה ממש גט בטל ובניה ממזרים –<br>It appears to</b> תוספות <b>that this concern</b> of מצי מקלקל לה, <b>is merely</b> that he will <b>spread a rumor</b> that her divorce is invalid, <b>but not that the גט should be actually nullified and her children</b> from her second husband will be <b>ממזרים –<br>דהא לא אמר על מנת<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">על מנת means that he states, ‘I am taking this action on the condition that this stipulation will be fulfilled’. If he would have said here, ‘I am divorcing you ע"מ that you made a נדר which I cannot nullify, or the negative rumors about you are true’, and it turned out that this stipulation is not true, the גט would be בטל. However since no clear stipulation was made, he merely stated, ‘I am divorcing you because of these reasons’, the גט will remain valid even though the reasons were not true.</i> –<br>For he did not make a stipulation</b> when he divorced her; he merely said, ‘I am divorcing you because of this reason’ –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>דאף על גב דבכמה דוכתי מהני גילוי דעת כמו שטר מברחת<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A שטר מברחת means a note where the intent is to hide one’s assets. For instance, a widow with assets, who wishes to remarry, but does not want that her new husband should have any claim to her assets, so she writes a (fictitious) deed transferring her assets to her daughter. The widow may at a later date reclaim her assets from her daughter (even against her daughter’s will), for we understand that this transfer was only to protect her assets from her new husband. This גילוי דעת is sufficient to invalidate the transfer of assets to her daughter, even if she did not make any stipulation (by saying ע"מ). </i> דהאשה שנפלו (כתובות דף עט,א) –<br>For even though in many instances a ‘revelation of one’s mindset’ is effective</b> to nullify a transaction (even without saying ע"מ), <b>like</b> the case of a <b>שטר מברחת in</b> פרק <b>האשה שנפלו –<br>וזבין ולא איצטריכו ליה זוזי דפרק אלמנה ניזונת (שם דף צז,א) –<br>And</b> in the case <b>in פרק אלמנה ניזונת, where he sold</b> his property for he needed the money to buy something else, <b>and</b> it turned out <b>that he did not need</b> the money; the rule is that the sale is nullified because of this גילוי דעת. The question is why his גילוי דעת here is not sufficient to invalidate the גט?!<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably, according to רש"י (see footnote # 1 & # 10) this גילוי דעת is the reason why the גט is בטל.</i><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>הכא ליכא למימר הכי מדבעי לרבי מאיר תנאי כפול<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">There is a general dispute between ר"מ ורבנן whether we require a תנאי כפול. According to ר"מ in order for the stipulation (תנאי) to nullify the transaction, both sides of the תנאי must be stated; i.e. ‘if these conditions will be met, the transaction is valid, and if they are not met, the transaction is nullified’. However according to the רבנן we do not require a תנאי כפול rather only one side of the תנאי needs to be said, i.e.’ if these conditions are met the transaction will be valid’. That is sufficient to nullify the transaction if the conditions are not met. It follows that in a case where the רבנן do not even require a תנאי to nullify a transaction, but a גילוי מילתא is sufficient, ר"מ would certainly not require a תנאי כפול. Later (on the עמוד ב') the גמרא states that the משנה there which ruled that one who divorces his wife because (he suspects that) she is an איילונית, he may remarry her, and we are not concerned for קלקול, since the משנה is according to ר"מ who requires a תנאי כפול and in this case he was not כופל the תנאי, so he cannot nullify the גט. The concern there by איילונית is the same as the concern here by ש"ר or נדר, therefore since we see that ר"מ requires a תנאי כפול to nullify the גט, this proves that a גילוי מילתא is not sufficient to nullify the גט. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>Here we cannot say</b> that גילוי דעת should be effective; תוספות proves this, <b>since according to ר"מ, we require a double stipulation –<br>לכך נראה דלא אתי אלא ללעז בעלמא שיוציא עליה לעז כדי להחזירה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">According to תוספות the reason we tell him that you will not ever be able to remarry this woman (even if she does not marry anyone else) is because if we permit him to remarry her, he will spread a rumor that the divorce is invalid since he realized that the stories about her were not true (and there will be a לעז on [her and] her children). However once we warn him that he will not be able to remarry her ever (regardless whether she remarries someone else or not), he will not be מוציא לעז. See footnote # 9.</i> –<br>Therefore</b> (since he cannot be מבטל the גט) <b>it appears</b> to תוספות <b>that it will only be merely a rumor; that he will spread the rumor</b> that the divorce is invalid, <b>in order to have</b> his wife <b>return</b> to him –<b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is asking what will he gain with his לעז; since according to him the גט is בטל, and she (as an אשת איש [according to him]) is living willingly with another man, so she is a סוטה who is אסורה לבעלה, how can he take her back?!</i><br><b>אף על גב דכבר נישאת לאחר שריא ליה דזנות דשוגג הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">She thought that she was מגורשת, and by a זנות בשוגג she may return to her husband. This is what he assumes.</i> –<br>And even though she already married someone else,</b> nevertheless he assumes that she is <b>permitted to him for it was a זנות בשוגג –<br>לכך אמרו חכמים דלא יחזיר דהשתא שוב לא יוציא לעז<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The reason he is מוציא לעז is in order to take her back; however once he realizes that he cannot take her back (because of this תקנת חכמים), there is no point in being מוציא לעז. </i> –<br>Therefore the חכמים ruled that he cannot take her back</b> (even if she did not remarry), <b>so now he will not be מוציא לעז.</b><br>In summation; according to תוס' if the rule would be יחזיר (if she did not remarry), he will claim the גט is void (in an attempt to take back his wife), and that will make a לעז on the children. Therefore the חכמים made a תקנה that he cannot take her back ever (even if she does not remarry), in which case there is no reason for him to be מוציא לעז, since he will never be able to have her back.<br>תוספות cites sרש"י' explanation (why there is no concern):<br><b>ורש"י פירש<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה טעמא. According to רש"י if he will challenge the גט (before the תקנה) he would be believed and the children would be ממזרים; however once there is the תק"ח that if he divorces her because of ש"ר or נדר, he can never have her back for his wife (even if she does not remarry), he will no longer be believed to challenge the גט.</i> דאפילו יאמר אילו הייתי יודע כולי אינו נאמן –<br>And רש"י explained that even if he will say; ‘if I would have known</b> that my reasons are unfounded, <b>etc.</b> (I would not have divorced her)<b>’ he would</b> (still) <b>not be believed –<br>דכיון דיודע שאסור להחזירה ולא חש להמתין ולבדוק אחר הדברים –<br>For since he knows that he is forbidden to take her back and he was not concerned to wait and verify these issues –<br>גילה בדעתו שלא היתה חביבה עליו –<br>He revealed his mind that she is not so dear to him,</b> so he will not be believed when he said. ‘if I knew this was not true I would have not divorced you’.<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">We mentioned previously (see footnote # 5) that according to ר"מ if he divorced his wife because she is an איילונית he may take her back, for we are not concerned for לעז since לא כפליה לתנאו. Seemingly in our case if not for the תק"ח there is the concern for מוציא לעז even though there was not a תנאי (for the husband maintains that his גילוי דעת is good enough to nullify the גט), so why is there no concern according to ר"מ (and he may take back the איילונית) when there was an actual תנאי (but לא כפלו)?</i><br><b>ולרבי מאיר דבעי תנאי כפול כי לא כפליה למילתיה אפילו לעז ליכא<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">In our case (not according to ר"מ) we are concerned that the husband will think that his גילוי דעת is as good as a תנאי, therefore there will be לעז, however according to ר"מ since we require a תנאי כפול, it is understood that without a תנאי כפול the גט is valid, so he cannot be מוציא לעז.</i> –<br>And according to ר"מ who requires a תנאי כפול, if he was not כופל the תנאי, there will not even be לעז –</b><br>תוספות responds to another anticipated difficulty:<br><b>והא דקאמר רבי מאיר כל נדר שצריך חקירת חכם לא יחזיר<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">From the גמרא later on the עמוד ב' when it wishes to reconcile our משנה of לא יחזיר and the following משנה where the רבנן (ר"מ) maintain יחזיר is that the following משנה is where לא כפליה לתנאיה; indicating that our משנה is where כפליה לתנאיה; however that cannot be for if כפליה לתנאיה, what would לא יחזיר accomplish, the children will be ממזרים (if it turns out that there is no נדר or ש"ר), regardless whether יחזיר or לא יחזיר</i> –<br>And this which ר"מ stated</b> in our משנה; <b>‘any נדר which</b> the woman made that <b>requires the examination of a חכם, he may not take her back’ –<br>היינו בדכפליה למילתיה<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">This means he said to her, ‘I am divorcing you because of the נדר or ש"ר, but if it weren’t for the נדר or ש"ר, I would not divorce you’ (but he never said the גט should be בטל); this is referred to as כפליה למילתיה, but if he said that if there is no נדר or ש"ר, the גט should be בטל, that is called כפליה לתנאו.</i> ולא כפליה לתנאיה<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that כפליה למילתיה ולא לתנאו will be similar according to ר"מ like a גילוי דעת according to the רבנן. Therefore we are concerned that he will mistakenly assume that since כפליה למילתיה the גט should be בטל (as if he were כפליה לתנאיה), and therefore he will be מוציא לעז; however in truth since we tell him לא יחזיר there is no concern for לעז. See footnote # 9.</i> –<br>This is in a case where he repeated the statement, but did not double the תנאי –<br>דאי כפליה לתנאיה אין מועיל מה שלא יחזיר<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">If it turns out that there is no נדר or ש"ר, the children from the new husband will be ממזרים. See footnote # 13.</i> דלעולם איכא קלקולא:</b><br><b>For if he doubled the תנאי,</b> the rule <b>that he may never take her back is ineffective, for there will always be</b> the problem of <b>קלקול.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to רש"י the concern is that he will be מבטל the גט and the תק"ח accomplishes that we do not believe him. According to תוספות the concern is for לעז, and the תק"ח assures us that he will not be מוציא לעז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות states that in our case (of מוציא משום ש"ר ונדר), a גילוי דעת is insufficient to nullify the גט (as opposed to other situations where it is sufficient). תוספות goes on to prove it.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> However תוספות does not explain why indeed a גילוי דעת is insufficient here. What could be the reason why indeed a גילוי דעת is insufficient here?!<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See אוצר מפרשי התלמוד # 69-79.</i><br>2. Will the last two questions<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11 & # 13.</i> of תוספות apply to פרש"י as well?

Line 2

<b>שלא יהו בנות ישראל פרוצות כולי—So that Jewish women should not be promiscuous, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה stated that if one is divorcing his wife משום ש"ר or because of a נדר, he may never take her back as a wife. Various תנאים in the משנה (namely ר"י, ר"מ, ר"א) qualify this rule somewhat. The גמרא cited two versions in the name of רב יוסף why this prohibition was enacted; one was because of קלקול and the other because of פריצות.<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>הני תרי לישני דרב יוסף<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’; the two לשונות are either משום קלקול or משום פריצות.</i> אליבא דתנא קמא פליגי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">They cannot argue according to ר"י (who distinguishes between נדר ברבים or not), for according to ר"י the reason is only because of פריצותא; they do not argue according to ר"מ because we have a ברייתא that ר"מ subscribes to the reason of קלקולא. Similarly ר"א also maintains קלקולא (see later in this תוספות and footnote # 16-18). Therefore we need to say that the two לשונות are arguing according to the ת"ק only.</i> –<br>These two versions of ר"י are arguing</b> (only) <b>according to the ת"ק</b> of the משנה –<br><b>דלישנא קמא סבר כיון דקתני במתניתין נמי משום שם רע –<br>The first version</b> (of קלקול) <b>maintains that since the משנה also teaches</b> regarding one who is divorcing <b>because of a ש"ר –<br>והתם אין שייך פריצות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why לא יחזיר if we assume that it is because of פריצות is that we are informing her that since you are a פרוצה (you made נדרים, etc.) therefore we are punishing you that your husband cannot take you back.</i> דמה לה לעשות אם מוציאין שם רע עליה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">However, the ל"ב (of פריצותא) maintains that somehow her actions cause it that there should be a ש"ר about her.</i> –<br>And there</b> (by ש"ר) the reason <b>of פריצות is not applicable, for what can she do if people are gossiping about her –<br>אלא טעמא משום קלקולא הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה אי for a full explanation of קלקולא.</i> –<br>But rather the reason</b> for לא יחזיר <b>is because</b> he may <b>ruin</b> her –<br><b>ולישנא בתרא סבר דבמוציא שם רע לא מצי מקלקל לה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We assume that he will never even want to take her back (even if she did not remarry). However the ל"ק (of קלקולא) maintains that if the ש"ר turns out to be false he would want to remarry his wife.</i> –<br>And the latter version</b> (פריצות) <b>maintains that by מוציא ש"ר he cannot ruin her –<br>דכיון דמשום שם רע מגרשה דעתו בכל ענין לגרשה אפילו יהא בטל –<br>For since he is divorcing her because of a ש"ר, his intent is to divorce her in any event even if</b> the ש"ר <b>is retracted,</b> therefore the reason must be because of פרוצות –<br><b>וכן בנדרים דמסתברא דחד טעמא הוי בתרוייהו –<br>And similarly by נדרים</b> the reason is because of פרוצות (and not because of קלקול) <b>for presumably there is one reason</b> (פריצותא) <b>for both</b> cases of ש"ר and נדר –<b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות just stated that the dispute between the two לשונות is only according to the ת"ק; however ר"מ subscribes to the reason of קלקולא (see footnote # 2). How then can the גמרא bring a proof to the ל"ק (that the reason of the ת"ק is משום קלקולא) from ר"מ, since ר"מ obviously subscribes to קלקולא, how is this proof לל"ק that the ת"ק subscribes to קלקולא?!</i><br><b>והשתא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות just explained that the לישנא of פרוצות claimed that by ש"ר the reason of קלקול is not applicable (see footnote # 6). This will enable us to answer the question posed in footnote # 7.</i> אתי שפיר דמייתי תניא כלישנא קמא מדרבי מאיר אתנא קמא –<br>And now it is quite justified that</b> the גמרא <b>cites a proof</b> (from a ברייתא) <b>to the ל"ק, from ר"מ to the ת"ק –<br>דלא מייתי אלא דשייך במוציא שם רע משום קלקולא והוא הדין לתנא קמא<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא is refuting the stance of the לישנא דפרוצות (who maintain that קלקולא is not שייך by ש"ר), when we see clearly that ר"מ maintains the idea of קלקולא by ש"ר, so one cannot say that it is לא שייך. [See רש"ש, who amends this line to read במוציא משום ש"ר (instead of במוציא ש"ר).]</i> –<br>For he is not offering</b> a proof that ר"מ maintains קלקול, <b>but rather that the</b> concept <b>of קלקולא is applicable by מוציא ש"ר</b> (according to ר"מ) <b>and similarly according to the ת"ק –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ללישנא בתרא דרב יוסף דטעמא משום פריצותא –<br>And if you will say; according the last version of ר"י that the reason</b> for לא יחזיר is <b>because of פריצותא,</b> but not on account of קלקולא –<br><b>מנא לן דפליגי רבנן עליה דרבי יהודה<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">ר"י maintains that if it was a נדר שידעו בו רבים (which has no הפרה) the rule is לא יחזיר because it is a פריצותא (see footnote # 2).</i> וסברי דנדר שהודר ברבים יש לו הפרה –<br>How does</b> the גמרא <b>know that the רבנן argue with ר"י and maintain that a נדר which was made in public can be annulled;</b> we know the גמרא assumes this <b>–<br>דקאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See later on this עמוד. The גמרא there states that ר"י derives his ruling that a נדר שידעו בו רבים אין לו הפרה from יהושע and the גבעונים. The גמרא asks, so how will the רבנן respond to the proof of ר"י, and it gives an answer. The fact that the גמרא asked and answered this question proves that the גמרא takes it for granted that the רבנן argue with ר"י and maintain that a נדר שידעו בו רבים יש לו הפרה. The question is why we assume that. Granted if we follow the ל"ק, we can then assume that the רבנן argue with ר"י, for if they agree with him (that a נדר שידעו בו רבים אין לו הפרה) they should have said that by a נדר שידעו בו רבים the rule is יחזיר, since he cannot be מקלקל her (for he cannot say, ‘if I would have known that this נדר יש לו הפרה, I would not have divorced her', since this נדר שידעו בו רבים cannot have a הפרה). However if the רבנן follow the ל"ב, how do we know that they maintain יש לו הפרה, since the reason is משום פריצותא, they maintain that by every נדר (and certainly by ידעו בו רבים) the rule is לא יחזיר because of פריצותא?!</i> ורבנן מי חיילא כולי –</b><br><b>For</b> the גמרא <b>states, ‘and the רבנן</b> will respond to ר"י saying, <b>‘did</b> that נדר <b>take effect, etc.’ –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהך סוגיא אתיא כלישנא קמא דטעמייהו משום קלקול<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> –<br>And one can say; that this סוגיא</b> which assumes that the רבנן argue with ר"י <b>is according to the ל"ק that the reason</b> of the ת"ק <b>is because of קלקול –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי הא דקאמר ורבנן היינו רבי מאיר ורבי אלעזר דאמרי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read דאמר (instead of דאמרי).</i> לא אסרו צריך<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">צריך means it requires a חכם to be מפיר the נדר; the husband cannot do it on his own. ר"מ maintains that only by a צריך it is לא יחזיר, however ר"א maintains that both are לא יחזיר and לא אסרו צריך אלא בפני אינו צריך. See רש"י on the משנה מה,ב ד"ה כל והלאה.</i> כולי –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say, <b>this which</b> the גמרא <b>states, ‘ורבנן’, that means</b> (not the ת"ק of our משנה, but rather) <b>ר"מ ור"א who say[s] they did not forbid צריך, etc. –<br>דקסברי<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">Regarding ר"מ we know his reason is משום קלקול (for he states so clearly in the ברייתא, and) since he does not distinguish between ידעו בו רבים and לא ידעו (only between צריך and אינו צריך) it is evident that by צריך he always maintains יחזיר even by ידעו בו since it has הפרה, not like ר"י.This proves that he follows קלקולא and not פריצותא. We cannot say that ר"מ agrees also to the reason of פריצותא, for how can he maintain that by אין צריך the rule is always יחזיר even by ידעו בו רבים (for there is no concern for קלקול), but the rule should be לא יחזיר by ידעו בו רבים on account of פריצותא. This proves that he does not agree to פריצותא at all; only קלקול. </i> טעמא משום קלקולא –<br>For they maintain the reason</b> for לא יחזיר <b>is because of קלקולא –<br>ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות will now explain how we know that even ר"א disagrees with ר"י and maintains that נדר שידעו בו רבים יש לו הפרה. Seemingly, since ר"א maintains that in all cases (whether צריך or אין צריך) the rule is לא יחזיר, so we can perhaps say that he agrees with ר"י that by a נדר שידעו בו רבים אין לו הפרה and that is why לא יחזיר, on account of פריצותא. תוספות disproves this notion. See מהר"ם.</i> בהודר ברבים קאמר דלא אסרו אלא מפני שאינו צריך –<br>For even</b> in a case of <b>הודר ברבים,</b> which ר"א may rule לא יחזיר,<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">ר"א rules that in all cases of צריך (also/even if הודר ברבים) the rule is לא יחזיר; however one should not make the mistake that the reason for לא יחזיר is because אין לו הפרה (and משום פריצות).    </i> however ר"א <b>stated that they only prohibited</b> צריך <b>because of אינו צריך;</b> this would indicate that the איסור is not because of פריצותא –<br><b>דאי ברבים אסור משום פריצותא הוי ליה למיסר לא ידעו בו רבים אטו מפני דידעו בו רבים –<br>For if a</b> נדר <b>ברבים is אסור משום פריצותא, he</b> (ר"א) <b>should have forbidden לא ידעו בו רבים on account of ידעו –<br>ולא<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The fact that ר"א only mentions צריך ואינו צריך (when he states that it is always אסור), but does not mention הודר ברבים or not, proves that ברבים is irrelevant, for every נדר has a הפרה even ברבים, not like ר"י. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> מפני שאין צריך:</b><br><b>And not</b> that צריך is אסור <b>because of אין צריך.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The two לשונות (of קלקולא and פריצותא) are only according to the ת"ק; however ר"י maintains פריצותא and ר"מ ור"א follow קלקולא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות proves that ר"א maintains קלקולא rather than פריצותא, since when he was אוסר in all cases, he was גוזר צריך אטו אינו צריך, but was not גוזר לא ידעו בו רבים אטו ידעו.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18.</i> However how is that sufficient proof; in any event he is אוסר by all נדרים, why should he choose to mention ידעו בו רבים over אין צריך?!<sup class="footnote-marker">##</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>כיון דאמרו מארץ רחוקה וכולי—Since they said, from a far land, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא taught that ר' יהודה derived his ruling that a נדר שהודר ברבים אין לו הפרה, from the story of the גבעונים, where the נשיאי העדה swore to make peace with them.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly they could have annulled the נדר; this proves that a נדר שהודר ברבים אין לו הפרה.</i> The רבנן, who disagree with ר"י and maintain that יש לו הפרה, say that the שבועה was never effective since it was mistakenly made, for the גבעונים claimed that they were from far away (not from the ז' אומות), so there was no need even for הפרה, the reason they did not kill the גבעונים is because of קדושת השם.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר בלאו הכי מי חיילא שבועה והא הוי נשבע לבטל את המצוה –<br>And if you will say; without this</b> issue that they made a false statement (so the שבועה was בטעות); <b>can this שבועה take effect, but it is a שבועה to nullify a מצוה –<br>דכתיב (דברים כ,טז) לא תחיה כל נשמה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Even if the בני ישראל would have known that the גבעונים are from the ז' אומות and swore to make peace with them (so it cannot be considered a שבועה בטעות), nevertheless their שבועה would be invalid, since they are swearing to abolish the מצוה of לא תחיה כל נשמה, that all the people of the ז' אומות must be annihilated. A שבועה לבטל את המצוה does not take effect (as the גמרא derives in נדרים יז,א).</i> –</b><br><b>For it is written, ‘you should not allow any soul to live’ –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a possible solution to his question:<br><b>ואף על גב דאמרינן בירושלמי דשביעית פרק ששי אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני –<br>And even though that in</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי in the sixth פרק of</b> מסכת <b>שביעית; רשב"נ stated –<br>שלש פרוזדוגמאות שלח יהושע לארץ ישראל עד שלא יכנסו לארץ –<br>יהושע sent three messages to</b> the inhabitants of <b>א"י before</b> the בנ"י <b>entered א"י –<br>מי שהוא רוצה לפנות יפנה להשלים ישלים לעשות מלחמה יעשה מלחמה –<br>Whoever desires to vacate, should vacate; to make peace, let them make peace; to wage war, let them wage war –<br>גרגשי פינה והלך לאפריקא –</b><br>The nation of <b>גרגשי vacated and went to אפריקא –<br>גבעונים השלימו שנאמר (יהושע י,א) וכי השלימו יושבי גבעון את ישראל –<br>The גבעונים made peace as it states, ‘and that the inhabitants of גבעון made peace with ישראל’ –<br>שלשים ואחד מלכים עשו מלחמה ונפלו –<br>Thirty one kings waged war and were defeated;</b> this would seemingly answer the question<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">It seems that if the ז' אומות wish to make peace we accept them; therefore if they would have known that they are from the ז' אומות it would not be נשבע לבטל את המצוה. This would answer the question.</i> –<br>תוספות rejects this answer:<br><b>היינו קודם שעברו את הירדן כדקאמר עד שלא יכנסו לארץ –<br>This</b> offer for peace was only <b>before</b> the בנ"י <b>crossed over the ירדן as</b> the ירושלמי <b>stated, ‘before the</b> בנ"י <b>entered the land’ –<br>אבל משנכנסו משמע שלא היו יכולין להשלים –<br>However, it seems that once the</b> בנ"י <b>entered</b> א"י <b>they could no longer make peace</b> and would have to be killed –<br><b>ולכך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is proving that once the בנ"י entered א"י the option for peace no longer existed, for if it did exist why was it necessary for the גבעונים to go through this whole charade, they could have merely said we wish to make peace. The question remains (since there is no option for peace, the מצוה of לא תחיה כל נשמה remains) so they were נשבע לבטל את המצוה, which cannot be חל; why mention that that it was a mistaken שבועה?!</i> הוצרכו להערים ולומר מארץ רחוקה באנו –<br>So therefore</b> the גבעונים <b>needed to be sly and say, ‘we came from a far land</b> and we are not from the ז' אומות’.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דעל כרחך<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות writes 'ע"כ' because according to this answer it is not understood why the גבעונים did not merely seek out to make peace. Possibly they assumed that this offer is only before the בנ"י entered א"י, as תוספות assumed previously (see footnote # 4).</i> באין רוצים להשלים כתיב לא תחיה כל נשמה –<br>And one can say that perforce we must say that</b> when the תורה writes <b>לא תחיה כל נשמה</b> that is only <b>if they do not want to make peace –<br>כדמוכחי קראי (דברים כ<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">שופטים פסוקים י-טז, reads .י. כִּי תִקְרַב אֶל עִיר לְהִלָּחֵם עָלֶיהָ וְקָרָאתָ אֵלֶיהָ לְשָׁלוֹם. יא וְהָיָה אִם שָׁלוֹם תַּעַנְךָ וּפָתְחָה לָךְ וְהָיָה כָּל הָעָם הַנִּמְצָא בָהּ יִהְיוּ לְךָ לָמַס וַעֲבָדוּךָ. יב וְאִם לֹא תַשְׁלִים עִמָּךְ וְעָשְׂתָה עִמְּךָ מִלְחָמָה וְצַרְתָּ עָלֶיהָ. יג וּנְתָנָהּ יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּיָדֶךָ וְהִכִּיתָ אֶת כָּל זְכוּרָהּ לְפִי חָרֶב. יד רַק הַנָּשִׁים וְהַטַּף וְהַבְּהֵמָה וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בָעִיר כָּל שְׁלָלָהּ תָּבֹז לָךְ וְאָכַלְתָּ אֶת שְׁלַל אֹיְבֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר נָתַן יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ לָךְ. טו כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְכָל הֶעָרִים הָרְחֹקֹת מִמְּךָ מְאֹד אֲשֶׁר לֹא מֵעָרֵי הַגּוֹיִם הָאֵלֶּה הֵנָּה. טז רַק מֵעָרֵי הָעַמִּים הָאֵלֶּה אֲשֶׁר יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ נֹתֵן לְךָ נַחֲלָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה כָּל נְשָׁמָה.</i>) וקראת אליה לשלום וגומר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">It seems that תוספות understands פסוקים י, יא to apply to all wars even against the ז' אומות. The difference between the ז' אומות and other nations is only if they chose to wage war, in which case by the other nations you make take the woman and children, but by the ז' אומות the rule is לא תחיה כל נשמה [פסוק טז is effective only after פסוק יב.]. </i> ואם לא תשלים עמך וגומר –<br>As is evident from the פסוקים;</b> the פסוקים begin, ‘<b>and you shall call out to her for peace, etc. and if they will not make peace with you, etc.;</b> the פסוקים continue –<br><b>רק מערי העמים וגומר לא תחיה כל נשמה –<br>Only from the cities of the nations, etc. leave no one alive’ –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי טעמא דרבי יהודה הא ודאי שבועה בטעות הואי<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It is obvious that this was not a valid שבועה, so the reason the בנ"י, did not kill the גבעונים is not because of the שבועה per se (since it is a שבועה בטעות), but rather (as the חכמים say) because of קדושת השם, so how does ר"י derive from here that נדר שהודר ברבים אין לו הפרה?!</i> –<br>And if you will say; what is the reasoning of ר"י</b> (that he derives from this story that נדר שהודר ברבים אין לו הפרה); <b>but is was certainly a mistaken שבועה –</b><br>An additional question:<br><b>ועוד לרבי יהודה איך הניחום בארץ הכתיב (שמות כג,לג) לא ישבו בארצך וגומר –<br>And furthermore how, according to ר"י, did the</b> בנ"י <b>allow the</b> גבעונים to live in <b>ארץ</b> ישראל; but it is <b>written, ‘they shall not live in your land, etc.?!</b><br><b>והוה ליה נשבע לבטל את המצוה ועל כרחך משום חילול השם הוא כדאמרי רבנן –<br>So</b> it is a case of <b>swearing to be מבטל a מצוה</b> which is ineffective, <b>so perforce</b> we must say <b>like the רבנן say,</b> that they kept the ‘oath’ only <b>because</b> otherwise it would be a <b>חילול השם!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דקסבר רבי יהודה דאי איתא דיש לו הפרה לא היה בדבר חילול השם<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">According to the רבנן there was no valid oath, nevertheless they kept it because of חילול השם; the nations would say that the בנ"י do not keep their oaths. ר"י however maintains that there would not be a חילול השם for they can understand that under certain conditions oaths can be annulled. However if the rule is that a נדר שהודר ברבים אין לו הפרה, there would be a חילול השם, for people will say since it is a נדר שהודר ברבים then even if it is a נדר בטעות or לבטל המצוה, etc. it still cannot be annulled, so if the בנ"י would not have honored their שבועה there would be a חילול השם.</i> –<br>And one can say; that ר"י maintains that if it is so that a</b> נדר שהודר ברבים <b>יש לו הפרה, there would not be a חילול השם</b> if they annulled the נדר –<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר בלא חילול השם נמי אין יכולין להורגן כיון דבאין להתגייר –<br>And if you will say; even without</b> the reason of <b>חילול השם,</b> the בנ"י <b>could not have killed</b> the גבעונים <b>since they came to convert –<br>כדאמרינן לעיל (דף מה,א) לא ישבו בארצך פן יחטיאו אותך לי –<br>As</b> the ברייתא <b>stated previously</b> on the פסוק, <b>‘they should not settle in your land, lest they cause you to sin against me’,</b> the ברייתא states –<br><b>יכול בעובד כוכבים שקיבל עליו שלא לעבוד עבודת כוכבים כולי –<br>I may think</b> that this applies even to a <b>נכרי who accepted upon himself not to worship idols, etc.</b> so we derive from another פסוק that they may remain in the land –<br><b>ואמרינן נמי בפרק אלו נאמרין (סוטה דף לה,ב) –<br>And</b> ר' שמעון <b>also stated in פרק אלו נאמרין –<br>וכתבו להן מלמטה למען<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">דברים (שופטים) כ,יח.</i> אשר לא ילמדו אתכם לעשות וגומר –<br>And they wrote<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to the ס"ת which was written on סיד (according to ר"ש) so the אומות העולם could learn from it, עיי"ש.</i> on the bottom for</b> (the nations), ‘<b>in order that they should not teach you to do, etc.</b><br><b>הא למדת שאם חוזרין בתשובה שמקבלין אותן וההוא קרא בז' אומות כתיב –<br>You may derive from this that if they would repent that we would receive them, and that פסוק</b> (of אשר לא ילמדו and לא ישבו) <b>was written regarding the ז' אומות,</b> the question is why the need to mention חילול השם –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאי לאו חילול השם נהי שלא היו יכולין להרגן<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> היו יכולין לגרשן מעריהם –<br>And one can say, that if not for חילול השם,</b> so <b>granted that they would not be able to kill the</b> גבעונים (as תוספות just proved), nevertheless <b>they could have chased them away from their cities</b> (in which the בנ"י lived) –<br>An alternate answer:<br><b>ועוד דבאותה שעה לא באו להתגייר<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם that the first two questions of תוספות assumed this last answer that באותה שעה לא באו להתגייר. </i> כי אם אחרי כן:</b><br><b>And additionally at that time they did not come to be מתגייר</b> (only not to be killed), <b>but rather it was only later</b> that they agreed to be מתגייר.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The rule of לא תחיה כל נשמה is only if they chose not to make peace. One may not kill anyone even from the ז' אומות if he wishes to be מתגייר. There would not have been a חילול השם according to ר"י if they were able to be מפיר the נדר שהודר ברבים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes (in one answer) that indeed they could not kill the גבעונים, since they came להתגייר, but they could have chased them out of the cities.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> However the גמרא states explicitly that they did not kill them because of קדושת השם?!<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש.</i>

Line 8

<b>רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר שלשה—Rav Nachman Bar Yitzchok </i>said, three</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' יהודה ruled that a נדר שהודר ברבים has no הפרה. The גמרא asked what is considered a רבים. According to רנב"י it means three people. תוספות discusses what are the requirements for a נדר על דעת רבים (which has no הפרה).<br>------------------------------<br><b>נראה דעל דעת רבים לא בעי אלא שנים –<br>It is the view</b> of תוספות that a נדר <b>על דעת רבים only requires two</b> people, not three –<br><b>דבפרק שבועת הדיינין (שבועות דף לט,א) כשאמר להם משה לישראל –<br>For in פרק שבועת הדיינים,</b> the גמרא states, <b>when משנה told the Jews –<br>הוו יודעים שלא על דעתכם אני משביע אתכם וכולי –<br>‘You should know that I am not adjuring you according to your mind, etc.,</b> but rather according to my mind and the mind of הקב"ה’ <b>–<br>ופירש שם בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">We do not find this in our texts of רש"י.</i> דהיינו על דעת רבים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The שבועה there was made על דעת of two, הקב"ה ומשה; proving that for ע"ד רבים two is sufficient.</i> –<br>And רש"י explained there that</b> משה meant to say that <b>it is על דעת רבים –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ומיהו לפי זה לא היה היתר לחרמות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Under various circumstances the communities would make certain restrictions and sanctions and would say that this is being done ע"ד המקום וע"ד הקהל (similar to what we say before כל נדרי). If this is considered ע"ד רבים there will be no way to nullify it.</i> בזמן הזה –<br>However according to this</b> understanding that two are sufficient to make it a נדר ע"ד רבים, which has no הפרה, <b>there would be no היתר for חרמות nowadays –</b><br>תוספות offers his explanation:<br><b>ונראה דלא אמר משה כן אלא שלא יערימו כדמפרש התם משום קניא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A מלוה claimed that his debt was not paid and the לוה said that he paid it and was willing to swear. What happened is that the לוה came to בי"ד with a hollowed out reed using it as a cane. He filled the cane with the money he owed the מלוה, and asked the מלוה to hold the cane for him. Therefore he was willing to swear that he paid the מלוה. Obviously after he swore he took back the cane. Therefore it is important for the בי"ד to say לא על דעתך משביעים אותך אלא על דעתנו not to make it ע"ד רבים, but to insure that there is no הערמה.</i> דרבא –<br>And it is the view</b> of תוספות <b>that משה did not say this</b> (לא על דעתכם וכו' אלא ע"ד המקום וכו') in order to make it a נדר ע"ד הרבים, <b>but rather so that they should not be deceitful as</b> the גמרא <b>explained there, because of the reed of רבא –<br>וכן עתה אין עושין אלא בשביל כך –<br>And similarly now we do not do this</b> (saying על דעתנו), <b>only because of this</b> concern for הערמה, but not to make it a נדר ע"ד רבים.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> על דעת יחיד נמי לא יהא לו הפרה כיון דתלה בו נדרו –<br>And if you will say;</b> that in a case where he makes the נדר <b>ע"ד one</b> individual <b>it should also not have a הפרה, since he make his נדר dependent on this</b> person –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמבטל דעתו משום רבים ולא משום יחיד:</b><br><b>And one can say that</b> a person <b>nullifies his mind to many, but not to an individual.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to רש"י when משה (or a בי"ד) state לא על דעתך וכו' it is in order to make this a נדר ע"ד רבים, while according to תוספות it is to prevent deceit.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According the מסקנא of תוספות, how many are required to make it a נדר ע"ד רבים (since he disagrees with פרש"י)?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i><br>2. Is there any connection between תוספות question, וא"ת כו',<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> with that which תוספות stated previously?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>הנודר כאילו בנה במה—One who makes a vow is as if he built a <i>Bomoh</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' נתן taught that one who makes a vow is sinning as if he bult a במה (at the time when במות are prohibited)<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">E.g. After the ביהמ"ק was built.</i>. תוספות explains the connection between נודר and (building) a במה<br>------------------------------<br><b>מפרש רבינו אליהו משום דאתיא בגזירה שוה דחדלה –<br>ר"א explained because we derive</b> the connection between נדר and במה <b>through the גז"ש</b> of the word <b>חדלה (refraining) –<br>כתיב הכא (דברים כג,כג) כי תחדל לנדור<br>It is written here</b> regarding נדרים, ‘<b>if you will refrain from making a vow’ –<br>וכתיב התם<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The entire פסוק reads; חִדְלוּ לָכֶם מִן הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר נְשָׁמָה בְּאַפּוֹ כִּי בַמֶּה נֶחְשָׁב הוּא.</i> (ישעיה ב,כב) חדלו לכם מן האדם וגומר כי במה נחשב הוא –<br>And it is written elsewhere, ‘you should refrain from</b> listening to <b>a person, etc. for what is his importance’ –<br>ודרשינן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ברכות יד,א. The גמרא there interprets this דרשה regarding one who gives שלום to his friend before תפילה (שחרית). </i> אל תיקרי במה אלא במה</b> (ב' ומ' קמוצים) <b>–</b><br><b>And we expound</b> the word במה, saying <b>do not read it</b> as <b>במה</b> (what is he)<b>, but rather read it as במה</b> (a private altar) –<br><b>ובריש פרק ארבעה נדרים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> (נדרים כב,א) יליף בהאי גזירה שוה דנקרא רשע –<br>And in the beginning of פרק ארבעה נדים</b> the גמרא <b>derives through this גז"ש</b> of חדלה <b>that</b> one who is נודר <b>is called a wicked</b> person; for it says חדל by נדר –<br><b>דכתיב שם רשעים חדלו רוגז (איוב ג,יז):</b><br><b>And it is</b> also <b>written, ‘there the רשעים refrain from</b> their <b>anger’.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The connection between נדר and במה (as well as רשע) is based on the גז"ש of חדלה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why was it necessary for תוספות to cite the גמרא in נדרים;<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> what does that add?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

<b>המוציא אשתו משום אילונית—One who divorces his wife because she is an אילונית</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה is discussing one who divorced his wife because she was an אילונית. Our תוספות examines whether an אילונית requires a גט or is it קדושי טעות.<br>---------------------------<br><b>משמע<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The phrase 'המוציא אשתו וכו', while it may not mean unequivocally with a divorce, it certainly indicates a גט, for otherwise what is the meaning of מוציא; she is not married to him, he has no need to send her away. Additionally why would ר' יהודה maintain לא יחזיר, if she is not married to the first husband, the children of the second husband will not be ממזרים at all. Finally the משנה later states והיא תובעת כתובתה from the first husband, if no גט is required how can there be a כתובה. Therefore we must conclude that our משנה maintains that an אילונית requires a גט.</i> הכא דאילונית בעיא גט –<br>It seems</b> from the משנה <b>here that an אילונית requires a גט,</b> (meaning that even though the husband was not aware that she is an אילונית, nevertheless she is considered married to him and in order to marry someone else she requires a גט) –<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה דבריש יבמות (דף ב,ב) משמע דלא בעיא גט דהוו קדושי טעות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Had he known that she was an אילונית, he never would have married her. </i> –<br>And it is astounding; for in the beginning of</b> מסכת <b>יבמות it seems that</b> an אילונית <b>does not require a גט, since it is a mistaken קידושין.</b> תוספות explains his proof –<br><b>דתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is for instance there were two brothers ראובן and שמעון, where ראובן had two wives רחל and לאה; one of them (רחל) was the daughter of שמעון. In a ‘regular’ case where ראובן died childless, normally שמעון would be מייבם his wife; however here since one of sראובן' wives (רחל) is sשמעון' daughter, and we derive from a פסוק that not only can he not be מייבם his daughter (רחל), but he also cannot be מייבם the other (non-related) wife (לאה), the צרה. Both wives are exempt from יבום (and חליצה). However if the related wife (רחל) died prior to her husband’s death, שמעון can be מייבם the other (non-related) wife (לאה), since at the time of sראובן' death (when the חיוב יבום came into effect) רחל was already dead. The same rule applies if רחל was found to be an אילונית, then שמעון can be מייבם לאה, for רחל was never sראובן' wife since it is קדושי טעות, and obviously no גט is required. This contradicts our משנה which maintains that an אילונית requires a גט.</i> וכולן שמתו או שמיאנו או שנמצאו אילונית צרותיהן מותרות –<br>For the משנה teaches, and all of them who died or were ממאן, or were found to be אילונית, there rival</b> wives <b>are permitted</b> to be מתייבם.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהכא מיירי בספק אילונית ומוציאה משום חשש אילונית –<br>And one can say that here</b> in our משנה <b>we are discussing a possible אילונית and he is divorcing her because of</b> his <b>concern</b> that she may be an <b>אילונית,</b> therefore she requires a גט for it is not קדושי טעות (with a certainty) –<br>תוספות proves that we are discussing a ספק אילונית:<br><b>תדע מדקתני סיפא נישאת לאחר והיו לה בנים ואילו ודאי אילונית אין לה רפואה –<br>You should know</b> that we are discussing a ספק אילונית, <b>since in the סיפא</b> of our משנה <b>it states, ‘she married another</b> person <b>and she had children</b> from him’, this proves that she was not a ודאי אילונית , <b>for a ודאי אילונית cannot be healed;</b> she will always be barren. תוספות goes on to prove that a ודאי אילונית אין לה רפואה –<br><b>מדפליגי רבי יהושע<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read ר' אליעזר (instead of ר' יהושע).</i> ורבי עקיבא בהערל (שם דף עט,ב) בסריס חמה דיש לו רפואה –<br>Since (ר"י) [ר"א] ור"ע argue in</b> פרק <b>הערל regarding a born eunuch who can be healed,</b> whether <b>–<br>וחולץ וחולצין לאשתו ובאילונית לא פליגי –</b><br><b>He can</b> perform <b>חליצה and whether חליצה can be performed on his</b> widowed <b>wife, however they do not argue regarding an אילונית,</b> all agree that there is no requirement to give her חליצה, the reason for this is - –<br><b>ודרשינן בפרק קמא דיבמות (דף יב,א) אשר תלד פרט לאילונית<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The reason no one discusses the status of an אילונית regarding חליצה (as they discussed the status of a סריס) is because since an אילונית can not bear a child she is excluded from the פרשה of יבום וחליצה. The fact that we exclude an אילונית because of אשר תלד, proves that she can never bear children; otherwise why exclude her.</i> –<br>As we expound in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>יבמות,</b> the פסוק of <b>אשר תלד (which she will give birth to) to exclude an אילונית</b> (who cannot bear a child), from the whole פרשה of יבום וחליצה. Therefore an אילונית ודאי does not require a גט, for it is קדושי טעות (since she can never bear children) however our משנה is discussing a ספק אילונית, therefore a גט is required.<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמר (שם דף סד,ב) שרה אמנו אילונית היתה אין מזכירין מעשה נסים –<br>And this</b> which רב נחמן <b>states that our matriarch שרה was an אילונית</b> (even though she later had a child; which seemingly contradicts this which תוספות maintains that an אילונית cannot bear a child); this is not a question because <b>we do not mention miracles</b> (שרה gave birth through a נס; naturally she was incapable of having children) –<br><b>כדאמרינן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">There is a dispute there regarding the מרה (the gall bladder) whether the animal is a טריפה if the מרה was perforated. The גמרא asks, ‘but איוב stated that his מרה spilled out to the ground and nevertheless איוב did not die’; this would indicate that ניקבה המרה is not a טריפה. The גמרא answered אין מזכירין מעשה נסים.</i> גבי איוב בריש אלו טריפות (חולין דף מג,א) –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states regarding איוב in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>אלו טריפות –</b><br>תוספות anticipated another difficulty:<br><b>והא דפליגי בהמדיר (כתובות דף עג,א) בקדשה על תנאי וכנסה סתם דבעיא גט –<br>And regarding this which</b> רב and שמואל <b>argue in</b> פרק <b>המדיר</b> in a case where a person <b>was מקדש</b> a woman <b>with the stipulation</b> that she has made no vows, <b>and he married her סתם</b> (without mentioning his תנאי); רב maintains <b>that she requires a גט –<br>משום דאין אדם עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The question is just like there we say she is מקודשת since אין אדם עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות (even though initially he made a תנאי, nevertheless we say that once he was בועל he meant it for קידושין, regardless of the תנאי), the same should apply here, that when he was כונס her he did it לשם קידושין so that even a ודאי אילונית should require a גט?! [In fact רש"י בד"ה משום actually states this as he writes, ומ"מ צריכה הגט דאין אדם עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות ובעל לשם קידושין.] This could also resolve the contradiction mentioned in the beginning of תוס' that in מסכת יבמות there was only אירוסין and therefore it is קדושי טעות, however here there was נישואין and since א"א עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות she requires a גט. See מהר"ם שי"ף.  </i> –<br>Because a person does not make his בעילה a promiscuous ביאה</b> and the ביאה was made לשם קידושין –<br>תוספות responds<br><b>היינו בשאר מומין דמחיל אבל באילונית לא מחיל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">By other מומין (like נדרם) even though initially he would not want to marry her if she has these מומין, for he explicitly made a תנאי, nevertheless at the time of ביאה, he forgoes his תנאי and (even though the original קידושין will not be חל since she has these מומין, nevertheless) he is בועל her now לשם קידושין. However the מום of אילונית is so great that even though he never made a תנאי that she is not an אילונית, nevertheless a regular person will never agree to marry an אילונית and even when he is בועל, he would rather that this בעילה be a בעילת זנות than to be מקדש an אילונית. This assumption is so strong that we do not even require a תנאי.</i> –<br>When</b> do we say אין אדם עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות <b>by other blemishes</b> (like נדרים) <b>where he</b> is willing <b>to forgo</b> his תנאי by the בעילה, <b>however regarding an אילונית he is not מוחל</b> and is not בועל לשם קדושין if she is an אילונית –<br>תוספות offers another distinction:<br><b>ועוד דמומין מסיק אדעתיה שמא לא יתקיים התנאי דשכיחי ובועל לשם קדושין<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">He made a תנאי, presumably because he was somewhat suspicious that she may have this מום, therefore בשעת ביאה he is concerned perhaps she has this מום and it will be a ביאת זנות, so he is בועל לשם קידושין.</i> –<br>And furthermore by</b> regular <b>מומין he is aware that perhaps the תנאי will not be fulfilled</b> (she will have נדרים) <b>for it is common</b> for women to have this מום, so he is aware that his initial קדושין may be invalid <b>and</b> therefore <b>he is בועל לשם קדושין –<br>אבל אילונית דלא שכיח לא מסיק לבעול לשם קדושין<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">He made no תנאי and it is the furthest thing from his mind that she may be an אילונית (since it is לא שכיח), therefore he is בועל על דעת קידושין הראשונים, and he is not בועל לשם קידושין. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>However regarding an אילונית, which is uncommon it does not enter</b> his mind <b>to be בועל לשם קדושין –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a further difficulty:<br><b>והא דתנן פרק אלמנה ניזונת (שם ק,ב) הממאנת והשניה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">A שנייה is a ‘secondary’ ערוה, which is אסור only מדרבנן; for instance a man’s grandmother.</i> והאילונית אין להן כתובה –<br>And</b> regarding <b>this which the משנה taught</b> in <b>פרק אלמנה ניזונית that a ממאנת and a שניה and an אילונית, receive no כתובה</b> payment if divorced or widowed –<br><b>דמשמע אבל גיטא בעי –<br>Which indicates that they require a גט.</b> This is in contradiction to what<b></b> תוספות<b></b> maintains that an אילונית is קידושי טעות and does not require a גט.<br>תוספות proves that this is the general inference when it states אין לה כתובה (that a גט is required)<b>:</b><br><b>דהכי דייק בהמדיר<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there (עב,ב) states if a man had נישואין, without making any stipulations (כנסה סתם) and it was realized later that she had נדרים the rule is תצא בלא כתובה. The גמרא infers from this that she has no כתובה, but she requires a גט. The same inference should be made regarding the אילונית in פרק אלמנה ניזונית which תוספות cited. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2. </i> (שם דף עג,א) גבי כנסה סתם ונמצאו כולי –<br>For this is what</b> the גמרא <b>in פרק המדיר infers regarding</b> the משנה of <b>כנסה סתם ונמצאו, etc.</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>משום שניה נקט הכי דעל כרחך ממאנת<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">A ממאנת refers to a קטנה who was married מדרבנן through her mother or brothers. The rule is that whenever she wants she can say that she refuses (ממאנת) to be with her husband and she is no longer married to him. Obviously the phrase אין להן כתובה regarding the ממאנת cannot be inferred to mean הא גיטא בעיא, because a ממאנת does not require a גט, therefore we can equally say regarding an אילונית that this inference does not apply to her either; it only applies to a שניה, who indeed requires a גט.</i> לא בעיא גט –</b><br>This implied inference of הא גיטה בעיא <b>is only regarding a שניה</b> (but not for an אילונית) <b>for perforce you must say that a ממאנת does not require a גט</b> and neither does an אילונית –<br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי בהמדיר לא דייק אלא משום דתני ברישא אינה מקודשת ובסיפא תצא שלא בכתובה –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say <b>that the only reason the</b> גמרא <b>makes this inference in</b> פרק <b>המדיר</b> (that כתובה הוא דלא בעיא הא גיטא בעיא) <b>is because in the רישא</b> of the משנה <b>it states, ‘she is not מקודשת’</b> (which mean no גט is required) <b>and in the סיפא</b> it states differently, <b>תצא בלא כתובה</b> (but it does not state אינה מקודשת; indicating that there is קדושין, and a גט is required); however in the משנה in אלמנה ניזונית where there is no statement of אינה מקודשת, only the statement of אין להן כתובה, that is insufficient to infer that גיטה בעיא.<br>תוספות anticipates one more final question:<br><b>והא דאמרינן (יבמות סא,ב) קטן וקטנה לא חולצין כולי קטנה שמא תמצא אילונית<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">There is no מצות יבום by an אילונית, therefore if he is מייבם her he will be מייבם his brother’s wife שלא במקום מצוה, which is a חיוב כרת.</i> –<br>And regarding</b> the ברייתא which <b>states that we do not perform חליצה by a קטן וקטנה</b> and also no יבום<b>,</b> the reason given why there is no יבום, is that the <b>קטנה may turn out to be an אילונית –<br>ולא אמרינן תתייבם ממה נפשך דאי אילונית היא הרי הן קדושי טעות ושריא לשני –<br>But why do we not say that</b> this קטנה <b>should be מתייבם in any case. For if she is an אילונית.</b> her קידושין to the deceased brother <b>was קדושי טעות so she is permitted to marry the second brother</b> (she is not אשת אחיו)?! This would seem to disprove תוספות that by an אילונית it is קדושי טעות!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דהתם בדקבלה עילויה<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore she is אשת אחיו, and if she turns out to be an אילונית he will be מייבם אשת אחיו שלא במקום מצוה.</i> וכהאי גוונא משני בפרק<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא cited a משנה which states that if someone married a girl three years or older she is considered an אשת איש and who ever lives with her is חייב מיתה. The גמרא asked how can we kill him since she may be an אילונית. The גמרא concluded that it is in a case where קבלה עילויה.</i> בן סורר (סנהדרין דף סט,ב):</b><br><b>The ר"ת explains that there</b> the case is where the deceased brother <b>accepted to</b> marry this קטנה even if she should turn out to be an אילונית<b>, and we use this answer also in פרק בן סורר.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות maintains that an אילונית does not require a גט even if there was ביאה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות offers two explanations why regarding an אילונית we do not say א"א עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8 & 10.</i> Is there any advantage of one answer over the other, and is there any נפקא מינה between the two answers?<br>2. תוספות asks a question from פרק אלמנה ניזונית where it states regarding an אילונית that אין להן כתובה; inferring that they require a גט, in contradiction to תוספות opinion.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 12.</i> Why does not תוספות answer here (as he answered before) that the משנה in אלמנה ניזונית is referring to a ספק אילונית?!<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א, מהר"ם, מהר"ם שי"ף.</i>

Line 6

<b>אומר לה שתיקותיך יפה מדבוריך—He says to her; your silence is better than your talking</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' יהודה rules in our משנה that if someone divorces his wife because she is an אילונית,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">He is not obligated to pay her כתובה, if she is an אילונית (and he was not aware until after the wedding).</i> he may never take her back as a wife. If she married someone else and bore children, and demands her כתובה payments from her first husband, ר"י rules that the (first) husband says to her שתיקותיך יפה מדיבוריך; meaning that if you persist in claiming the כתובה, I will be מבטל the גט, for I only divorced you because I assumed that you were an אילונית, but now that it turns out that you are not an אילונית, I may be מבטל the גט (and your marriage to the second husband will be null and the children will be ממזרים). This is how he is able to deny her request by making this threat. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with seemingly contradictory גמרות.<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ואם היא שתקה אנן מי שתקינן –<br>And if you will say; and if she is quiet, will we be quiet –<br>דהכי פריך רב פפא בסוף פרק הבא על יבמתו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא there states if a woman married two men (consecutively) and bore no children, she should not marry a third person (who is childless) and if she marries him she leaves without a כתובה. The גמרא asked what if she married a fourth person and had children from him, can she go back and claim her כתובה from her third husband (for we now see that she can bear children). The גמרא there answers (similar to here) that we say to her שתיקותיך יפה מדיבוריך; meaning that the third husband may nullify the גט, so therefore release your claim (see ‘Overview). רב פפא challenged this answer saying; אי איהי שתקא אנן מי שתקינן! The point ר"פ is making is if the husband has a valid claim that he can nullify the גט by saying, ‘I only divorced you because you could not have children, but had I known that you can bear children I would not have divorced you’, thereby nullifying the גט, this argument can seemingly be made by us the בי"ד; why does not the בי"ד say that the גט is בטל since he divorced her under a mistaken assumption. The fact that we do not say this, indicates that this claim is meaningless, that he certainly divorced her regardless whether she can or cannot have children, so since he has no threat against her; what is the meaning of שתיקותיך יפה מדיבוריך?! The same question that רב פפא asked there, we can ask here. Since we the בי"ד do not claim that the divorce by the first husband to the אילונית is void (even though she had children from the second husband), so how can he threaten the אילונית, since we assume that the divorce is binding (see מהר"ם). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> (יבמות דף סה,א) גבי נשאת לרביעי והיו לה בנים –<br>For this is what רב פפא asks in the end of פרק הבא על יבמתו regarding the case where she married a fourth</b> husband <b>and bore children</b> to him –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהתם נמי לא הוי אלא לעז דהא סתם גירשה ולא התנה כדפרישית הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' מו,א ד"ה אי (regarding המוציא משום נדר) that the concern is only for לעז, but not that he can be מבטל the גט.</i> –<br>And one can say that there too</b> (in יבמות) we are <b>only concerned for rumor mongering,</b> but not to nullify the גט<b>, since he divorced her explicitly without making any stipulations</b> or reasons, <b>as I explained here –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">We are now saying that when the גמרא writes שתיקותיך יפה מדיבוריך, it means that he is threatening her that if she will demand her כתובה, he will be מוציא לעז on the גט. How is it then that ר"פ asks אי איהי שתקא אנן מי שתקינן, does he mean that the בי"ד should threaten her that they will be מוציא לעז on the גט; this is inconceivable!</i><br><b>ופריך רב פפא דהוה לן לתקן נמי התם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In a case where she was twice married without bearing children the rule should be that if a third person marries her (בדיעבד) he should be told that if he divorces her he can never take her back; in which case there will be no לעז.</i> דלא יחזיר שלא יהא לעז כדתקין הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The תקנה of לא יחזיר prevents a לעז. The reason he is מוציא לעז is in order to take her back; however once he realizes that he cannot take her back (because of this תקנת חכמים), there is no point in being מוציא לעז. </i> –<br>And sרב פפא' question was that</b> that the חכמים <b>should have enacted also there that he cannot take her back in order that there should be no לעז as they instituted here</b> (by אילונית, etc.) –<br><b>ומשני אלא ודאי בלאו הכי אפילו לעז ליכא דהשתא הוא דברית<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">There is no לעז because he cannot say that ‘if I would have known that you can bear children I would not have divorced you’, because we will say that indeed when he divorced her she was incapable of having children (so the גט is valid), and later (when she married the fourth husband) she was healed, and was able to bear children. See footnote # 17.</i> –<br>And</b> the גמרא there <b>answers that even without</b> the תקנה of לא יחזיר, <b>there certainly will not be even a לעז,</b> for we will say, <b>that she became healthy now</b> when she married the fourth man<br><b>ומהאי טעמא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">She cannot say, ‘I deserve a כתובה from my third husband since I can bear children’, because we will say that when you were divorced, you were indeed incapable of bearing children (because of some illness or malfunction) and only now were you healed, therefore his divorce was justified and you have no claim for a כתובה payment.</i> לא מצי למתבע כתובה –<br>And for this</b> very same <b>reason she cannot claim her כתובה</b> from the third husband –<br>תוספות explains now why here we do not say איהי שתקה אנן מי שתקינן:<br><b>אבל הכא אם היא שתקה אנן נמי שתקינן דליכא לעז כיון דתקון דלא יחזיר –<br>However here</b> (by the אילונית) <b>if she is silent</b> (and does not claim her כתובה), <b>we will also be silent for there is no concern of לעז</b> by an אילונית <b>since</b> the חכמים <b>enacted that לא יחזיר –<br>ואי אתיא למתבע כתובה מצי אמר לה אדעתא דיהיבנא כתובה לא גירשתיך<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">It is only where she is claiming her כתובה that her first husband says to her שתיקותיך יפה מדיבוריך; he threatens her that he will be מוציא לעז. He will say that ‘if had known that you will have children and therefore I would need to pay the כתובה I never would have divorced you’, so the divorce is void; this is the לעז that he will be מוציא if she pressures him for the כתובה, otherwise (if she is quiet)  there will be no לעז since לא יחזיר.</i> –<br>And if</b> the אילונית <b>comes to claim her כתובה</b> payment, <b>he can tell her, ‘I did not divorce you with the intent a paying you the כתובה’ –</b><br>תוספות responds to another anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">In יבמות we were not מתקן לא יחזיר because we were not concerned for לעז, since we can say השתא הוא דברית (see footnote # 7), so here too by אילונית why was there a תקנה of לא יחזיר, let us say here too השתא הוא דברית?!</i><br><b>והתם דאיירי בעקרה דוקא שייך השתא הוא דברית –<br>For only there where she was (</b>merely) <b>a barren woman</b> (not an אילונית) <b>can we say השתא הוא דברית –<br>אבל הכא דאיירי בספק אילונית כדפירשנו<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה המוציא</i> לא שייך לומר השתא הוא דברית<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">If she was actually an אילונית she can never be healed (see footnote # 11), and if she was not an אילונית, why should we say השתא הוא דברית; we assume she was always healthy, and therefore there will be לעז.</i> –<br>However here</b> in our משנה <b>where we are discussing a ספק אילונית, as we explained, it is not possible to say השתא הוא דברית –</b><br>In summation; firstly in all cases there is only a concern of לעז, but not of ביטול הגט (since he divorced סתם). There are two ways in which לעז can be prevented; either by being מתקן that לא יחזיר (this is applicable in the cases of אילונית, etc. where the סברא of השתא הוא דברית is not applicable), or by the סברא of השתא הוא דברית (which is applicable by the four marriages), in which case there is no need to make a תקנה of לא יחזיר.<br>תוספות responds to an additional anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואפילו לרבנן דלא חיישי הכא לקלקולא פריך התם שפיר אנן מי שתקינן<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות explained previously that ר"פ when he asked אנן מי שתקינן meant to say why was there no תקנה made that לא יחזיר (so there will be no לעז [as a תקנה was made by אילונית according to ר"י]). However the רבנן maintain by אילונית that יחזיר (for they are not concerned), so what is ר"פ asking that there in יבמות there should be a תקנה of לא יחזיר; why should there be a תקנה there (by ד' נשים) more than here (by אילונית), according to the רבנן.</i> –<br>And even according to the רבנן</b> of our משנה <b>who are not concerned for a problem</b> (they maintain יחזיר and are not concerned for לעז), <b>nevertheless</b> the גמרא <b>there</b> in יבמות, <b>correctly asks, אנן מי שתקינן –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>דמודו רבנן התם דמשום דאין לה בנים גירשה שכבר נשאת לשנים ולא היו לה בנים<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">In our משנה where he is divorcing her because of a ספק אילונית (see previously) we assume that he is divorcing her with finality, whether she turns out to be an אילונית or not, therefore there will be no לעז; however there where she married twice without any children and then she married this third husband and bore him no children, he is divorcing her because he is sure that she cannot bear children. However if it turns out that  she can have children, he will be מוציא לעז and say if I knew you can have children I would never divorce you. [This all is in the הו"א before we say השתא הוא דברית; in which case there is no לעז.]</i> –<br>There</b> the <b>רבנן admit</b> that there is a concern of לעז, <b>since he divorced her because of no children, for she was already married to two people and she had no children –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר בסוף פרק קמא דנדה (דף יב,ב) גבי אשה שאין לה וסת<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">A וסת means a set time (or a set trigger) for the onset of her menstrual cycle.</i> פריך פשיטא דלא יחזיר –<br>And if you will say;</b> we learnt in a ברייתא <b>in the end of the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>נדה, regarding a woman who has no וסת,</b> that he needs to divorce her and never take her back; the גמרא there <b>asked; ‘it is obvious that לא יחזיר’</b>; why does the ברייתא need to teach it to us <b>–<br>ומשני לא צריכא דהדר איתקן מהו דתימא ליהדרה –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answered, it was necessary</b> to teach us this rule even in a case where, <b>she improved</b> and she now has a וסת, <b>I would think</b> perhaps <b>he may take her back –<br>קא משמע לן זימנין דאזלה ומינסבה כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">By this second husband she had a וסת, we are concerned that the first husband would say, ‘had I known this, I would never have divorced her, etc.’, ונמצא גט בטל ובניה ממזרים (as we said here in similar cases).</i> –</b><br>Therefore the ברייתא <b>teaches us</b> that he may not, <b>for sometimes she may go and marry, etc.</b> This concludes the citing of the גמרא. תוספות asks<br><b>ואמאי לא אמרינן התם השתא הוא דברית –<br>But why do we not say there</b> (as we said in יבמות) that <b>השתא הוא דברית;</b> in which case there is no לעז?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהתם כיון שנתרפאת הרי היה מועיל לה סם רפואה ולהכי מצי מקלקל לה –<br>And one can say that there</b> (by the וסת) <b>since she was healed, this shows that a medicine can cure her</b> (to give her a וסת), <b>therefore he can ruin her –<br>דאומר אילו הייתי יודע שיש רפואה לזו הייתי מבקש לה סם לרפואה:</b><br><b>For he will say, ‘if I would have known that this</b> (וסת problem) <b>can be healed I would have found for her this medicine to heal her’,</b> but the same cannot be said for the case in יבמות.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' נדה יב,ב ד"ה אילו who writes; וי"ל דהכא בקל ע"י סממנים תחזיר לוסתה ואיכא לעז טפי ולא דמי לעקרה דאין לה רפואה בקל לבא לידי בנים ומשמיא הוא דמסו לה. There is seemingly no easy cure for a barren woman; we can only say השתא הוא דברית that they healed her now מן השמים. Therefore by וסת he can claim, ‘had I known of this medicine I certainly would not have divorced her’, however by the childless woman he cannot claim that he would have done anything, because there is nothing basically that people can do; it is up to the שמים and one does not depend on miracles. See נחלת משה.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Where we can apply the logic of השתא הוא דברית (in יבמות) we do not make the תקנה of לא יחזיר; however where that סברא does not apply (by אילונית and וסת) we are מתקן לא יחזיר to prevent לעז. There may be a greater concern for לעז in יבמות than by אילונית.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks his question from our משנה of אילונית to the גמרא in יבמות regarding איהי לא שתקה אנן מי שתקינן.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> Seemingly תוספות could have asked the same question (also) on the previous משנה of המוציא את אשתו משום ש"ר ומשום נדר. Why did תוספות only ask his question on our משנה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

<b>ריש לקיש זבין נפשיה ללודאי—<i>Reish Lokish</i> sold himself to bandits</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates a somewhat bizarre story how ר"ל sold himself to לודאי, and eventually killed them all. תוספות explains how ר"ל came to do this.<br>------------------------------------<br><b>קודם שחזר למוטב<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דמסתמא לא היה מזלזל בעצמו כל כך:</b><br>This story <b>occurred before</b> ר"ל <b>returned for the better (he did תשובה), for presumably</b> after he did תשובה, <b>he would not have denigrated himself so much.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ר"ל sold himself to the לודאי before he was חוזר בתשובה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Was the זלזול that he sold himself or that he killed them?<br>2. How could תוספות say that this happened before he was חוזר למוטב,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> the גמרא relates immediately after this story regarding the death of ר"ל, so seemingly this was in his later years?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See חי' מהריעב"ץ.</i>
