<b>לא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרא the text reads; לעולם אימא לך בעלמא קסברי ר' יהודה ור"ש קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי .</i> דכולי עלמא קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי—No; for all</b> agree <b>acquisition of the fruit is like acquisition of the body</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a ברייתא in which there was a מחלוקת between ר' יהודה ור' שמען and ר' מאיר. The גמרא initially assumed that they argue whether קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי (the view of ר"מ), or לאו כקנין הגוף דמי (the view of ר"י ור"ש). רב נחמן בר יצחק rejected this assumption saying that it is possible that all agree (even ר"י [ור"ש]) that קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי. Our תוספות qualifies this approach of רנב"י.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>דיחויא בעלמא הוא –<br>This is merely</b> an attempted <b>rejection</b> of the contention of the גמרא that whether קנין פירות is כקנין הגוף דמי or not, is a מחלוקת תנאים –<br><b>דרבי יהודה אית ליה בהחובל (בבא קמא דף צ,א) גבי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The תורה writes concerning one’s עבד כנעני that if the master hit him and killed him the master is חייב מיתה. However if the עבד did not die immediately but lived יום או יומים (for a twenty-four hour period) and then died, the owner is not חייב מיתה. However if anyone else (not the master) kills this עבד he is חייב מיתה even if the עבד lived for twenty four hours (as long as he died because of the initial wound). In a case where the master of an עבד sold his עבד, but made up with the buyer that for the next thirty days this עבד (which now belongs to the buyer (the new master)) should still work for the seller (the first master). The new master has a קנין הגף in this עבד (he owns him) and the original master has only a קנין פירות in this עבד (the עבד only works for him, but does not belong to him). The question is which master has the exemption of יום או יומים. According to ר"י, only the new master has the exemption of יום או יומים (if the new master killed him), since he has a קנין הגוף in this עבד, however if the first master killed him he does not have the exemption of יום או יומים, since he is not his master (for קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי). It is evident that ר"י maintains לאו כקנין הגוף דמי; not like רנב"י says here in our גמרא. </i> דין יום או יומים דלאו כקנין הגוף דמי :</b><br><b>For ר"י maintains in</b> פרק <b>החובל, regarding the rule of ‘a day or two days’ that</b> קנין פירות <b>is not like קנין הגוף.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ר"י maintains קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>When the גמרא here wanted to say לימא כתנאי, why did it not cite the מחלוקת between ר"מ ור"י regarding יום או יומים where the גמרא there states clearly that ר"מ maintains כקנין הגוף דמי, and ר"י maintains לאו כקנין הגוף דמי?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות כה,ב ד"ה ר"י [TIE footnote # 23].</i>

<b>אי לאו דאמר רבי יוחנן קנין פירות כולי—Were it not that <i>Rabi Yochonon</i> said; acquisition of the fruits, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבי יוחנן maintains that brothers who divided up their estate are considered as if they are buyers who bought out their brothers for their share.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">When two brothers inherit their father’s estate and then divide it, we can either assume that they are יורשים and each son took his share which rightfully belongs to him (this will be called יש ברירה), or we can say (the view of ר' יוחנן) that we are not sure which share belongs to which son (אין ברירה), rather when dividing the estate the two brothers agree that whichever portion falls to each one, they agree to relinquish their right in the part which the other brother took, in exchange that the other brother will relinquish his part in which he took. In short they are bartering or exchanging their portions which is the equivalent of buying and selling. If we make this assumption they will need to return the fields to each other on יובל (since they ‘bought it’ from each other) and make a new division. None of the brothers who inherit are considered true owners of the fields since they only have a קנין פירות in it.</i> The גמרא said that if ר' יוחנן would not maintain קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי we could not find anyone who could bring ביכורים unless he was a חד בר חד עד יהושע.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This means he was a sole heir and his father was a sole heir etc. up until יהושע so there never was any sharing of the inheritance. However when there are multiple heirs they are all לקוחות and only have a קנין פירות in the property and if קנין פירות is no like קנין הגוף, no one can say (regarding his property) אשר נתת לי (since he does not own it; he only has a קנין פירות).</i> Our תוספות reconciles these two הלכות (of האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן and קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי) according to how we rule.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה רבינו תם ואנו איך מצאנו ידינו ורגלינו –<br>The ר"ת asked but how can ‘we find our hands and feet’</b> to reconcile these two rulings –<br><b>דקיימא לן כריש לקיש דלאו כקנין הגוף דמי כדאמרינן בריש החולץ<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ל and ר"י are referencing the משנה which states that if a father wrote over his assets to his son מהיום ולאחר מיתה, in which case the son owns the גוף הקרקע and the father owns the פירות (until he dies), and neither can sell the property while they are both alive. In a case where the son sold it while the father was alive; ר"י maintains the it is not sold even after the father died since קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי the son had no right to sell it. ר"ל, however maintains that it is a valid sale, since קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי, so the buyer can keep it after the father (who currently has the right to eat פירות) dies. This is one of three cases where we rule like ר"ל against ר"י. </i> (יבמות דף לו,ב) –<br>For we have established</b> the הלכה is <b>like ר"ל</b> that קנין פירות is <b>not like קנין הגוף, as</b> the גמרא <b>states in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>החולץ –<br>וקיימא לן נמי דבדאורייתא אין ברירה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling regarding האחין שחלקו whether they are יורשין or לקוחות depends respectively whether יש ברירה or אין ברירה, and since we rule אין ברירה the ruling is also that האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן (see footnote # 1).</i> –<br>And we have also established that</b> regarding <b>דאורייתא</b> issues the rule is <b>אין ברירה.</b><br>תוספות offers various proofs that we maintain אין ברירה בדאורייתא <b>–<br>דבסוף מסכת ביצה (דף לח,א) פסקינן כרבי אושעיא –<br>For in the end of מסכת ביצה we rule like ר"א</b> that בדאורייתא אין ברירה –<br><b>ורב נחמן דקיימא לן (כתובות יג,א) כוותיה בדיני קאמר בריש פרק ב' דקדושין (דף מב,ב) –<br>And</b> regarding <b>ר"נ, whose rulings we follow in monetary issues, states in the beginning of the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>קדושין –<br>האחים שחלקו הרי הן כלקוחות פחות משתות<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">When buying or selling, if the price is les than a sixth more or less than the market price, the sale is valid (for people forgo such a small difference). In any even we see that ר"נ maintains that the אחים are לקוחות and all the laws of buying and selling apply to them.</i> נקנה מקח –<br>The brothers who divided</b> an estate <b>are considered like לקוחות</b> in this regard [as well] that if the assessment <b>was</b> off <b>less than a sixth, the sale is accomplished –<br>ופסקינן נמי בהמוכר את הבית (בבא בתרא דף סה,א) דאין להן דרך זה על זה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that there was two fields adjacent to each other; an outer field by the road side and an inner field, which has no direct access to a road except via the outer field. The son’s divided the two fields. The one who received the inner field has no claim of right of way to go from the road to his field via his brother’s outer field (even though their father obviously did that). The owner of the inner field must purchase his right of way from his brother (the outer field).</i> –<br>And in</b> פרק <b>המוכר את הבית we also rule that</b> brothers who divided the estate <b>have no</b> claim of right of <b>way, one on the other;</b> the reason is <b>–<br>דמוכר בעין רעה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The מהרש"ל amends this to read 'יפה' (instead of רעה). See מהרש"א.</i> מוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">We assume that the brothers, when dividing, are really exchanging their shares in the respective fields. The owner of the inner field שמעון is selling the owner of the outer field ראובן all his interests in the outer field, in turn that ראובן is selling to שמען all his interests in the inner field. We say that שמעון is selling his share to ראובן בעין יפה, that he is giving שמעון everything in the outer field, including giving up the right of way to go from the road to the inner field through the outer field.</i> אלמא<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">What is relevant to us is that we consider the division as a מכירה; buying and selling, meaning that האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן</i> לקוחות הן<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">In any event it is obvious that we rule קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי and we also rule האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן, so we have this (same) problem (like ר' יוחנן) how can anyone bring ביכורים?!</i> –<br>For one who sells, does so with a ‘(bad) [good] eye’; it is evident</b> that אחים שחלקו <b>are לקוחות.</b><br>תוספות addresses various challenges to his assertion that we maintain לקוחות הן:<br><b>והא דפסקינן בפרק בית כור<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is when two brothers divided their father’s estate, and then their father’s creditor took away one field (from ראובן), for his debt. The rule according to רב is that the original division is nullified, and they have to redivide all the assets which are left in the estate that the מלוה did not take (even the share which שמעון took). The גמרא explains the reasoning of רב is because he maintains that האחין שחלקו יורשין הן (therefore the obligation of paying the debt is on [the property of] both brothers equally). See the רשב"ם there ד"ה יורשין וד"ה כלקוחות for a more detailed explanation.</i> (שם דף קז,א) כרב דאמר בטלה מחלוקת<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא concludes there that the הלכה is according to רב, since יורשין הן. This contradicts the which תוספות maintains that לקוחות הן.</i> –<br>And regarding this which we rule in פרק בית כור like רב who maintains the division is nullified –</b><br>תוספות replies:<br><b>לאו משום דיורשין הוו אלא משום דהוו כלקוחות<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן. The בע"ח took away sראובן' field. This field belongs to ראובן because שמעון sold it to him (in exchange for his field which ראובן sold to him). ראובן comes now to שמעון saying the field you sold me was taken away from me. In a regular case if a בע"ח takes away a field from a לוקח and there is no אחריות (the seller did not guarantee the sale), the לוקח loses. Here too if we consider האחרים שחלקו as לקוחות שלא באחריות, then ראובן has no recourse; he bought a field and it was taken away from him. However if there was אחריות, so ראובן can go back to the seller and make him pay for this field which was taken from him. In our case also we assume (according to רב) that they are כלקוחות באחריות, so if the מלוה took away sראובן' field, שמעון has to make good (by redividing all the assets anew).</i> באחריות –</b><br>The reason of רב why בטלה מחלוקת <b>is not because they are יורשין, but rather because they</b> are considered <b>as buying with a guarantee –<br>ויורשין דקאמר רב לאו יורשין ממש אלא כלומר כיורשין<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The reason רב says יורשין and not לקוחות באחריות, for if it was (merely) like לקוחות באחריות then שמעון would be able to pay off ראובן for the value of the field taken away by the מלוה. However רב maintains that here they are like יורשין so they need to divide anew )see תוס' ב"ק ט,א ד"ה כיורשים) .</i> –<br>And this which רב says</b> that they are <b>יורשין, it does not mean actual יורשין, but rather it means like יורשין –<br>וברוב ספרים גרסינן הכי בפרק קמא דבבא קמא (דף ט,א) –<br>And in most text in the first פרק of ב"ק it reads this way;</b> כיורשין (but not יורשין).<br>תוספות addresses a related contradiction:<br><b>ומיהו רב אסי דאמר יחלוקו<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This is in this same case where the בע"ח collected the field from one of the brothers.</i> ומספקא ליה אי יורשין הוו היינו יורשין ממש –<br>However רב אסי who maintains that they divide</b> the loss, <b>for he is unsure whether they are</b> כלקוחות or whether they are <b>יורשין,</b> there it means <b>actual יורשין</b> (not כלקוחות באחריות) –<br><b>כדמוכח בפרק יש בכור<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The case there in the משנה is when a woman gave birth to her firstborn twins and the father died before he performed a פדיון הבן. There is a dispute between ר"מ (who maintains that the sons are not obligated in פדה"ב), and ר"י (who maintains that they are obligated).  </i> (בכורות דף מח,א) גבי<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there establishes the מחלוקת in a case where the entire inheritance was exactly five סלעים. We assume that both ר"מ ור"י agree with רב אסי that the inheritance is considered half ירושה and half a purchase. We also agree that an oral loan (like the obligation of a פדה"ב) can be collected from the יורשין but not the לקוחות. Since their inheritance is מחצה יורשים ומחצה לקוחות, therefore only two and a half סלעים (or חצי חמש סלעים) is collectible. ר"מ maintains חמש ולא חצי חמש (therefore they are פטור), while ר"י maintains חמש ואפילו חצי חמש (therefore they are חייב). See there for more details. It is obvious (from the underlined) that יורשין there must mean יורשין ממש.</i> חמש ולא חצי חמש –<br>As is evident in פרק יש בכור regarding, ‘five but not five halves’.</b> On the other hand <b>–<br>ורבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן לאו היינו רב אסי<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">רב אסי maintains האחין שחלקו ספק יורשין הוו however רבי אסי maintain לקוחות הן.</i> –<br>ר"א אמר ר"י maintains האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן,</b> which would seem to contradict this which רב אסי said מספקא ליה אי יורשין הוו. We must answer that רבי אסי <b>is not the same as רב אסי –<br>אי נמי הא דידיה הא דרביה –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say; <b>one is his ruling</b> (מספקא ליה אי יורשין הוו), <b>and the other</b> (לקוחות הן) <b>is his teacher’s view</b> (ר"א אמר ר' יוחנן), so there is no contradiction.<br>תוספות discusses an additional contradiction:<br><b>והא דפסקינן בנדרים בפרק השותפין (דף מו,ב) כרבי אליעזר בן יעקב –<br>And regarding this that we rule like ראב"י in</b> מסכת <b>נדרים in פרק השותפין –<br>בשותפין שנדרו הנאה זה מזה דמותר ליכנס לחצר<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The issue there is when one partner enters the חצר, is he entering his part or his partner’s part. This will depend whether יש ברירה (so we can say that he is entering his part) or אין ברירה (in which case he is not necessarily entering his part). ראב"י maintains that each one may enter; indicating that he maintains יש ברירה. However if we maintains יש ברירה, the rule should be האחין שחלקו יורשין הן (not לקוחות הן as תוספות maintains). How can we reconcile that the הלכה is like ראב"י that יש ברירה and still maintains לקוחות הן?!</i> –<br>In connection</b> to the case of <b>partners who vowed not to derive benefit from each other,</b> the view of ראב"י is <b>that they may enter into a courtyard</b> which belongs to both of them –<br>תוספות responds; the הלכה indeed is like ראב"י; however –<br><b>לאו מטעמיה דטעמיה משום ברירה כדמוכח<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there compares another מחלוקת between ראב"י ורבנן to the מחלוקת of חצר השותפין, that in both cases the reason of ראב"י is because he maintains יש ברירה.</i> בפרק הפרה (בבא קמא דף נא,ב) –<br>It is not because of his reason, for his reason</b> for permitting them to enter into the חצר <b>is on account of</b> יש <b>ברירה as is evident in פרק הפרה;</b> that however is not the reason we rule like ראב"י –<br><b>אלא משום דויתור<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">ויתור here means forgoing or overlooking one receiving a minor benefit (even though you vowed that he should not benefit from you). The benefit received by walking on my ground is insignificant and people generally do not include this when they are מודר הנאה.</i> הוא כרבינא בחזקת הבתים (בבא בתרא דף נז,ב) ומותר במודר הנאה –<br>However</b> the reason we rule like ראב"י that they may enter the חצר השותפין <b>is because</b> <b>of ויתור as רבינא states in</b> פרק <b>ח"ה, and</b> ויתור <b>is permissible</b> even by a <b>מודר הנאה.</b><br>In summation; תוספות has proven the we maintains האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן, and קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי, so how can we reconcile this with the bringing of ביכורים.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דדוקא בההיא לחודה בהכותב לבנו מהיום ולאחר מיתה קיימא לן כריש לקיש<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> –<br>And one can say; that it is specifically in that case alone, where he wrote over his assets to his son מהיום ולאחר מיתה, that we rule like ר"ל –<br>דלאו כקנין הגוף דמי משום דאבא לגבי ברא אחולי מחיל –<br>That</b> קנין פירות <b>is not like קנין הגוף, because a father in regards to his son<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Really it should not be a sale, since the father has a קנין פירות in this field, and generally קנין פירות is כקנין הגוף, however in this case the father out of caring for his son will be מוחל his right to void the sale and agrees that the sale should be effective.</i> gives up</b> his rights that he has in the גוף on account of his פירות –<br>תוספות proves that this is a valid reason why here there is this exception:<br><b>דהכי מצריך להו בפרק יש נוחלין<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">There the גמרא cites the above mention מחלוקת between ר"י ור"ל regarding the son selling it while his father is alive. The גמרא asked but ר"י ור"ל argue elsewhere regarding whether קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי, in a case where a field was sold only לפירות, where ר"י maintains מביא וקורא (since פירות is כקנין הגוף) and ר"ל maintains מביא ואינו קורא since לאו כקנין הגוף דמי; so why repeat the same מחלוקת twice.</i> (שם דף קלו,ב) לתרי מילי דריש לקיש דהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">The case of ביכורים (see footnote # 24).</i> ודהתם<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">The case of מכר הבן בחיי האב (see footnote # 3).</i> –<br>For this is how</b> the גמרא <b>in פרק יש נוחלין</b> explains <b>the necessity<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">ר"י explains that even though generally קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי, nevertheless it was necessary to state the case of מכר הבן, since I may have though that in that case the sale is valid (as ר"ל rules) since the father is מוחל for his son. We see that even ר"י concedes that by the case of מכר הבן that the rule could be that it is a valid מכירה. We take it a step further and use the סברא of ר"י that indeed in this case it is a valid מכירה, but not because קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף, but only since the father is מוחל even though that קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי.</i> for ר"ל</b> stating <b>his two rules here and there –<br>אבל בעלמא קיימא לן דכקנין הגוף דמי<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore even though we maintain that האחים שחלקו לקוחות הן (they only have a קנין פירות), nevertheless since כקנין הגוף דמי they are מביא וקורא.</i> –<br>But generally we establish</b> the rule <b>that</b> קנין פירות <b>כקנין הגוף דמי –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואף על גב דקאמר הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">On the very bottom of this עמוד.</i> רבא קרא ומתניתא מסייעי ליה לריש לקיש לרבא לא סבירא ליה הכי –<br>And even though that רבא states here that the פסוק and the ברייתא support ר"ל</b> (that by קנין פירות the rule is מביא ואינו קורא, since it is לאו כקנין הגוף דמי), nevertheless <b>רבא does not agree to</b> ר"ל that לאו כקנין כגוף דמי –<br><b>דאם לא כן לא מצא ידיו ורגליו דרבא סבר לקוחות הן<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">רבא was qualifying the ruling of רב נחמן that האחין שחלקו לקוחות הן regarding אונאה (of a שתות). רבא stated that this ruling is only if he did not make the assessor a שליח. It is apparent that he agrees in principle with ר"נ that they are לקוחות.</i> בפרק ב' דקדושין (דף מב,ב) –</b><br><b>For if</b> you will <b>not</b> say so (but rather that he agrees with ר"ל that לאו כקנין הגוף דמי),<b></b> רבא <b>will not find ידיו ורגליו, since רבא maintains in the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>קדושין that</b> האחין שחלקו <b>לקוחות הן –</b><br>תוספות will prove that even though רבא states קרא ומתניתא מסייע ליה לר"ל, nevertheless רבא does not necessarily agree with ר"ל:<br><b>ובפרק הזהב (בבא מציעא דף מח,א) קאמר רבא נמי גבי משיכה מפורשת מן התורה –<br>And in פרק הזהב,</b> where <b>רבא also states regarding</b> the view of ר"ל <b>that</b> קנין <b>משיכה is explicit<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">ר' יוחנן maintains that מה"ת money is קונה, while ריש לקיש maintains that משיכה is קונה מה"ת.</i> in the תורה –<br>קרא ומתניתא מסייעי ליה לריש לקיש –<br>The פסוק and the ברייתא support ר"ל</b> that משיכה is קונה מה"ת –<br><b>אף על גב דרבא קאי כרבי יוחנן בר מתלת<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">This statement was made by רבא there that הלכתא כוותיה דר"ל בהני תלת, but not in any other מחלוקת.</i> (יבמות דף לו,א) –<br>Even though that רבא</b> always <b>agrees with ר"י except for three</b> cases where we rule like ר"ל, we see that even though he say קרא ומתניתא מסייע ליה לר"ל, nevertheless he disagrees with ר"ל and maintains מעות קונה מה"ת like ר"י. We can say the same regarding קנין פירות.<br>This is תוספות first answer that we maintain לקוחות הן; however we also maintain קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי therefore the יורשין may be מביא וקורא.<br>תוספות now offers an alternate solution:<br><b>ועוד יש לומר דדוקא רבי יוחנן אית ליה דמחזירין זה לזה ביובל –<br>An additionally one can say; it is specifically only ר"י who maintains that</b> the brothers must <b>return the properties to each other on יובל</b> and redivide them since לאו כקנין הגוף דמי –<br><b>אבל שאר אמוראים סברי אף על גב דלקוחות הן אין מחזירין –<br>However the rest of the אמוראים maintain that even though לקוחות הן</b> (since מה"ת אין ברירה), nevertheless <b>אין מחזירין</b> זל"ז ביובל –<br><b>דמכר הוא דאמר רחמנא דליהדר ירושה ומתנה לא והשתא אתי שפיר<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">Even though אחין לקוחות הן but since אין מחזירין זל"ז they have a קנין הגוף so whether we maintain that קנין פירות כקנין הגוף or not it makes no difference they are always מביא וקורא since they have a קנין הגוף (for אין מחזירין). This answer removes the slight difficulty that רבא stated קרא ומתניתא מסייע ליה לר"ל.</i> –<br>For</b> only <b>by a sale did the תורה state that it must be returned, but not by ירושה ומתנה so therefore it works out –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר לרבי יוחנן דמחזירין זה לזה ביובל תו לא משכחת שדה אחוזה<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">There are different laws prescribed in the תורה, whether one is מקדיש a שדה אחזוה (a field which is inherited for generations) or a שדה מקנה a field which one bought (to keep until יובל).</i> –<br>And if you will say; according to ר"י that the</b> heirs <b>return</b> the properties <b>to each other on יובל, you will never find</b> a case <b>of a שדה אחוזה –<br>דכולהו הוו שדה מקנה ולא תתחלק לכהנים<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">If no one redeems a שדה אחוזה from הקדש, the rule is that when יובל comes the field is given to the כהנים of that משמר (the owner has the right to be מקדיש if for posterity since it is his completely). However if no one redeems a שדה מקנה from הקדש, when יובל arrives it goes back to the original owner (for the buyer of the שדה מקנה only has a קנין פירות in the field until יובל; he cannot be מקדיש it forever).</i> –<br>For all</b> fields <b>are</b> considered as a <b>שדה מקנה and it will not be divided amongst the כהנים –<br>וגם יפדוה בשוויה ולא בית זרע חומר שעורים<sup class="footnote-marker">36</sup><i class="footnote">בית זרע חומר שעורים is the area needed to seed a כור (thirty סאה) of barley. One who is מקדיש a שד אחזוה can redeem it for this amount proportionately; if he has a field that is half a בית חומר שעורים, he redeems it for twenty five שקלים, if his field is two בית חומר שעורים he redeems it for a hundred שקלים. This is a price fixed in the תורה (in ויקרא [בחקותי] כז,טז), for one who redeems his field immediately after יובל, regardless of the actual value of the field. However when one is מקדיש a שדה מקנה, it is redeemed for its market value.  </i> בחמשים שקל כסף<sup class="footnote-marker">37</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is asking that the whole rule of שדה אחוזה will (almost) never happen according to ר"י, since מחזירין זל"ז ביובל it is considered a שדה  מקנה.</i> –<br>And also it will be redeemed</b> from הקדש <b>for its worth, but not</b> according to the assessment <b>of בית זרע חומר שעורים for fifty silver שקלים –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר כיון דתחת זו תחזור לו אחרת לא קרינן בה שדה מקנה אלא שדה אחוזה:<br>And one can say; since that instead of this</b> field which he received from his father’s estate, <b>another field</b> from his father’s estate <b>will be returned to him; it is not considered a שדה מקנה, but rather a שדה אחוזה!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Generally קנין פירות כקנין הגוף except where the father (who has קנין פירות) is מוחל to the son (who has קנין הגוף). Alternately, although we maintain לקוחות הן, nevertheless אין מחזירין זל"ז ביובל.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why according to ר' יוחנן that since קנין פירות כקנין הגוף one may bring ביכורים, even though לקוחות הן, so we should apply it to שדה אחוזה as well that since כקנין הגוף דמי it is considered a שדה אחוזה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br><b>הדרן עלך השולח</b><br><b>We shall return to you</b><br><b>פרק השולח</b><br><b>**************</b><br><b>יחזקנו שוכן שחקים</b><br><b>שגמרנו לפרש ארבעה פרקים</b><br><b>מהמביא עד השולח</b><br><b>בעזרת מוחל וסולח</b>

<b>Happy is the man who always fears:</b> In the chapter [entitled] HaRoeh, we say [that Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose] saw that a certain man was afraid. He said to him, "You are a sinner, as it is written, 'The sinners in Zion are afraid.'" But [the other] challenged from the verse here; and it was established to be about matters of Torah, such that he worries to not forget his studies and always reviews his learning. And here too, he brings [this verse] about these events in which they trusted in their great wealth and tranquility to embarrass Bar Kamtza and to stand up to Caesar's daughter, whereas they should have been afraid and worried about punishment. And that is not similar to someone who is afraid for nothing.

Daf 56a



Line 1

<b>A threefold (<i>tilta</i>) calf:</b> As in, "and <i>shalishim</i> (officers) upon all of them" (Exodus 14:7); and like, "a threefold (<i>meshuleshet</i>) calf and a threefold (<i>meshulash </i>) ram" (Genesis 15:9) - the explanation of which is, healthy and good. But there are some that explain it as the third in the womb. But that is not likely, since we say in the chapter [entitled] Arba Mitot (Sanhedrin 65b) that a threefold (<i>tilta</i>) calf was created for them. And it is not like the one who wants to explain that it has grown a third. For behold, at the end of the chapter [entitled] Rabbi Eliezer (Shabbat 136a), it said, "He made a threefold (<i>tilta</i>) calf for them on the seventh day" - its explanation being, the seventh day from its birth. (And see further [in] Tosafot [on] Bekhorot 19b, s.v. DeHach SheLo, etc.)

<b>If you are not a king, Jerusalem would not be handed over into your hands:</b> Even though it was not yet handed over into his hands until Titus arrived - since he already was besieging it three years and there was a famine, it was nevertheless as if it was already handed over.

<b>And picked at his brain for seven years:</b> He did not become a <i>tereifa</i> (one who has a wound or condition that will lead to his death within twelve months) with this. For it entered through his nostril and did not pierce the membrane [of his brain]. Moreover (alternatively), there is a distinction between [what causes the condition of being a <i>tereifa</i> in] people and animals, as I explained in the first chapter of Eruvin (Tosafot on Eruvin 7a, s.v. Kegon).

[Tosfot quotes the Gemara:] "for whatever [amount of] money that they demand." [He was legally allowed to do this because where] there is a threat to life, we redeem the captives for more than their value. Alternatively, [he was allowed to redeem the baby for more than its worth] because [it possessed] great wisdom.

<b>אם יכול לנתקו ולהביאו כולי—If he is not capable of retrieving it and bringing it, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא is discussing a case where a man gave his wife a גט which was attached to a thread that the man was holding. The rule is that if the man can retrieve the גט from the woman by pulling on the thread, the woman is not divorced<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It is (seemingly) understood that when he releases the thread she is divorced. The case in the גמרא is if the גט was destroyed before the husband released the thread. </i>, for there is no כריתות; no complete separation between the man and the woman. However if the man cannot retrieve the גט then it is a valid גט. תוספות will discuss the actual details of this case.<br>-------------------<br><b>נראה דלא מיירי כשהיתה ידה פתוחה ולאחר שנתן הגט בידה קפצה ידה –</b><br><b>It seems that we are not discussing</b> a case <b>where</b> initially <b>her hand was open</b> (and at that time the husband was able to retrieve the גט from her hand), <b>and after</b> the husband <b>placed the גט in her hand she closed her hand tightly</b> (which made it impossible for the husband to retrieve the גט) –<br><b>דאם כן אפילו אין יכול להביאו אצלו אינה מגורשת –</b><br><b>For if this were</b> the case, then <b>even if</b> the husband <b>cannot retrieve</b> the גט (since she is holding on to it tightly), <b>she is</b> still <b>not divorced.</b> The reason for this is, that –<br><b>כיון דבשעת נתינה היה יכול להביאו אצלו –</b><br><b>Since at the time of the giving of the גט</b> (the moment when the divorce is to become effective) the husband <b>could have brought</b> the גט back <b>to him</b>. This is not considered a כריתות.<br><b>ומה שקופצת ידה אחר כך זה אינו עושה הבעל אלא היא –</b><br><b>And that what she subsequently closed her hand tightly</b> (and prevented him from retrieving the גט), this has no effect; for <b>the husband is not doing it; but rather she</b> is making it impossible for him to retrieve the גט. Any action that the women does to make the גט effective after the husband concluded his giving disqualifies the גט –<br><b>והוה ליה כמו טלי גיטיך מעל גבי קרקע ואינו גט –</b><br><b>For this is like</b> the case where the husband says to his wife, <b>‘take your גט from the ground’; where it is not a</b> valid <b>גט.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The reason is that the husband did not give his wife the גט. He merely placed it on the ground. A גט becomes effective when it enters the possession of the women. Here it entered her possession through her action (of picking it up from the ground), not through any action of the husband. The תורה requires that it should be ונתן בידה; that the husband make the גט effective. Similarly here too, when he gave her the גט it was not a valid נתינה, for since he could retrieve it (with the thread), it is not considered כריתות. It can become כריתות only when she clasps her hand tightly shut. However then she is making the כריתות and not the husband; which makes the גט invalid. It would seem that she is not divorced even after the husband released the thread.</i></b> It is therefore not understood how this rule of יכול לנתקו אצלו is applicable.<br>תוספות explains:<br><b>אלא נראה לרבינו יצחק דמיירי שכבר היתה ידה קפוצה והוא תחב הגט לתוך ידה –</b><br><b>But rather is seems to the ר"י that we are discussing</b> a case <b>where her hand was tightly closed and he stuffed the גט into her</b> (closed) <b>hand –<br>ואם תחב כל כך בחוזק עד שאינו יכול להביאו אצלו הויא מגורשת –</b><br><b>So if he stuffed it</b> in her hand <b>so tightly that he cannot retrieve if back</b> (with the thread) <b>then she is divorced.</b> In this case it was the husband who made the effective כריתות.<br><b>ורבינו תם מפרש דבידה פתוחה איירי שפיר –</b><br><b>And the ר"ת explains that we are discussing</b> a case where <b>indeed her hand was open (</b>and she never clasped it shut) and the meaning of –<br><b>ואם אינו יכול להביאו אצלו היינו כשהגט כבד ואם ימשוך אצלו תינתק המשיחה –</b><br><b>‘and if he cannot bring it</b> back <b>to him’ is that the גט is heavy</b> (relative to the strength of the thread) <b>and if he will pull</b> the thread <b>towards himself,</b> <b>the thread will tear.</b> Therefore it is a valid גט; for he gave it to her, and the reason he cannot retrieve it is because of its weight; but it has nothing to do with any action on her part.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">It seems that the ר"י and the ר"ת agree in principle. They are merely giving different examples of how אם אינו יכול לנתקו, it is a valid גט.</i><br>According to the abovementioned, תוספות continues with a practical הלכה ramification:<br><b>וצריך ליזהר שתהא יד האשה פתוחה עד שיניח כל הגט בידה –</b><br><b>And it is necessary that one be careful that the hand of the woman remains open until the entire גט is placed in her hand.</b> The woman should not close her hand until the husband placed the entire גט in her hand and released it completely –<br><b>דאם תקפוץ ידה בעוד שהבעל אוחז בראש הגט בידו לא הוי גט –</b><br><b>For if she will close her hand while the husband is</b> still <b>holding</b> the other <b>end</b> of the <b>גט in his hand</b> <b>it will not be a</b> valid <b>גט</b> (for at that point he is able to withdraw the גט to himself; which means that the כריתות is not yet effective) –<br><b>דהוי כמו גט בידה ומשיחה בידו –</b><br><b>For it will be considered</b> the same case <b>as ‘the גט is in her hand and the thread is in his hand’;</b> in which case we say that if he can withdraw the גט it is not a valid גט. Similarly his holding on to the other end of the גט is similar to holding on to the thread and since he can retrieve the גט she is not yet divorced. When she closes her hand and prevents him from retrieving the גט she is causing the כריתות, which as mentioned previously is not valid<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">However, when the woman’s hand remains open until the husband releases the גט (and cannot retrieve it anymore), the entire giving was accomplished by the husband as the הלכה requires. </i>.<br>תוספות offers a dissenting opinion:<br><b>ונראה דכשר דלא גרע מערק לה חרציה ושלפתו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See עח,א.</i> דהוי גט –</b><br><b>And it seems that</b> the גט <b>is כשר</b> (in the case where she closed her hand before he released his hand from the גט) <b>for it is not worse than</b> the case where the husband <b>extended his hip to her and she removed</b> the <sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The גט was placed between his belt and his hip.</i>גט, where the rule is that <b>it is a</b> valid <b>גט<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The extension of his hip to her is considered that he is giving her the גט.</i> –<br>אף על גב דביד הבעל להדק מתניו שלא תטול והמחמיר תבא עליו ברכה:</b><br><b>Even though the husband is capable of tightening</b> (his belt around) <b>his loins that she should not be able to take it<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It should be considered like גט בידה ומשיחה בידו. He gave her the גט (by extending his hip), but he can retrieve it from her (by tightening his belt).</i>;</b> and nevertheless it is כשר. The same will apply here where she closed her hand<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">It is not clear whether this ונראה כשר agrees or argues with the initial opinions of the ר"י ור"ת concerning משיחה בידו. It would appear that the ונראה כשר argues and only according to the ונראה דכשר is the woman divorced if she closed her hand before the husband released the גט. Others however maintain that even though that by גט בידה ומשיחה בידו the woman is not divorced if קפצה ידה, however by a regular גט (without a משיחה בידו) where the husband is holding the other end of the גט she is divorced. The difference is that by משיחה בידו the husband gave the entire גט to the woman, but she is not divorced since it is יכול לנתקו. When she closed her hands she made the כריתות, which is invalid. When the husband subsequently released the thread, it is a meaningless act, for he is not giving her a גט. However when the husband is holding the end of the גט, then even if the woman closes her hand, the act of גירושין is not completed yet, for the husband is still holding the גט. When he finally places the גט in her (closed) hand that it a valid נתינה. [We would have to make a similar distinction (if possible) between משיחה בידו and ערק לה חרציה. ודו"ק.]  </i>. However <b>the one that is stringent</b> and insists that the woman leave her hand open until the husband releases his hand, <b>a blessing should come upon him!</b>
